The game plan on the inside of the lid and the pieces fitted with magnets makes it possible to play even if it sways and bends, such as on a bus or a boat.

VETO consists of 400 different categories that each have three questions of different difficulty. On your turn you choose which question to answer, the higher the difficulty the higher the score. In addition, if someone else get a category you like, you can shout VETO! This means that you "steal" the category and have the opportunity to answer all the questions in that category, collect lots of points, while the opponent loses his turn.

name: Leap Frog
description:
Leap Frog is played on a 8x8 board.
A stone moves by jumping another stone(of any color)to the opposite empty space(orthogonal or diagonal).
Enemy stones jumped over are captured.
A player unable to move looses the game.

name: Jump Jack
description:
Jump Jack is played on a 7x5 square board.Each player starts with 5 stones(Soldiers) on the second row,a neutral stone(Jack)starts in the middle of the fourth row.
The Jack can only be moved by jumping over any other stones on the board.The Jack can jump over one or more stones in a straight line(orthogonal or diagonal)and can continue to jump,if possible(but it is not mandatory).
Soldiers can move one space in any direction or they can jump as the Jack.Soldiers cannot jump over the Jack.
Each player is allowed to have one soldier at his first row,and cannot move any stone to the opponent´s first row.
At each turn,each player can do just one ot the following:
1.Move a soldier one space;
2.Jump with one soldiers;
3.Jump with the Jack.
The player wins who gets the Jack to the opponent´s first row.

name: Mission Luna
description:
The game board shows the moon and an orbit. The astronauts are placed in the middle of the moon, a space ship is placed in orbit. Instead of dice, the players toss three coins (two 2 cent, one 1 cent). The space ship moves along the orbit according to the results (the orbit is marked with head or tails symbols). The astronauts can move the number of spaces corresponding to the number of different results (1/2/reverse side), so 1-3 fields. On the way, oxygen tokens can be collected which are needed to "wait in space" for the space ship. The first player to reach the space ship with both astronauts is the winner.

The game was published in Spielböxchen in October 2009.

name: Bidding on Sekigahara
description:
Conventional Sekigahara games uses some diplomatic system which makes solitaire play very difficult.
In this game, Nakamura tries to make a new type Sekigahara game suitable for solitaire.

The game mechanics is unique.
You must turn one card from the deck and follow the instruction. This procedure is repeated until you draw the card "Ieyasu moves". Then, the turn is finished after the movement of Ieyasu. This makes solitaire play easy. Because you must focus the current action described by the card and you never know what will happen next.

1 map
90 counters
16 cards

According to specification, this game can be finished within 2 hours.
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Hexagon Grid

name: Greedy Kingdoms Expansion Set: Treasure
description:
This is a small expansion set for Greedy Kingdoms, containing 18 new Upgrade cards and a bonus priest card (v 2.0)

Box blurb:
The two rival kingdoms had various treasures in their treasure houses, such as an ancient holy sword and a magic book sealed by a great sage. Desperate to build royal palaces faster than his rival, each of the two kings came to realize that his treasures would offer a wealth of advantages.
"I will use these treasures to build palaces even more quickly!"
Thus the fierce rivalry between the greedy kings became even fiercer
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Medieval
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Secret Unit Deployment, Set Collection, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Kalamees
description:
This is and old soviet union board game about fishing. This introduces fishes that live in Estonian part of soviet union (back in those days) and regulations and rules for fishing those fishes. It is not permitted to catch fishes under regulated size and like in life is in this game - the one to do so, will be fined. Catching fishes right size will give you an advantage on the game board.
The follows a story, like most games back from that time. The story starts with leaving home and finishes with getting back there. Winner is the one who caught most fishes. On the way you have obstacle like leaving your bag home or you broke your fishing rod! All this things will held you back while other players just keep catching the good fishes and moving towards the end. Very entertaining old board game.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Pick-up and Deliver, Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Greedy Kingdoms Promo Card: Scholar
description:
This is a promo card handed out by the designer when the game is bought on events. This card has only been distributed in Japan. It was also attached to the Treasure expansion pack when sold at Essen.

It's a 2 gold cost citizen card, the cost reduced to 1 gold if you have a Royal Palace. The Scholar's effect is gaining you 1 Honour each turn, if you have 4 Buildings or more in your kingdom.

name: End of the World
description:
Co-op zombie games where the players try to survive in a zombie infested small town. Together, they must band and try to complete their affected mission. The board is grid-based, where players move one square at a time. They can enter building at do search check to find: useful items, scared survivors, adrenaline points or bad bad things. The longer the game gets going, the faster and hungrier the zombies become, giving at hectic ending to this fun co-op game.

The Zombies uses a basic AI, controlled by everyone so it's all the players against the board.
mechanics: Area Movement, Cooperative Game, Modular Board

name: Concerto
description: This game is played with a standard deck of cards. Partners play cards face up till they played five cards and then score according to how good those cards are as a Poker hand. Then the other partnership does the same.

name: Soccard
description:
A soccer themed real-time card game for 2 to 8 players ages 8 and up.
PLAY SOCCER WITH CARDS
Soccard is an addictive and exciting action-packed strategy game with two competing teams trying to reach the opposing goal and score.

AN EASY TO LEARN GAME
Players on each team move along a field 11 numbers long and 3 colors wide.
Each side races to move the ball to opposite ends of the field by playing sequentially-numbered cards.
Players pass, save or score goals with the use of action cards.

A NON-STOP ACTION FRENZY GAME
Wait for no one.
A game with no turns, only speed, reflexes and control.
A game where action meets reaction and swiftness goes against cunning.

A GAME OF INFINITE POSSIBILITIES
A customizable system where you can change every single element of gameplay.
You can play right out of the box or add expansion cards to build the perfect dream team.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Card Game, Real-time, Sports
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Hand Management, Simulation, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Nachbarn: das Spiel
description: The players have to create scenes for the TV series "Neighbours". The scenes are assembled from sentence fragments which are printed on cards. The cards are laid out on fields with matching colors (which helps creating grammatically correct sentences). Scoring cards reward certain moves and decide the winner at the end of the game.
categories: Movies / TV / Radio theme, Word Game

name: Empire of Rome 27 BC - 284 AD
description:
In the second century of the Christian era, the Empire of Rome comprehended the fairest part of the earth, and the most civilised portion of mankind. The frontiers of that extensive monarchy were guarded by ancient renown and disciplined valour. The gentle but powerful influence of laws and manners had gradually cemented the union of the provinces. Their peaceful inhabitants enjoyed and abused the advantages of wealth and luxury. The image of a free constitution was preserved with decent reverence: the Roman senate appeared to possess the sovereign authority, and devolved on the emperors all the executive powers of government. During a happy period (A.D. 98-180) of more than fourscore years, the public administration was conducted by the virtue and abilities of Nerva, Trajan, Hadrian, and the two Antonines. It is the design of this...to describe the prosperous condition of their empire; and afterwards, from the death of Marcus Antoninus, to deduce the most important circumstances of its decline and fall; a revolution which will ever be remembered, and is still felt by the nations of the earth.

The Decline and Fall of the Roman Empire

Edward Gibbon, 1776

Empire of Rome is a game depicting the internal politics and wars of Imperial Rome from 27 BC to 284 AD. Players control factions, each one controlling senators, consuls, proconsuls, provinces, legions, fleets, courtiers and trade concessions. One faction controls the Caesar, who can reward and punish, wage war and make peace and takes the cream of Rome’s wealth. Every hand is raised against him and to claim victory he must survive assassinations, rebellions and the attentions of the Praetorian Guard. Foreign wars interfere with internal politics, the expansion of the empire leads to great glory and renown, but Germanic tribes and Parthian kings may invade at any time and the generals sent to repel them may march on Rome to claim the imperial purple. If the players place the good of the Rome before their own ambitions it may expand beyond its historical limits, if not they could precipitate its premature decline and fall.
categories: Ancient, Negotiation, Political, Print & Play, Wargame
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Movement Points, Point to Point Movement, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Simulation, Variable Player Powers, Voting

name: Legions of Steel Alien Source Book
description:
(from the back of the book)
A GALAXY BESIEGED...

This new supplement to the LOS universe will introduce you to the Black Empire, the Infranites and the Fantasians. These are three of the many interstellar races which are at odds with the Legions of Steel. Provided in these pages is an overview of each race's physiology, culture and history. In addition we have provided you with six new scenarios, several useful charts and tables and complete descriptions of many new fighting units and their painting schemes.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Miniatures, Science Fiction

name: Hammer's Anvils
description:
From the Web site:

The second volume in the Hammer's Slammers game system is here! Hammer's Anvils contains rule enhancements to the basic system in Handbook 1, and optional rules like:

Separate Detachments (for multi-detachment forces);
The Whites of Their Eyes (range bands);
The Big Guns (on- and off-table artillery);
Mounting Chaos (loss of TU's and what it does to leadership);
Overkill (why big guns do more damage);
Courage Under Fire (varying suppression on infantry, based on quality); and
A Leader of Men (using leadership to remove suppression).

Included are rules for: Mortars and MLRS systems, mines and countermeasures, spotting with snipers, top and bottom vehicle defensive arcs, and what happens if an APC "brews up," plus enhanced weapon charts, Tactical Unit Points Costs, and examples of platoon sized detachments.

Finally, there are two appendices (names and numbers of Slammers vehicles and a Time-line for the Slammers universe) plus 10 pages of descriptions of the colour plates, and errata for the first volume.

From the Web site:

Hammer's Anvils is an expansion for the Hammer's Slammers Handbook, containing new optional rules and detailed organisations for other forces, such as Broglie's Legion, The Thunderbolt Division, The Zaporoskiye Brigade, and the Compagnie de Barthe, with vehicle types and development, organisational strengths, and so on.

Background info on other units includes: Heliodorus Regiment, The Wolverines, Harris' Commandos, The Firelords, West Riding Yeomanry, Anders' Legion, The Apex Dragoons, The Sons of Mangala, Flaming Sword Commando of the Holy Brotherhood, United Defence Batteries, Foster's Mercenaries, Fasolini's Company, Division Légere, Lightning Division, The Waldheim Dragoons, Texian 101st Airborne Light Infantry, Solace & Prosperity Regulars, Nonesuch National Guard, Hindi Army, Oltenian Republican Army, Hashemite Nation, Terran Authority Starmarines, and the Sincanmo Federation Militia with illustrations of unit insignia.

In all, there are approximately 160 illustrations and photos in colour and mono.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Novel-based, Science Fiction, Wargame

name: The Wasteland: SOG Exclusive Supplement ‚Äì 2010
description:
User Summary:
The Wasteland is a a 22 pages scenario book only available to the subscribers of Ambush Alley Games Special Operation Group, a membership system that grants discounts and access to exclusive contents.

Unlike the previous year exclusive scenario book, Under The Black Flag, that was only for Ambush Alley, this booklet contains scenarios for the three core Ambush Alley Games rules.

The three scenarios details engagements of the forces of the "Barony" of Harlin's Corner, a small town in a post-apocalypse USA.


Scenario 1 - In the Rat's Alley - For Ambush Alley



A Squad of Baron's Rangers find themselves in the middle of a Raider's Camp, they must fight their way out running and gunning! The Raider's mission is much simpler, kill them all!



Scenario 2 - Agony in Stony Places - For Force on Force



A Small force of Harlin Corner must resist the onslaught of a scouting force from the Ominious Central Republic long enough for the reinforcements from the Corner to arrive. The Central republican forces must try to sweep away the defenders and get closer to the Barony, failing that, they must report to the Republic command the strength of the local resistance.



Scenario 3 - Fear in a Handful of Dust - For Ambush Z



A simple mission to recover a cache of medical supplies from a wasteland city turns into a nightmare as the Baron's rangers are attacked by zombies!


The booklet also contains information regarding the Barony Forces, Central Republic forces, Raiders, Zombies, Mutants and Grey Aliens to design other scenarios in the setting.

The booklet is available only as a download.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Horror, Modern Warfare, Science Fiction

name: Zoofari Paw Prints
description:
Track 'em down & match 'em up!

Complete the Zoofari by matching as many sets of paw prints as possible. Deck of 52 cards with single or double paw prints in different colors. Optional play includes 2 WILD cards which automatically give the player a match.

Teaches matching skills.
Enhances recognition skills.
Promotes friendly competition.
No reading required.
categories: Animals, Card Game, Children's Game, Memory

name: Body Count: Five Battles in Vietnam 1965‚Äì1969
description:
Body Count: Five Battles in VietNam 1965-1969 is a new Tactical Combat Series wargame that covers five actions in Vietnam starting with the earliest actions of the US (Operation Starlite and LZ X-Ray) through Air Cavalry actions (Operation Pegasus), Vietnamization (Duc Lap) and finally assaults on fortified areas (Hamburger Hill).

5 maps (small) + 5 area movement maps
720 counters
20 scenarios

Unit size: single vehicles, weapons sections, infantry platoons
Hex scale: 125 yards
Turn: 20 minutes

Special rules:
Napalm
Flare Ships
FACs
Broken Arrow
Helicopter transport
Helicopter gunships
Tunnel complexes
RPGs
Claymores
NVA/VC concealment

name: Ladinoscop
description:
The game consists of 3 Sub-games that are all played on a map of the Ladin valleys. In the very heart of the Dolomites live slightly more than 30.000 Ladins whose identity is characterised mainly by the uniqueness of their language which derives from Vulgar Latin. It is only thanks to the isolation of the splendid high-mountain landscape, in which the Ladins live, that the Ladin language and cultural heritage have survived.

1) Ladinoscop
The objective of the game is to connect the starting point and the arrival point indicated on the route card using the town tokens which lies between.

2) The Dolomite round trip
The objective of this game is to complete the Dolomites round trip by returning to the starting point.

3) Up and down trough Ladinia
The objective of the third game is to reach all the spaces corresponding to the taken town tokens, and finally return to the starting point.
mechanics: Network and Route Building, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Rainbow++++
description:
Most men only distinguish among 11 basic colours (mango, lemon, mandarin, pistachio et al are things you eat, not colours. Oranges are a mere coincidence with the colour).

Rainbow++++ is a fast-paced card game where you must play at least one of each of the 11 possible colours in order to win.

Each colour has a unique special ability that can be good or bad and there is a universal special ability that says that any two played cards of the same colour act as a trump card of the colour of your choice.

The cunning player will carefully choose the sequence of cards to be played as a combo and try to avoid to play cards with a negative special ability.
categories: Abstract Strategy, Card Game, Print & Play

name: Operation: Uruzgan ‚Äì Force on Force in Afghanistan
description:
A sourcebook for Force on Force: Modern Wargaming Rules

From the publisher's website:

Written by Leigh Neville, author of the best-selling Osprey Press titles Special Operations Forces in Afghanistan and Special Operations Forces in Iraq, Operation: Uruzgan takes a detailed look at Australian operations in the Uruzgan Province of Afghanistan.

Operation: Uruzgan contains:

* 9 Historically Accurate Scenarios
* A Historical Overview of Operations in the Region Since Anaconda
* Special Rules to Represent the Unique Flavor of Taliban Operations in Uruzgan
* Special Rules to Represent the ADF’s Operations in Uruzgan, Including ROEs and COIN based tactics
* 5 New Vehicle Write-Ups, including the Bushmaster IMV
* Uruzgan Specific Fog of War Cards
* Uruzgan Specific Asset Cards
* Guidelines for Using Scenarios with Other Coalition Forces
categories: Book, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Modern Warfare

name: Power Warriors: Core Rulebook
description:
Power Warriors is a turn based combat game for two or more players set in a world where an alien race is trying to enslave the Earth. The planet's only hope for survival is a group of young warriors. The game allows players to create and control a mighty warrior trained to fight using the mystical energy of life known as qi. Power Warriors is unique in that it gives players complete control over the creation of their warrior. Players can create an existing warrior from popular media or one from their own imagination. The possibilities are endless. The object of the game is simply to be the last warrior standing.

Power Warriors is a stand alone game that can also be used as an expansion for any other Toy Battle SystemTM game.
categories: Fantasy, Fighting, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Video Game Theme, Wargame

name: Mix 'n' Match
description:
Mix´n´Match is played on a 7x7 square board.
The board is occupied by stones except the middle cell.
The Mix player must jump on any orthogonal or diagonal direction and capture stones if they are different from each other.
The match player must jump on any orthogonal or diagonal direction and capture stones if they have the same color.
The player that cannot make any valid move,loses.

name: New World Conquest
description:
"Board and card game depicting the colonization of the Americas circa 1492-1760."

The players portray European powers (Spain, Portugal, France, England, and Holland) exploring the American continents. The map is randomly constructed during the course of play. Card play determines what actions a player can take each turn.

This free, online rules set describes the components that you will need to create in order to play the game. The components consist of an 8x5 grid board, 50 terrain tiles, approximately 170 cards, 39 Indian tribe counters, Gold tokens, and Victory Point tokens.

name: Invasion of the Body Snatchers
description: Invasion of the Body Snatchers is a party game for 8-21 players based off of the popular Mafia and Werewolf games. One of the players is secretly an alien invader in a human body and is turning the citizens of Lake Terror into pod people one by one. Can the town find and lynch the alien menace before it's too late? It won't be easy, but you will have fun finding out.
categories: Bluffing, Deduction, Murder/Mystery, Negotiation, Party Game, Science Fiction
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Role Playing, Team-Based Game, Variable Player Powers, Voting

name: Memini
description:
This game is played with two standard decks of cards. One of them is dealt to the players evenly (the remaining cards remain face down). Then everyone has half minute to memorize his cards. Then the cards from the other pack are revealed one at a time, and players can claim they have the matching pair among their cards.

After going through the deck every player scores 1 point for his card if he card alone claimed it, and p points if it was claimed by someone else as well, where p is the number of players.

name: L'Eclissi di Zama
description:
"L'Eclissi di Zama" is the second wargame published by the Italian games shop "Stategia e Tattica", the first having been "Il Sole di Austerlitz" (Austerlitz's Sun). Both were published on the occasion of public events.

The game system, as the "Il Sole di Austerlitz", takes inspiration from "Napoleon's Last Battles", and has about the same hex size while units are equivalent to a regimental size.

name: Janosch Schatzsuche
description:
Try to find many treasures with the tiger duck. The treasure hunter with the most treasures wins.

To get a treasure, one of the player draw one of the 21 treasure cards. With the help of the tiger duck (and the player, who has drawn the card), the other players try to hit the field that shows the drawn treasure.

name: Pastrengo
description:
Pastrengo (subtitle "sound the charge, into glory ride") is a tactical/operational level simulation of the battle fought 30th April 1848, in the opening phases of the First Italian War for Independence, between Charles Albert's army and the Austrian one. It was a small fight, but very significant for the heroic charge made by the Carabinieri (King's guards), immortalized every year during the parade made before the major Italian authorities.
The game is straightforward, with a system first pionereed in Montebello (another TCS games from 2003), and have only a few units on the map (around a dozen for each player), but takes in account fire combat, melee combat, morale, command range, initiative, and an order system that makes this game a little more complex than the usual productions of this small print & play company.

name: Seconds
description:
This game is played with a standard deck of cards. There are different partnering arrangements in each deal.

Tricks are played, and then the player's score is the number of tricks won multiplied by the number won by his partner. (There are some deals with different scoring rules).

The winner at the end is the player with the second highest score.

name: Classical Rummy
description:
This card game serves as a learning aid to Music 350 students. They will learn to classify classical composers by the era in which they worked: Renaissance, Baroque, Classical, Romantic and Modern.

Players lay down matched sets consisting of three cards with the same composers or four cards within the same era for scoring. The player who lays down one matching set of composers and one matching set of eras.first, wins the game.

Components:
45 cards

name: Spec
description: This game uses a standard deck of cards containing three jokers. It is split into two separate packs. One of them is contains the showcards. They are turned face up one at a time after everybody guesses what that card will be. Players get scorecards (the other pack of cards) for correctly predicting the suit, the rank or both. The round continues till the last showcard is revealed (which can be known if a player remembers all the previous cards), and then other rounds are played till a player reaches 173 points.

name: Kings of France, or Charlemagne
description:
The players will be able to match the Kings of France to the appropriate royal house for each king. For example, Charles VII belonged to the house of Valois. In the affective domain, the students will have fun in learning what is considered to be an uninteresting subject.

Object. The object of the game is to accumulate the most points by having the most cards discarded.

Components:
52 cards

name: Martian Tic-Tac-Toe
description:
Martian Tic-Tac-Toe is an Icehouse game for 2 players played on a 3x3 square board.

Each player starts with a stash of three small pieces, three medium pieces and three large pieces, all of one color.
On each player's first turn, that player must place a small piece into a square. After that each player may make one of the following moves:

1. Place a small piece from your stash into an empty square.

2. Swap one of your pieces in play with a piece from your stash (up to one size larger or any size smaller).

3. Capture an opponent's piece by replacing it with a piece from your stash exactly one size larger and sending the captured piece back to the opponent's stash.

A player wins when they get three of their pieces of the same size in a straight line (orthogonal or diagonal).

name: Patterns
description:
Patterns is played on an empty 5x5 square board.
On the first move the first player drops one of his stones on an empty cell.After that,each player may make one of the following:
1.Drop two stones making no captures.
2.Drop one stone to capture enemy stones.
Wins the player that captures 9 stones or stalemates the opponent.

name: Cycling Legends
description: Italian cycling game; each player controls a team of riders. There is an individual and a team classification.

name: Le Grand Voyage
description:
French vintage game. Players travel around the world using destination cards that they draw each turn. Goal is to visit all continents and to do this quicker as the other players.

The game was loosely based on a tv show that was aired in the early '60 on French television.
mechanics: Hand Management, Point to Point Movement

name: For, Lords, To-morrow is a Busy Day: Wargame Rules for The Wars of the Roses
description:
Tactical battle rules for the Wars of the Roses, covering medieval civil warfare in Britain in the late 15th century. The rules indicate use of 10mm figures but other scales are usable.

The rules emphasise the various arms within the armies of the warring factions, including men at arms, light and heavy cavalry, archers, handgunners and artillery. Rules are also provided for incidental troops such as pikemen and foreign mercenaries.
publishers: Real Time Wargames, Realistic Modelling Services

name: "Playing Leapfrog": Corps Level Actions on the Western Front Battlefield Rules and Mini-Campaign System
description:
Corps level miniatures rules for World War One on the Western Front at a fairly abstract level. The rules indicate use of 10mm figures but other scales are usable.

The rules emphasise command of large scale units. The aim is to gain ground, trading off against casualty levels. The rules contain all the key features of Western Front warfare, including artillery, machine guns and trench warfare.
publishers: Real Time Wargames, Realistic Modelling Services

name: Lexico SWE-ENG
description: Unique dictionary game is now completely renovated! Lexico contains a total of 9000 commonly used words, divided into five thematic areas: Human, Environment, Nature and Hobby, Science and Technology as well as the general words. Three different levels of difficulty thanks to the game is suitable for all ages and levels of language minds can play together - each of the chosen level of difficulty. Lexicon company you enjoy and learn a foreign language!

name: Arena
description:
Arena is a four-in-a-row game, much like Connect Four or Score Four, with two distinguishing features:

Players alternately place/stack pieces along a wrap-around circular/cylindrical path instead a grid.
The board is not divided into discrete spaces; pieces are considered neighbors until a piece is laid between them.

name: Vilbergen
description:
This game is played on a 3x4 rectangular board. Each player has 5 pieces in his/her own color.
At the begining of the game each player alternately place a stone into an empty cell exept one restricted cell.
After all cells occupied, On each turn, each player must do one of the following actions:
Capture an adjacent stone on an orthogonal direction by jumping over it and landing on the immediate empty cell. Captures are multiple and mandatory or move a piece on an orthogonal direction to an empty cell.
The player that captures all enemy stones, or has his last stone on the restricted cell wins the game.

name: Drewdle
description:
Drewdle is a Tile-Based Abstract Strategy & Hand Management game for 2 to 4 people. Players attempt to connect multiple Tiles together in certain positions to create the biggest chain/group of their selected Element.

Requirements


The Drewdle Rulebook
The 81 Drewdle Tiles
The Drewdle Board
Tokens for Tile Locking (Each Player needs a different colour)
21 Red, Blue, Green & Yellow (a set for each player) and 6 Black (for Blocker Tiles, common to all players)


2 to 4 Players (2 or 4 Players is recommended)


High Res Files and Rules available from Mediafire
http://www.mediafire.com/?sharekey=4efeb01be37e854407258ee67...
mechanics: Hand Management, Modular Board, Pattern Building, Tile Placement

name: BLITZ!
description:
Subtitled "Wargame Rules for London Firefighting 1940 - 41".

From the rulebook introduction:

"This is a low level operational game about firefighting during the London Blitz in 1940/41. The basic premise is that the player(s) represent fire officers trying to combat fires and deal with emergencies in the critical period of the first London Blitz of September 1940 to May 1941. It is a ‘tactical skirmish’ game - with individual models representing individual vehicles, and stands of figures representing small groups of fire-fighters and emergency workers."

"It also requires a model (or at least a detailed ground plan) of the appropriate scale or the buildings involved. To keep the game manageable I have defined buildings as covering a number of ‘zones’ - both vertically and in area - and these might cover more than one floor of a building, and ignore much the detail of the internal layout. I have done this to make the game reasonably fast-moving and to keep it simple - there is a wealth of detail; that could be represented, but in my view this would slow the game down considerably."

"This game is unusual in that there is no ‘enemy’ played as such. Player cooperate to solve a difficult (or even insoluble) problem with limited resources - I guess this could be called a ‘multi-player solo game’. The opposition comes in the form of randomly generated bombs and fires and damage that occur according to the games’ simple fire propagation model."

name: Desert Rats
description:
Desert Rats: Sand & Steel in the Western Desert 1941/42.

A tactical scale World War II miniatures wargame designed for double-blind umpired play.

"These rules are intended to provide a framework for tank battle games set in the Deserts of north Africa in World War 2. The basic groups of forces are tanks and similar mechanised forces, and the intention is that they be used in a ‘back-to-back’ style of game on two maps or terrain models, using 1/300 scale models."

"Each model represents on tank or an infantry section."

"The ground scale is 1mm = 1 metre (1:10,000)."

name: The Orchard
description:
An orchard is an artificially cultivated land where fruit trees are grown mainly to serve as human food.

The orchard has a variety of fruit species found but in particular apples, pears and cherries.

The high harvest costs, the difficult years and disease control make fruit trees fall into disuse.

Overview
You're a fruit farmer who harvests fruit (apples, pears and cherries) from a common orchard, where you struggle with fellow growers to meet the specific demand of the market to harvest healthier, tastier and better quality fruit.

Good fruit is scarce, harvesting expensive and not enough ladders available but only fruit growers know how to preserve fruit quality even when fruit tree abandonment takes place due to difficult years.

As a fruit grower you need to make sure that the quality of your fruit will be rated as high as possible and need to keep fruit harvesting costs under control.
mechanics: Chit-Pull System, Commodity Speculation, Point to Point Movement, Set Collection, Variable Player Powers

name: Bumba Circusspel
description: Roll the die and find your way through Bumba's circus. This educational game teaches small children about colours and letter-sounds. Based on the popular Belgian children's TV-show
categories: Children's Game, Educational, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Word Game

name: Dobbelsteen Spelletjes
description:
On the cover:
Dobbelsteen Spelletjes including instructions for 26 different dice games.

Included are instructions for different dice games with 1,2,3,5 and 6 dice, a dice cup and 6 dice.

Games with 1 die: Jule, To and From, Add and Subtract, 21st One, Fifteen, The Big Heart, Game of Sixes

Games with 2 dice: Heaven and Eart, The Happy 7, The crossed 12, Eleven, Dice Game

Games with 3 dice: Blue Eyes, Chicago, Chicago High-Low, Succession, Double, Double Lotje, Game of tens, Two is One, From 1 till 16

Games with 5 dice: Big Bank, Dice Poker

Games with 6 dice: Three times a pair, The angry 7, Ohio
publishers: Schmidt Spiele, Selecta Spel en Hobby

name: Castle and Cathedral
description: Through manipulation of influence, bids and bribes, players employ skills provided by the Guilds of medieval Europe to build both a Castle and a Cathedral. The cards represent characters involved in the project, from the Guilds of craftsmen, to the Royalty and Clergy, as well as the Nobility, the Spies, and the Assassins. With the help of a Priest, you might persuade a Guild to abandon an opponent’s project and work for you, but a Guild Master can also turn the tables, wielding great influence among the skilled labor you need to complete your structure.

name: The Wogglebug Game of Conundrums
description:
The Wogglebug Game of Conundrums. Salem, Mass.: Parker Bros., Inc., 1905.

The Wogglebug Game of Conundrums is a formalized guessing game, a contest of wit and skill in which players take turns asking riddles. The player that cannot answer loses.

The "What Did the Woggle-Bug Say? Contest" made this Oz character a household name and inspired all kinds of novelties. That was the beginning of a "Woggle-Bug" craze.

Parker Brothers quickly produced their own tie-in for the hype, introducing The Wogglebug Game of Conundrums the same year. The Wogglebug Game of Conundrums is a game of riddles (none having to do with Oz) produced in 1905.

This is the first toy connected to the Land of Oz as it predates The Wonderful Game of OZ. This unauthorized novelty was only in production for a short time, and is the oldest Oz toy to be found.

Neither Baum nor his book The Marvelous Land of Oz (1904) are mentioned anywhere on this game.

The complete game consisted of a chromolithographed box containing a set of 51 gray colored Conundrum cards and 51 buff-colored Answer cards with one page "Rules for Playing The Woggle Bug Game" and Parker Bros. flyer for two other card games, Pit and Quit .

Sampled below are some of the Woggle Bug's silly questions, and the corresponding answer cards for the game. Popular Culture themes of the time were referenced, as seen in the answer to "What was Adam's favorite popular song?"

Some examples of the Conundrums (questions relying for their effects on punning in either the question or the answer) are:

Why didn't the dog want to go into the Ark?
Because he had a bark of his own.

With what would you fill a barrel to make it lighter than when it was empty?
Holes.

What was Adam's favorite popular song?
"There's only one girl in the world for me."

What kind of medicine does the iceman take?
Pond's extract.

It is unfortunate that the colorful design of the box cover did not extend to the playing cards.
As this was an unauthorized game, Parker Brothers might have found it too difficult to reproduce Neill's stylish illustrations past the images of the Woggle-Bug and Jack Pumpkinhead on the box cover.

The earliest toy associated with Oz and one of the rarest examples of Oziana.
categories: Children's Game, Deduction, Humor, Novel-based, Party Game
mechanics: Memory, Open Drafting, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Flume (hex hex)
description:
Hex hex Flume is a very simple game for two players, played on a hex hex board lined with a perimeter of green stones (or green, stone-sized stickers). Two players, Red and Blue, take turns adding stones of their own color to the board.

If you add a stone which forms 5 or 6 connections (adjacencies) with neighboring stones of any color (red, blue or green) you must add another stone to the board while it's still your turn. And so on. Your turn concludes when you add a stone which forms 4 or less connections with neighboring stones.

Certain move types are prohibited in hex hex Flume, unlike its sister game, square Flume, in which there are no prohibited move types.

The object is to have the majority of stones on the board.

name: Commander
description:
Translated from the Russian language instructions:

This is Commander, the game which imitates the military activity of the early 19th century. Each player will be a commander, determining the strategic and tactical goals of his troops and realizing them through combat with his opponents.

This game will acquaint you with the glorious countries in the patriotic war of 1812, and with the tactics, organization and uniforms of the European armies in 1812-1814.

Before beginning, the players need to decide on their strategic goal. For example: defeat your opponent(s) through reducing his forces to irreplacable levels and seizing his fortified areas, depriving him of the chance to rebuild his forces; seizure or defense of the main citadel; occupying your opponent's territory, etc."

name: Game of Iowa: Trivia Debate
description: A roll-and-move trivia game with questions about Iowa

name: 47 Ronin
description:
Issue game of Wargame Japanese History #4.

This game covers one of the most important Samurai-era episode "Ch≈´shingura". Ch≈´shingura happened December 14th, 1702.
One year before the incident, Asano-takumi, the lord of Akou-han was ordered to harakiri by Shogun Tokugawa Tsunayoshi without detailed judgement due to his outrageous action in Edo-castle.
The 47 warriors of Akou-han had strong will to revenge this judgement and had waited for one year to do the final action.
In falling snow, the 47 warriors assaulted their target Kira's house and did their wish without seriouse damege on their side.
But, Shogun Tokugawa Tsunayoshi again decided to order them harakiri.
Because of their strong will and bushido-spirits, this fact became very popular as "Ch≈´shingura". Even in recent period, this is very popular on TV drama series again and again.
http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ch≈´shingura

This game covers this episode by small wargame.
8 page rulebook
80 counters
1 map
2 dice

name: Fighting Fleets
description:
This booklet provides Ship Grids for Perfidious Albion and Combat data for Fire When Ready rules. There are about 200 classes of ship of all sizes provided from Austria-Hungary, China, France, Germany, Great Britain, Greece, Italy, Japan, Russia, Spain, Sweden, Turkey and United States, as well as some generic cargo ships.

For Perfidious Albion the 10 x 6 Ship Grids can be photocopied or transferred to blank ship cards as you wish. All the data you need to play the game is provided including gunnery modifiers and torpedo sizes. The points value for each ship has been calculated for a standard crew.

For Fire When Ready the game data has been calculated for the ships in the booklet and shows the gunnery data including gun type and penetration required for the game. The armour protection for ships has been assessed and is shown for all the locations needed for the game.

Note that this product is intended for use with Fire When Ready, or Perfidious Albion, and a copy of either of these rules is required.

(Publishers Description)

name: Armoured Wargaming: A Detailed Guide to Model Tank Warfare
description:
User Summary:

Primarily an historical digest of armor unit statistics, the book also contains a dozen pages of rules for 1:300 scale model tank wargaming. Scenarios and mixed- unit rules are, however, left to the reader's imagination.

name: Bigbep Hockey
description:
BigBep Hockey is designed to play quickly while providing accurate statistics. But most of all, the game is designed to feel like hockey and provide the gamer with an enjoyable and immersive experience.

BigBep Hockey utilizes a Fast Action Deck and a Fast Results deck to greatly enhance the speed of play. The vast majority of all results are found without consulting outside charts. Once you have learned the rules, contests in BigBep hockey fly by.

While the game plays rapidly, this isn’t a watered down hockey game, nor is it a quick-play game. This is a full-fledged simulation of hockey. In BigBep Hockey each skater is rated for the following: Shooting from various places on the ice, Power Play ability, Penalty Killing ability, Overall Offensive contribution, Overal Defensive Contribution, shots allowed, intimidation, passing, face-offs, injury frequency, times penalized, and a clutch rating. Goalies are also rated for both home and away performance. BigBep Hockey truly captures the entire game of hockey.

The board game includes complete rules, 100 die-cut, full-color Fast Action Cards, 100 die-cut, full-color Fast Result Charts, and all charts, printed in full-color, that are needed to play the game.

name: Admiral Byrd's South Pole Game 'Little America'
description:
Follow Rear Admiral Richard Evelyn Byrd, Jr., USN (1888–1957) on his trail by air, sea and land from New Zealand to the South Pole avoiding the perils of icebergs, crevasses and blizzards along your route.

Housed in the original 2 part box with color illustration on box lid depiction Admiral Byrd and scenes from his Antarctic exploration: Game board, 4 wooden game pieces, 4 spinners mounted to wooden sticks with colored cords and wooden plugs simulating radio microphones.

Object of the game is to insert peg at bottom of microphone into die-cut holes at “New Zealand”, spin the spinner and start out for Admiral Byrd’s Little America base. As players reach their destination they announce their safe arrival using the microphone and then continue on to the South Pole. The first player to reach the South Pole by exact count wins.

name: Ritter
description:
"A diceless battle game for ancients and medievals." from the cover of the rulebook.
Rules cover troop types (similar to DBA), movement, units and attacks. Each army has a rating for number of moves, number of killing attacks, and number of stands it can lose before it breaks. Combat is decided by a unique diceless matrix.
Also included are army lists from the dawn of history to the Renaissance and the Far East.
Part 2 of the Strategic Spectrum Series.

name: March Madness 2010 Irregular Forces Pack
description:
An expansion/scenario pack for Advanced Squad Leader. Like the previous scenario sets produced by the Kansas City Irregular ASL Club for their annual March Madness tournament in Kansas City, Kansas, this set is limited to 75 numbered copies.

This module focuses in on 6 WWII-era battles and, uniquely, one Cold War action. Scenarios cover:

•Usi-Usa, Siberia 1942 (gulag escapees take up arms against Soviets)
•Ivaskovic, Ukraine 1942 (anti-partisan actions by Slovak troops)
•Warsaw, Poland 1943 (Jewish uprising in Warsaw Ghetto)
•Paris 1944 (French underground fighters occupy Grand Palais)
•Rembertow, Poland 1945 (Polish partisans assault NKVD holding camp)
•Shaba, Zaire 1978 (French paratroopers respond to Angolan aggression)

Contents:
•7 scenarios
•2 overlays
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Modular Board

name: Eur√™ka!
description:
In the series of quiz games from DIDACTO, we, of course, had to include science. The modern era has been marked by scientific discoveries, and we must understand its main components.

This game will let you penetrate the world of geniuses and their inventions. Once immersed, not in Archimedes' bathtub, but in a fascinating universe in which you might perhaps be brought to exclaim "Eureka!"

(Translation from the instruction package)

"Eurêka!" is a game in which multiple players compete in trying to complete more of the 13 numbered sets of 4 cards than any other player. Every card contains several (around 5-10) trivia questions. After having distributed the cards evenly among players, gameplay starts. On his turn, a player will ask for a particular card of a set of which he has at least one other card. Its owner will ask the first question on the card - should that card ever be asked again, the second question will be asked, and so forth. Whenever a player answers correctly, the card is transferred to him; whenever a player completes a series or wrongfully answers a question, it becomes the next player in clockwise order's turn. The game ends either after all sets are completed, or after a set time deadline, to the players' choice.

Questions vary in difficulty, as some of them can easily be answered by any 6th grader while some others require an acute knowledge of particular disciplines. Mathematics, physics, chemistry, engineering, computer science and biology are all disciplines that this game addresses.

(Description by BGG user jgag)

name: Weltmissionsfahrt
description: Weltmissionsfahrt is a roll-and-move game published by the "Schweizerische Missionsgesellschaft Bethlehem" some time between 1921 and 1938. The players have to start their journey in Rome. They move two pawns representing missionaries across a world map. The winner is the player whose two pawns return to Rome the fastest.

name: Cont√°gio
description:
A game of claustrophobic terror and survival in a hostile environment.

In an underground military base, experiments are done in order to create a new biological weapon. Mutations of dangerous infectious agents and other threats are kept there.
Suddenly an accident occurs in a laboratory, releasing a lethal virus all over the place. Some of the first victims already suffer the effects of the new disease, and rise up from the dead, returning to life as zombies hungry for human flesh.
Some survivors still resist the virus, but their time is short. At any time, they can become a feast for the undead, or succumb to the disease and increase the horde of brain-eaters.

The players are in the role of some of these survivors, and should explore the site facing the zombies, find the experimental cure and escape.

Prepare, load your weapons and run! There is only one way out.

A summary of the gameplay:

The characters start at the central sector of the board, that is already revealed. The goal is to find the antidote and escape through the hatch in the center of the board. To do this, the players must spend action points to do actions like walk, fight and search.
When a character enters in a unrevealed room, he must take one tile from the pile, and place it adjacent to the room he is coming from, connecting the doors. Then he rolls the encounter dice, that shows if he met zombies, items or nothing.
The fight is conducted by the range and the requirements that each weapon has to kill or hurt the zombies. Then the player rolls a dice and see if the result satisfies those requirements. He can spend action points to add to the result.
The items are managed in the inventory, that shows how many items the character can carry.
When the player choose to search, he takes a card from the correspondent sector pile. It can be items, good or bad events, weapons or the antidote.
When a player finishes his move, then the next player plays with the zombies on the board. He can move and attack with all zombies.
After that, the same player now plays with his human character, an it goes on. When the round is complete, move the players' infection marker. If someone passes the last
mark, he becomes a zombie.
There are some details in the rules about spending action points, fighting, events and items.
The first player to find the cure and get back to the hatch is the winner.
mechanics: Action Points, Modular Board, Tile Placement

name: Tras el Unicornio: Searching the Unicorn
description:
According to a legend in 1471 by order of Henry IV King of Castille, called the Impotent, set out one expedition to Africa, beyond the land of the Moors.
The secret aim of this expedition was to hunt a unicorn, since it was assumed that the horn of this mythological creature could increase the virility of the king.
In 1946 the results of the exhumation of the corpse of Henry IV alongside the king's mummified remains found a gray spindle object, which was proved to be a fragment of African rhino horn.

So begins and ends the novel "In Search of the Unicorn" by Juan Eslava Galan awarderd Planeta Prize in 1987, being the original idea for this game. Each player leads an expedition sent to hunt the unicorn, but in the way they could get other valuable things like gold, trading on the Silk Road and to evangelize people in the name of his master Henry IV of Castille. All this if the expeditioners survived the attacks of nomade tribes with whom they have to fight. Many dangers and soldiers will die during the way and what is worse, maybe you the leader will also fall before reaching your goal ... who will get the horn and gets the grace of the king?

---

En 1471 por orden de Enrique IV de Castilla, llamado el Impotente, parte una expedición desde Segovia con destino los pastizales de Africa, más allá de la tierra de los moros.
El objetivo secreto de esta expedición era cazar un unicornio, ya que se suponía que su cuerno podía aumentar la virilidad del rey.
Según reza el Acta de la Exhumación del cadáver de Enrique IV de 1946, junto a los restos momificados del rey se encontró un objeto fusiforme gris, que una vez identificado por el C.S.I.C. resultó ser un fragmento de cuerno de rinoceronte africano.

Así comienza y termina la novela “En busca del unicornio” de Juan Eslava Galán que fue Premio Planeta en 1987, y que sirve como idea para este juego. Cada jugador dirige una expedición para cazar el unicornio, pero por el camino podrá conseguir oro, comerciar en la ruta de la seda y hasta evangelizar pueblos para ensalzar la figura de su señor Enrique IV de Castilla. Todo esto si sobrevive a los ataques de los pueblos nómadas con los que tendrá que luchar. A lo largo de la expedición es posible que tus compañeros pierdan la vida y lo que es peor, a lo mejor tu también caes…¿serás tu quien gane el favor del rey?

name: Battle Royale
description:
War has come to the ninth century as rival lords (the players) fight to conquer the land. Each player rules a fortress and the surrounding realm. Warriors are dispatched fortress and towers, crossing mountains, rivers, and open fields to engage the enemy. Using economics, diplomacy, and warfare, each player attempts to expand his realm and conquer all enemy fortresses.


Players create a unique geography before each game begins, so it's never the same game twice.
Battle Royale is a 2-player version of Antagonist with marauding warriors, changing seasons, burning villages, and limitless strategies.
Straight-forward, intuitive rules with have you playing in minutes.


(From the games label)
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Area Movement, Dice Rolling, Set Collection

name: Poland Aflame!
description:
Poland Aflame! is an Advanced Squad Leader campaign package that contains a series on interrelated scenarios pertaining to the German invasion of Poland starting on September 1st, 1939. A number of scenarios are played, each simulating a portion of the action, that took place on that date. The ASL Rulebook is required, and special rules that apply to this campaign series are listed in this expansion.

The rules of this campaign package allows players to make use of a special phase called the Refit Phase, wherein each side takes stock of what happened and prepares for further combat in the next scenario. Reinforcement Groups in the form of infantry companies, Armored platoons, OBA modules and Gun Batteries - to name a few - may be selected by the players and purchased through the expenditure of Campaign purchase points. Players will soon find that the last-ditch, suicidal charge so often employed in a standard scenario may be needlessly costly to their chances for victory in the overall campaign.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II

name: Nex
description:
Nex is an abstract strategy game for 2 - 4 players. Gameplay consist of players taking turns to either place or move one of their pieces on the board. The goal is to force the other players into a position where they can't make any legal moves. This can be done either by capturing enough of their peices or by maneuvering their pieces into a corner.

This game is no longer available as Nex. It has been rethemed and after a few rules tweaks released as Battle of 4 Armies.

name: Una serata a Saint Vincent: con Tony Binarelli
description:
(Text extracted from the introduction of the game, written by Tony Binarelli)

"The noise of the ball that bounces on the roulette wheel. The rustle of cards that slip on the green table. The sound of dice shaken in the dice-box. The murmur of the players. The silence of expectation. The blue smoke of cigarettes. Anxiety, joy, frustration depicted by the gambling on the faces of the crowd around the tables. This is the atmosphere in the halls of a casino. A thrilling atmosphere that attracts and disrupts all your senses. An extraordinary and unrepeatable sensation that Fortune gives you when filling your pockets with money or taking away everything you have. Because, in fact, winning does not matter. What is important is risking and defying the Fate at that beloved and, at the same time, hated green table.
The purpose of this game is just to give everyone a chance to try these feelings, tempting fate seamless. Come with me and your friends to spend an evening at this very special casino every time you want. You will not regret. Challenge your luck with roulette, poker, telesina, Macao, s1ot machines and many other exciting and funny games. If you are cautious, intelligent and, above all, lucky, you will have the chance not only to clean your playmates out, but also to break the bank of the casino and become the King of Players".

The game is composed by:
1 - A game board with all the squares indicating the different gambling rooms: roulette, poker, Telesina, Macao, dice, Tic Tac, Black Jack, +6 / -6. Moreover there are also: the Ballroom, the Night Club, the Grill Hall and the Entrance Hall.
2 - A dice-box
3 - Two 6-side dice
4 - Five poker dice for the Tic Tac game.
5 - A deck of French cards used for following games: Poker - Telesina - Macao - +6 / -6.
6 - A deck of 35 surprise cards (the "Black Jack" deck).
7 - A slot machine.
8 - Nr. 16 tokens with the shape of mini-bottles, different by colour, to be used to indicate the position of each player on the game board and the different bets on the roulette panel.
9 - A roulette wheel.
10 - A lot of paper chips for the players’ stakes and to compose the bank (denominations: 5, 10, 20, 50, 100)

(Testo tratto dall'introduzione del gioco, scritta da Tony Binarelli)
"ll rumore della pallina che saltella sulla ruota della roulette.
ll fruscio delle carte da gioco che scivolano sul tavolo verde. Il suono dei dadi agitati nel bicchiere. Il mormorio dei giocatori. Il silenzio dell’attesa. Il fumo azzurro delle sigarette. L’ansia, la gioia, la frustrazione che il gioco dipinge sui volti della folla attorno ai tavoli. L’atmosfera che si respira nelle sale di un casinò è questa. Un’atmosfera da brivido che seduce e sconvolge tutti i tuoi sensi. Sensazione straordinaria e irrepetibile che ti dà la
fortuna quando riempie le tue tasche di soldi, oppure ti toglie
tutto ciò che possiedi. Perché, in realtà, vincere non importa.
Ciò che conta è rischiare, sfidando la sorte a quell’amato e
allo stesso tempo odiato tavolo verde. Lo scopo di questo gioco è proprio quello di dare a tutti la possibilità di provare queste sensazioni, di sfidare la sorte senza soluzione di continuità. Vieni insieme a me ed ai tuoi amici a trascorrere una serata in questo casinò molto speciale ogni volta che vuoi. Non te ne pentirai. Sfida la fortuna alla roulette, a poker, a telesina, a macao, alla s1ot machine e a tanti altri giochi esaltanti e divertenti. Se sarai accorto, intelligente e soprattutto fortunato non solo avrai la possibilità di sbancare i tuoi compagni di gioco, ma anche di far «saltare il banco» dello stesso casinò e di trasformarti quindi nel Re dei Giocatori".

Il gioco si compone di:
1 - Un tabellone contenente tutte le caselle indicanti le varie
sale da gioco: Roulette, Poker, Telesina, Macao, dadi, Tic Tac, Black Jack, +6/-6, inoltre vi sono il Salone delle Feste - Il Night Club - il Grill e la casella Ingresso.
2 - Un bussolotto per giocare con i dadi
3 - Due dadi numerati.
4 - 5 dadi con i simboli delle carte per il Tic Tac.
5 - Un mazzo di carte francesi che viene utilizzato per i
seguenti giochi: Poker - Telesina - Macao - +6/-6.
6 - Un mazzo di 35 carte sorpresa (mazzo" Black Jack").
7 - Una slot machine.
8 - 16 segnalini a forma di mini-bottiglie, ognuno di diverso
colore, per segnalarci movimenti di ciascun giocatore sulla
tavola da gioco. Le bottiglie sono di diversa forma, ma abbinate dallo stesso colore.
9 - Una roulette.
10 - La riproduzione di fiches per la composizione delle poste
dei singoli giocatori e per la dotazione del banco. Nei seguenti tagli: 5, 10, 20, 50, 100.
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Death on the Seas
description:
From the rules:

"This game is designed to provide simple and easy to use rules for fighting small scale naval battles featuring around half a dozen ships per side. The rules are written with 1/600th scale ships in mind, but it would be possible to use other sized miniatures...Death on the Seas is historically set in the 5th Century BC, during the Persian Wars, but the rules feature statistics for ships from both earlier and later periods.
Several of the core mechanics for this game have their origins in the 5.56mm game and will therefore be familiar to anyone who has read those rules."

From the Wargames Journal website (blurb by the creator)

"...a fast play set of [free] rules that can be used with just about any scale of ancient ships (the target was 1/600th scale) and are based on a premise of one model equals one ship."

name: Battalions In Crisis! ModuleII: 1944-45
description:
User Summary.

This module rounds out the game to become a complete package for WW2 small unit simulation.

Adds on the last of the armour from 1944-45 including the IS2, M24 Chaffee, M26 Pershing, PzIVJ, Koenigstiger and Crab.

Addition to the basic rules include;
Spaced Armour immunity to HEAT based weapons,
High velocity guns no longer benefiting from falling shots at extreme ranges,
The additional carnage of multiple barrelled weapons and
The devestating power of rocket artillery.

The platoon roster have now been replaced with nation specific versions including early (rifles) and late (assault rifles and LMGS) versions for Germany.

The major update to the system is the inclusion of what the designers call a 'Box Wars' points sysem for competitive play. This adds a meticulous costing system to every item already included in the game. This is particularly useful for the more casual gamer who is not looking to recreate a specific action.

The five new scenarios are very well presented and now include a useful General Situation, Commanders' briefings and Umpire notes.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame, World War II

name: Kiumbove aneb Tajuplny balik z Afriky
description:
It is not just a board game, the packaging consist of a comics and it reaches beyond the classical board games - it is a helping hand for people in Africa. They make each and every one of the Kiumbi characters, which are in the game.
The game itself is mainly focused on children as it the whole design. It contains five characters, that are amazingly designed and handcrafted. They "sleep" on one side of the box in a little space with holes, so they can breathe.
It plays quickly. The game board is round, with five pathways to centre and nine points, that leads to victory. On start of each pathway you put one Kiumbi character and secretly choose one of them, who you will support.
Each player gets three cards with symbol, that matches one game character. When you play this card, that character moves one space to the center. But there are influences between characters - water tames fire and so on, so when you play fire, fire character moves one space forward, but another two characters move too - one forward and one backward. These influences are nicely shown on the board.
When first of kiumbis reaches the centre the game ends and who has supported this character wins. Game can also end sooner, when somebody guesses another players secret favorit.
categories: Bluffing, Card Game, Children's Game, Party Game
mechanics: Open Drafting, Point to Point Movement

name: Gear Krieg Fields of War
description:
Publisher Blurb:

This tactical sourcebook explores the various theaters of the early days of the Alternate Second World War and the operations that took place in them. Fields of War contains numerous tactical scenario seeds for the Gear Krieg universe that can be played together or separately, along with sample strike forces and heroes, special rules and miniature modeling advice for both the tabletop and the Gear Krieg miniatures.

Fields of War includes:

- Rules for Natural, Urban and Combat Engineering tabletop features;
- Scenario seeds for the above environments;
- Modeling instructions for both the tabletop and miniatures;
- New Heroes and equipment for Germany, the British Commonwealth, the United States, Soviet Russia and Imperial Japan;
- and several new vehicles and variants.

A copy of the Gear Krieg Rulebook, a few six-sided dice, miniatures/counters, pen and paper are required to use this supplement.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame, World War II

name: Target Gotland
description:
This is a Cold War era game depicting the hypothetical Soviet invasion of this strategically located Swedish island in the Baltic Sea. Includes five small (8.5" x 11") unmounted mapsheets and 300 unmounted counters. Originally published in issue #6 of the Swedish wargame magazine Combat!.

(c)1978 by Wellington Wargames of Kisa, Sweden.

name: Wehrmacht
description:
Wehrmacht: The War in Russia 1941-1945.

This is an epic strategic level wargame of the entire campaign fought by Germany and the Axis partners against the Soviet Union. Includes 255 die-cut counters, a three-color map, and set up sheets for the various scenarios.

This zip-loc wargame was the first title published by Fusilier Games of Scotland.

name: The Last Stand: Italy, April '45
description: "The Last Stand: Italy, April '45" is an operational wargame about the last month of World War II in Italy. One player is the German with some Fascist allies trying to delay allied advance toward the Po river. The other player has the composite forces of the Allies (American, British, Commonwealth, Polish, Jewish, Brazilian and Italian) with the objective to pierce enemy lines, catch significant cities and block retreat roads to the river and to Germany. Allies have a mighty airpower, while German has multiple defence lines with improved positions and a plenty of minor rivers. Rules reflect initial Hitler's strategy to hold until last man and, for the Allies, logistic problems to launch two main offensives at once; so German has initial movement limits and Allies must wait some game turns for their attacks: first the British Army,then the American Army.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Hexagon Grid, Movement Points, Ratio / Combat Results Table, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Simulation, Zone of Control

name: Baseball: Approved by Little League for Little Leaguers and Their Fathers
description:
The game is designed to teach baseball to people of all ages, allowing them to make decisions similar to those made in an actual game. To quote the introduction, "This is the only game approved by the Little League for Little Leaguers... It can be played with easy rules for beginners, so that dad can have fun teaching his boy the fundamentals of Baseball. It can also be played using all the science and strategy of Major League Baseball."

The game consists of a field with a giant "spinner" embedded under it. There are nine fielders sitting over small squares on the board, four umpires over additional squares, and a batter. The knob in the center is spun and aligned to a space in front of the pitcher. The player at bat then decides to swing, bunt or take the pitch. If the pitch is taken, the umpire behind the plate will call a ball or strike. This is done by lifting the umpire off a small square revealing the call. If a swing is made, the batter is lifted off his square and the result of the swing is shown by a number 1-9 (indicating the player position) and the type of hit (ground ball, line drive or fly ball). The defensive player then lifts the indicated fielder off his square to reveal whether the ball was fielded or not. If a throw has to be made to a base, the umpire on that base makes the call. If a runner gets on base, there are red base runners to indicate which base is occupied. You can attempt steals, bunts, hit-and-run -- all the regular plays in baseball are available. In addition, all the symbols are printed on the game board in foul ground so its easy to play without looking things up all the time. A great, simple game that actually plays somewhat like the real thing.

(Quotes and description from rules printed inside the box lid.)

name: Niederrhein-Quiz
description:
Simple trivia game with questions related to the German Niederrhein region. The game consists of cards with one question and answer each. Players take turns asking the other player(s) questions. A player who can answer a question gets the card. The player with most cards at the end of the game is the winner.

(User summary by HilkMAN)

name: The King O' the Castle!
description:
The King O' the Castle is an Icehouse game played on a 7×8 square board. Each player need one Icehouse Stash and each player takes: 2 large pieces (Kings), 3 medium pieces (Knights), 4 small pieces (Pages), and one counter or coin (Castle).
On each turn a player must move one piece, there are two types of movement.

Normal Movement
Jumping Movement


The first player to get one of their Kings onto their opponents Castle is the Winner.

name: Old King Cole
description:
Old King Cole done by both McLoughlin Bros in 1888 and Parker Brothers in 1890. This is a card game in which the cards are divided into 2 suits by means of the number in the corner, those with red numbers forming 1 suit and those with blue numbers forming the second suit. After being shuffled 5 cards are dealt to each player. The reminder of the deck is left face down in the middle of the table. Each player plays a card in turn, the one playing the highest card of the suit lead takes the trick. Each player then takes a card from the deck and adds it to the cards already in his/her hand. The winner of the trick leads the next card. Play continues this way with players taking additional cards after every trick played. After all cards from the deck have been taken play continues with all of the remaing cards until they are all played.

The object of the game is to get sets of cards, such as 3 or 4 Old King Cole Cards of the same suit. Anytime a player has in his hand any of the sets he announces it and can then count it toward his final score. The scoring groups are Any 4 cards consisting of the 4 different cards grouped with (an Old King Cole card, a King Cole Pipe Card, King Cole Bowl Card and Fiddler Card), any 4 OLD KING COLE cards, any 3 OLD KING COLE cards of the same suit. Each grouping of cards score differing amounts of points. Highest total points at the end of the game wins. Info from AGCA Archives.

name: Insecta: Expansion Kit
description:
Requires Insecta or Trilobite games to play.

Includes extra mutant bug design cards, extra dozen rubber bugs, new pixie rules, new pixie equipment cards, new pixie design sheet.

(from the cover)

Consists of printed card, with individual cards needing to be cut out with scissors, plus a pack of rubber bugs, packaged in a plastic bag.
categories: Animals, Educational, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Horror, Science Fiction
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Hexagon Grid, Role Playing, Simulation, Variable Player Powers

name: Scrum Down Rugby Card Game
description:
Scrum Down Rugby Card Game is a two-player Rugby Union card game, where players control two teams of 15 cards, each with different skills, use dice to challenge for plays, and use action cards to enhance their playing style, whilst giving players the freedom to customise their own teams and decks.

The game rules control two basic phases of play, loose play, with passing, kicking, running, rucks and mauls, and set plays, like scrums and lineouts.

It's exciting, it plays like rugby, it pits grit against grit.
categories: Card Game, Dice, Print & Play, Sports

name: Mega Bots
description:
Mega Bots is a turn based combat game for two or more players set in a world where conventional weapons of war have been replaced with immense robots.

The game allows players to create and control a robot armed with a variety of weapons and special combat systems.

Mega Bots gives players complete control over the creation of their bot. Players can create an existing bot from popular media or one from their own imagination. The possibilities are endless.

The object of the game is simply to turn the opposing bots into scrap metal

Mega Bots is a stand alone game that can also be used as an expansion for any other Toy Battle System™ game.

name: Bravo Gorilla
description:
Freely translated (and slightly expanded) from the Italian "Dictionary of Boardgames" ("Dizionario dei Giochi di Società"):

Two tribes of primates vie for control of the jungle. Game similar to Stratego: players have 16 gorillas each, of different values hidden from the view of the opponent. Aim of the game is capturing the opponent's king.
Contents: board, 16 red gorillas, 16 blue gorillas, rules booklet.

name: Atlanta-Opoly
description:
How do you make a board game about the city of Atlanta?
While it’s impossible to include everything, we jammed as much Atlanta as we could into this box. It’s FULL of history, parks, SPORTS, just one more peach AND...LOTS OF fun! LOOKING FOR A Great WAY TO EXPERIENCE A-Town? HERE IT IS! Grab Some Friends and Gather 'Round! Here's a quick idea of how to play!
Buy your favorite Atlanta properties, increase your rent by collecting City Blocks and trading them in for Keys to the City. Sound easy?

WELL, ADD IN SOME TRAFFIC JAMS, Property Tax
AND PARKING FINES AND IT GETS A LITTLE
MORE DIFFICULT AND A LOT MORE FUN!

SO CHOOSE YOUR TOKEN AND ADVANCE TO GOATLANTA!
YOU MAY SOON BE THE MAYOR OF Atlanta...
OR YOU MAY BE STUCK IN THE
TRAFFIC JAM OF YOUR LIFE!
Get YOUR Game On!
THIS IS ATLANTA... AND IT’S YOUR ROLL!!

Publisher's Website
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Dice Rolling, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Stock Holding, Trading
publishers: Late for the Sky Production Company

name: Indianapolis-opoly
description:
A board game about the GREAT city of Indianapolis! We chose some favorite landmarks and traditions, mixed in some super fast Indy cars, higher education, a great big Monument Circle, and some BIG FUN... and voilà (vwä lä)-behold; INDIANAPOLIS-OPOLY! Grab Some Friends and Gather 'Round!

Here's a quick idea of how to play! Buy property, collect City Blocks and trade in for a Key to the City. It sounds easy enough - but add in a traffic jam, property taxes, parking tickets and the IRS and it becomes a little more difficult... and a lot more FUN!

Get YOUR Game On, Indianapolis! It's Your Roll!

Publisher's Website
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading
publishers: Late for the Sky Production Company

name: Den Svenska Myllan
description:
A Swedish historical trivia game. Translated from the homepage:

"Den Svenska Myllan is a historical quiz. It contains more than 7200 questions and answers.

Questions about the Swedes adventures from Antiquity to the Present. Sometimes you need to know about names and events, others times you use your logic.

Rules, game pieces, dice and dice points (money) are included. The playing field measuring 42x42 cm."

name: Zauberlehrling
description:
In the school of magic there is great excitement. The apprentices arrive for their final test to be included in the circle of masters. The tower is full of mystical magic, and only the master can unravel the mystery about the progress of the examinees. Who will be the first to enter the circle?

Zauberlehrling is a delightful game of dice, and a bewitched race for the great art of magic. The magnetic charm of the stones creates a game with wonderful surprises. And with a good memory you will anticipate the steps of the master's magic...

A magnetic race for sorcerer's apprentices with a good memory.

name: Collection of Desires
description:
Collection of Desires is a twenty-card expansion pack to be played along with the card game Seppuku. This set introduces two very significant themes in every well-rounded samurai’s life, women and art.

The expansion pack consists of (20) cards. There are (7) Geisha, (9) Haiku Cards, and (4) Action Cards.

Collection of Desires is the first of three expansions set to be released for the samurai card and dice based game Seppuku.
categories: Card Game, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting

name: Mayhem Skate!
description:
An urban skating game included in the cardstock model set "Urban Grind" published from Worldworks Games.

From the publisher:
Mayhem: Urban Grind is a skate park, standees and mini-game all in one! Design the park of your dreams and furnish it with all the ramp and grind combos you can handle! Once constructed build up an army of skater dudes to inhabit the park and cause completely mayhem!

As mentioned, this release includes "Mayhem Skate"; a skate park themed multiplayer game which pits your skater against others in an exhibition style or racing format challenge! Includes a number of game variants to spice up the competition! Fun, fast and sweeeeet!
Mayhem: Urban Grind includes all of the following (All skate park terrain comes in both graffiti and "clean" versions)
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Race, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Championship Rugby
description:
“Championship Rugby” enables you to play an entire rugby tournament or season in only a few hours.

Individual players are not identified, but teams have dynamic Attack and Defence ratings which fluctuate over the season depending on form, injuries, suspensions or even the resignation of the team coach.

These ratings, plus home advantage and weather, determine the match ratings for the teams each week. Matches are then played out with two dice rolls per team per half, making it easy to generate half time scores for the full week’s fixture list before progressing to the second half of each match, if you wish.

“Championship Rugby” generates a statistically accurate campaign, whilst still maintaining that unpredictable aspect of sport.

name: Landser
description: Free set of World War II skirmish rules focused on squad vs squad level combat designed by Nick Eyre. The game is aimed primarily at 25/28mm, but 15mm works fine. Each soldier can perform a variety of different actions which are listed in his profile. Actions include Move, Move Fast, Move and Fire, Sneak, Fire, Hide, Assault, Covering Fire, Weapon Work and Rally. The rules are simple yet realistic. The game is divided into turns with players taking alternate turns with all of their units. The latest set of rules include many optional rules that have been added by the Landser Yahoo Group including basic armor rules and additional army lists.

name: Fall of the Philippines: MacArthur's Defeat, 1941
description:
(From Introduction)

This is a solitaire game simulating the Battle for Luzon between Japanese and Allied forces after Pearl Harbor in December, 1941. The player--representing the Allied forces under Gen. Douglas MacArthur--attempts to repulse the Japanese invaders. The game system handles the movement and combat of the Japanese side.

Published in Panzer Digest #9, Summer 2010
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Paper-and-Pencil, Point to Point Movement

name: Irish Quest
description:
When times are tough, as indeed they are just now, gather your friends and family around the table and cosy up for a few hours of traditional fun with Irish Quest. Together you can rediscover your Irish roots and the family values that really matter when you play Irish Quest. An ideal way to spend quality time together. Be Irish and proud of it!

Your Country, Your Heritage, Your Passion

Test your knowledge of everything Irish and learn so much more by playing Irish Quest. With over 2,000 Irish multiple-choice questions in four different categories HISTORY, LAND AND NATURE, CULTURE and MODERN there’s so much to share and learn, and the accompanying booklet enhances the experience with further explanations for many of the more interesting and unusual answers. But beware! As you tour the country to collect the letters ‘Q U E S T’, Destiny cards may help or hinder you and you will need to earn sovereigns to help pay your way.

name: Skirmish!
description:
FROM THE PUBLISHER"S INTRODUCTION (EXCEPTS):

Skirmish! is a quick-to-learn, easy-to-set-up game of combat that can be played using almost any miniatures figures. The point of this game is to simulate small-scale battles and to play as well as possible and to have fun, win or not.
Skirmish! is intended for both veteran and novice players. It is simple enough to be a beginner's first wargame, and versatile and expandable enough to satisfy more experienced gamers, especially those who want to pull out some of their old toy soldiers out of a footlocker or the closet and use them in a game.

Skirmish! is designed for simplicity and playability.
