The basic rules can be read, a handful of soldiers selected, and a game set up in about 20 minutes, and in much less time than that for players already familiar with the rules. And, while their emphasis is on playability, these rules allow for consistency, taking the gaming action up at least a few steps from merely "playing soldiers".

Would-be hardcore gamers mau complain that these rules are not "realistic". Sure they are. They are just exceptionally streamlined, and in the spirit of "playing soldiers" are simple and flexible. There are no cumbersome charts or combat matrices, no supporting papaerwork to keep track of a game in play, and a minimum of simple tables. Most attacks can be completely resolved with a simple roll of the dice.

Anything beyond the basic rules is optional. With the incorporation of selected optional rules, Skirmish! can be made as complex as is enjoyable for the players. Most players will eventually, if not initially, want to use some of the optional rules.

From RPGnow.com:

This book is part of a thematic series of works on miniatures wargaming published by Skirmisher that includes the H.G. Wells books Little Wars and Floor Games, the company’s spinoff Little Orc Wars rules, and the Quactica miniatures rules.

name: Coins
description:
"Coins" is an all-new web-published game! It's easy, fun, and exciting! It only takes three people with a handful of coins each to play, there's no board and practically no time limit.
The full rules are in the forum, but here's a short summary:
Three players each choose a coin from their hand and reveal it to the others. The winner is the player who either played the middle coin or the different coin. F.ex. with 5, 2 and 1, the winner is 2; with 2, 2, and 5, the winner is 5!
It's that easy! Try it out, write your thoughts in the forum and join us on facebook:
http://www.facebook.com/home.php#!/group.php?gid=10204253318...;ref=ts

For other fun coin-games, check out Cognes:
http://www.boardgamegeek.com/boardgame/68480/cognes
... and Coin Clusters:
http://www.boardgamegeek.com/boardgame/70359/coin-clusters
Also, for a more traditional coin game that can be played in combination with these, try Spoof:
http://www.boardgamegeek.com/boardgame/18137/spoof
Another classic is Penny Football:
http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Penny_football

name: Cat-a-pult
description: This is a dexterity "aiming" game where you flip plastic/rubber cats to cause chain reactions. It can be played solo, but it is intended to be played in a competition set-up with increasingly complex chain reaction set-ups. While the game doesn't specify a maximum number of players, six is the highest number that would not have too much downtimes between plays.

name: Bravodi
description:
The game board is an 8x8 grid which consists of 16 groups of four holes. Each hole is assigned a number between 1 and 4 (same alignment on the entire board). Each player has 16 playing pieces in his/her color.
At the beginning, the players take turns rolling a four-sided die and can place one of their pieces in any of the holes with the number that was rolled. The aim is to form squares and lines of four pieces either completely in one's own color or in two colors (two pieces each, together with another player). A single color square or line counts 2 points, a shared one 1 point for each of the involved players.
When all holes of one number are filled, the die is put aside and the players place the pieces at their discretion for the remainder of the game (thus the luck factor is eliminated and the game proceeds as a pure abstract strategy game.
When all the holes are filled, the player with most points is the winner.

(User summary by HilkMAN)

name: Warring States
description:
Warring States is a light strategy game taking place during the Japanese warring state period (15th to 17th century). Players customize their armies and then fight for supremacy over five key locations.

Turns occur by players secretly choosing two of their units and sending them to one of the five locations of their choice. When both players have units at a location, they are revealed and a battle occurs.

The game ends after five turns. Whichever player controls more points worth of territories is the winner.
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Secret Unit Deployment, Variable Player Powers

name: USS Hampton
description:
This is a 13 page supplement to Star Cruiser (GDW). Included are six 11"x17" playable boards for 25mm miniatures for the USS Hampton Destroyer Escort. This guide includes illustrations, descriptions, and the status sheet for this warship (including fighters, drones, and missiles). A sheet of a stand-up figure set is also included.

Star Cruiser is part of GDW's 2300AD universe.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Science Fiction, Wargame

name: Wend-edge
description:
Another meandering path game.

Wend-edge is a path building game in the Wend family for two or more players. Players place tiles to extend their path from a start point towards a target end point. The object of the game is to be the first player to get their path to a predetermined end point – typically a specific edge of the table, or an end point tile.

Contents
4 or more Player pieces
1 or more sets of Wend tiles, each consisting of 35 Playing tiles and 1 Start/end tile

Wend tiles are square in shape, and have 2 path entry/exit points on each edge. They each have four path sections which go from one path entry/exit point to another. When placed side by side, the path sections from one tile join up with those on the adjacent tile, to create meandering paths. There are 35 Wend tiles in a set, which includes one copy of all possible combinations of 4 path sections on a tile. A 36th ‘start/end’ tile is also included in a set, which is used by some games in the Wend family, including Wend-edge. This tile has 8 short path sections (used as starting or ending points), two on each edge.

You will find that a single set of 35 Wend tiles is enough for a good game with 2-4 players. There is no hard and fast limit to the number of players in a game, but most players would probably want a reasonable number of tiles, and thus moves in the game. You can use extra sets of Wend tiles to accommodate more players or for a longer and more challenging game with a small number of players. Wend tile sets come with different coloured dots in each corner, so that it is easy to put tiles that have been shuffled together back into sets.
mechanics: Network and Route Building, Tile Placement

name: Pyramids and Flags
description:
Pyramids and Flags is a game for 2 to 4 players with one Rainbow and one Xeno set of Treehouse pyramids to play it. Out of these pyramids, players put together flags of specific countries from all over the world. Apart from the pyramids and the pack of 36 goal cards, you do not need anything else.

Move a pyramid to create a flag!

Complete rules are available at the author's website, and at the Icehouse Wiki.
mechanics: Point to Point Movement, Set Collection

name: BattleTech: Historical ‚Äì Operation Klondike
description:
Publisher Blurb:

In the wake of the Star League’s collapse, Aleksandr Kerensky led the bulk of the SLDF into deep space to escape the inevitable Succession Wars. But war soon came to the "Star League in Exile" anyway, prompting General Kerensky’s son Nicholas to form a new society, based on the principles of honor and strength. Fifteen years later, the newborn Clans were unleashed against those who abandoned Kerensky’s vision.
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Role Playing, Variable Player Powers

name: Flintloque (Third Edition): Grapeshotte ‚Äì Expansion Book
description:
Grapshotte is an expansion book for 3rd edition Flintloque rules and you will need one of the other game books to use them (War in Catlucia, Death in the Snow, Bier and Bones or Blood on the Sand).

The expension rules contants rules on artillery, mines, weather, sappers, new trooper types and new skills etc.. Also it lists new equipment for each race.
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Napoleonic, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Role Playing, Variable Phase Order

name: Mercado de Arte: S√¥nia Menna Barreto
description:
User Summary:
The players should buy and sell paintings of Sônia Menna Barreto, the only Brazilian artist to have one of her works (Leonard Chesire) included in the art collection of the British Royal Family. To win the game, a player should acquire at least 3 of 5 artworks depicted on his goal card. After that, the player tries to move his pawn to the Art Club space, where he receives the valuable artwork Leonard Cheshire. Then, the players check the value of all their possessions, including artworks, money and stores that sell the artist’s products, and who has the highest amount is the winner. Artworks and stores can be directly purchased from other players or by auctions or can be earned on special spaces on the game board.

name: The Battle of Gettysburg
description:
"The Battle for Gettysburg" is the 2nd game in the "Orders of Battle" series of games.

17 x 22" map
120 Counters
1 Time Record/OOB
1 Tables & Charts
1 Order of Battle reference
12 Orders Cards

The game is divisional in scale. Orders are issued to individual corp via the Order Cards. It is an impulse based system, but not random. Players choose which Corp to activate and based on the Orders card that was placed under the Corp leader counter at the beginning of the turn (hidden to the opponent), that Corp takes action then play passes to the other player.
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Hexagon Grid, Simulation

name: Nestortiles DUEL
description:
Nestortiles DUEL

A Nestortiles game for 2 players by Néstor Romeral Andrés.

INTRODUCTION

Nestortiles DUEL is a dice building and dice combat game for 2 players. You’ll need one set of Nestortiles in order to play it.

DEFINITIONS

The value of a tile is the number of pips on that tile.

SETUP

Place all the Nestortiles face-down in the middle of the playing surface (drawing area) and shuffle them.
If this is the first game, the starting player is determined randomly. If not, the player that lost the previous game starts.
The game is played in 2 phases.

DICE BUILDING PHASE — This phase is played in turns.

On your turn, you must do one of these two things:


Draw a tile from the drawing area and place it face-up before you or...
Discard one of your tiles face-down (first show it to the other player) and draw as many tiles from the drawing area as the value of the discarded tile (You can't draw the discarded tile itself). The value of the discarded tile must be lower than the number of tiles left on the drawing area.


If, after drawing the tiles, you have 6 or more tiles, you must build a die. To do this, choose 6 of your tiles and assemble them into a die, and discard the rest face-down to the drawing area.
If the drawing area has no tiles left, the dice building phase ends.

COMBAT PHASE — Before this phase starts, 9 or 10 dice should have been built.

Both players roll their dice at once (try not to mix them).
Now, for each of the 10 colors, do the following:

Sum up the total value rolled for that color for each player. The player with the highest sum for that color gets 1 point.
In case of a tie, no points are scored for that color.


The player with the highest score after the 10 colors have been checked is the winner. In case of a tie, the player with the highest total sum (pips rolled on all dice) wins the game.

VARIANT

The discarded tiles are placed face-up.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Memory, Set Collection

name: Flintloque (The free editions)
description:
Flintloque is a Fantasy Black-Powder miniature wargame based on the Napoleonic Wars, where each fantasy race take the roll of one of the nations; Orcs are the British, Elves are the French, the Undead are the Russians etc...

The Publishers, "Alternative Armies" over the years have published versions of Flintloque that was given away free in magazines, flyers and as PDFs to advertised the game. Each version is fully playable but they are not full versions of the rules and are aimed to get people interested in the game, through the Flintloque Lite PDF version was also published as a companion to the "Flintloque Reloaded" rule book (see version entree for information).
publishers: Alector Limited, Alternative Armies, Crescent City Industries Limited

name: 8er-Bahn
description:
Math training game. The game consists of 60 cards with numbers from 1 to 12, 36 task cards and 12 special cards.
The number cards are shuffled and each player receives 5 of them. Another card is flipped open and placed on the table. Four task cards are openly laid out; they contain the operations +1, -1, *2, or /2. The active player can now place a card on the open card that fulfills one of these operations. On a 6, for example, a 5, a 7, a 3 or a 12 can be placed. This card is the base card for the next player. A player who has no matching card draws a new card. The goal is to be the first player to get rid of one's cards.

In other variants of the base game, the number of mathematical operations is increased in the course of the game, several operations can be combined, etc.

In an additional game with the same materials, players add cards on a pile, announcing the sum of the cards played. Whenever a player reaches a sum that can be divided by 5, he/she can take all the cards, unless the next player can also reach that task (in which case the latter takes all the cards, etc.).

(User summary by HilkMAN)

name: Lady Wintermores Fangs
description:
Lady Wintermore's Fangs is a scenario box set for the Flintloque game (a fantasy black-powder wargame). It consits of a background and scenario booklet (36 pages) and 16 miniatures.

The three scenarios in the booklet are set in the "Witchlands of Valon", where the Elves battle the forces of the Undead.

There is also a abridged set of Flintloque rules in the booklet.
publishers: Alternative Armies, Crescent City Industries Limited

name: Trafalgore
description:
Trafalgore (Fyre As She Bares) is a free supplement for the Slaughterloo and Flintloque games.

It has a story about a navel engagment between the Orcs and the Elves, and the rules for the Orcs sailors and Marines.

It was first published in a Alternative Armies news letter, but has also been relesed as a free PDF.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Napoleonic, Nautical, Wargame

name: Combined Arms
description:
This game is a tactical game that reproduces modern armored combat after the 1980's. The units are tanks, infantry, and helicopters. Each unit is one vehicle or platoon. The Advanced game adds more rules.

The represented countries are Japan, the United States, Britain, West Germany, the Soviet Union, and Israel.
The game can be played by 2 persons and up to 6.

Scale:

1 turn = 45 seconds
Hex = 150m
Unit = One platoon/vehicule


Components

1x Rulebook
4x Maps(200mmx550mm)
8x Chart
1000x Counters




Order of PlayBasic Game:
1.First player selection Phase
2.First player Movement Phase
3.Both Side Fire Phase
4.Second Player Movement Phase
5.Both Side Fire Phase

Advance Game:
1.Both Players of assaulting first decision Phase
2.Recovery Phase
3.First Player selection Phase
4.Second Player evasion movement Phase
5.First Player Suppression Fire Phase
6.First player Movement Phase
7.Both Side Fire Phase
8.Second Player Suppression Fire Phase
9.Second Player Movement Phase
10.Both Side Fire Phase

name: Sanitarium
description:
"My head...what happened? Who are these people? Who...am I? I am ...Alex... yeah, that’s right, Alex is my name. Can they hear me? No, get a grip, Alex! I’m not talking, I’m thinking. but how did I get here? what is this place? The test! yeah, that’s it! I was in a room taking part to a ...Rorschach test... what was the reason? Am I crazy? Was I performing the test or... taking it? And what are those people doing here? Maybe... the place looks like a hospital. Maybe I was injured. There is no pain though, no bruises maybe. either way, I am not taking my clothes off in front of these strangers to check on my body. Maybe I have a relation with them. Supposedly I have something to do to them... or they to me... I wonder what it is..."

Inside a mental institution, a group of people wakes up in the commons, the dining place of this sanitarium. nobody remembers how they got there. Amnesia. The only thing they remember is their names and an obscure scene of a Rorschach test. after searching the facility each one slowly begins to remember their role in this place... but that’s the easy part.

Sanitarium is a game in which, what you try to discover, is yourself! You try to remember, by gathering pieces of information and items in the facility, who you truly are and what's your purpose in the sanitarium. If you know who you are, then you have a purpose. If you fulfill your purpose, then you are the winner! This game is a tribute to all the b-movies that feature a main plot inside an abandoned hospital, asylum, sanitarium, medical building wing, or haunted medical lab.

The deduction mechanism of the game is very simple. It's allows you to bluff, in being one of the roles that exist in the game, until another player proves you wrong. If no one can prove you wrong then you fulfill your role's objective. There are six different objectives in the game that depend on the player's adopted role.

Sanitarium is best played with 3 to 6 players, but if you have a big group of friends it may be played with a maximum of 9 (if you don't bother with a little downtime, it repays in interactivity!).
categories: Bluffing, Deduction, Horror, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Battlecards: World Conflict ‚Äì North African Campaign: Expansion Pack 1
description:
Contents of each Expansion Pack:

1 top card (identifies Expansion Packs 1-5)
1 bottom card (identifies each card in the pack)
20 expansion cards (Arsenal & Conflict cards balanced to enhance game play and add new capabilities)
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II

name: Portito
description:
User Summary: The game is played by rolling five dice, and setting aside aside at least one scoring dice after each role, rolling only the dice that aren't kept for as long as the player keeps scoring. If, at any point, no dice rolled score, then all points set aside in that turn are lost, and the dice passed to the next player. Following any roll in which at least one dice scores, the active player may 'bank' the points accumulated that turn, and pass the dice to the next player. The next player then has the option of building on that score by rolling only the non-scoring dice, or picking up all five dice and starting from zero. At any time, the active player may call 'portito', which has the effect of flipping all dice following the roll: 1s become 6s, 2 become 5s, etc. The player remains 'portito' until calling 'normal', which they can only do when the dice are in their possession (so you remain 'portito' while the dice go round the players). The game continues until one player exactly reaches some pre-determined target score: 5000 or 10000 is common.

Scoring dice within each roll are as follows:
1 = 100 points
5 = 50 points
3 of a kind = dice score * 100

name: Snark
description:
A set collecting deck-building auction game, using the Rainbow Deck. A sister game to Boojum, which uses the same mechanics but with a Decktet.

Players bid on groups of cards to make sets of various descriptions. The bids are cards from the players' hands, which then get added to and become the lots for the next round of auctions. There are different types of sets to collect from familiar poker/rummy type sets like straights, flushes and full houses, to rainbow deck specific letter-based sets. The first player to collect one of each of the six set type tokens is the winner.

name: Seven of Seven
description:
Seven of Seven (S.o.S.) is a card game that has seven different ways to play! The main concept has to do with conflicts among Eternals which are divided in Archangels, Demons, Fortune Gods and Mortals which divided in the Sages of Ancient Greece and the Sages of China.
Each player is a Supreme Being which tries to manipulate mortals with the help of Eternals. Also, to make things more interests, you use the Seven Heavenly Virtues and Seven Deadly Sins to help in this endeavor.
In the end, the Seven Wonders help to take advantage of cards that already being used, for a small price. The Wonder is given to an opponent, and at the end of the game, the opponent benefits from the Wonders given to him.
But that's just for the first variation of the game!

The titles of the Seven of games of Seven are as follows:


Seven Supreme
Epta (by the greek number of Seven.)
Triptych
Revenge of Mortals
Iris
Heaven vs Hell
Voidance


Also, you might have understood by now, that all the cards in
this game are related to the number Seven. So, here's a list of
the games components:

7 Sages of Ancient Greece
7 Sages of China
7 Archangels
7 Demons
7 Fortune Gods
7 Heavenly Virtues
7 Deadly Sins
7 Wonders
1 Justice


Total of 57 cards.

name: Foxhole: Utah Beach
description:
Foxhole is a series of board wargames planned to cover a number of important battles of World War II and later those of other wars from the Napoleonic Wars to the War on Terror. Players assume the roles of Divisional or Corps commander. Although there are other ways to play the game, in the historical scenarios the goal is not to "win", but rather to do better than the historical commanders whose role the players have overtaken. The series' scale encompasses both the Operational and Tactical levels. Although the product is a wargame its publishers prefer to call it a simulation. It is developed by game designer Glenn Davis and published by Diffraction Entertainment, Ltd. based in Scotland, UK.

Foxhole's first product Utah Beach can be played by two to six players, while future installments are to allow additional players.

The product comes with three ways to play the game:
1) The historical scenario that comes with each product where the goal is to do better than the historical results,
2) A competitive (called tournament-style in the rulebook) system with over two dozen orders similar to Warhammer 40k like sieze and hold, rearguard action, etc. where your goal is to "beat" your opponent to the goal. Interestingly, in this version you each take one of the hexagonally shaped maps, set up your forces, and then push them together, giving you a bit of fog of war.
3) TSWW conversion: Although seemingly not fully supported in the original product, the rulebook implies that with later releases of TO&E data players will be able to play out TSWW battles at the Foxhole scale, giving gamers the first opportunity ever to play out World War II at the company scale ... everywhere.

As for playing the game; the following is ripped straight from the rulebook: "A Primer on Foxhole™ in 400 Words or Less
Each Player Turn consists of 6 essential Phases:

Supply-Movement Phase: Units which are adjacent to enemies, plan on firing an artillery barrage or conduct an Activity this turn must Trace Supply instead of do anything this Phase. Otherwise they may move as usual.
Barrage Phase: Barrages may be fired this Turn by Sorties and Artillery. In the case of Artillery, they must have Traced Supply in the prior Phase and not move in the next in order to do so. Note that the Reacting Player may also be able to fire Barrages.
Activities-Movement Phase: It is during this Phase and only if the Unit Traced Supply in the Supply-Movement Phase that Units may conduct Activities other than Movement such as digging entrenchments, demolishing them, bridges, etc., crossing a river or un-pin a Vehicle Platoon (which represents Vehicles bogged down). Units may also move unless they fired a Barrage in the prior Phase.
Combat Phase: There are two kinds of Combat and each hex may be attacked only once. Assaulting allows Units to enter and, if successful, secure a hex. Its disadvantages are that it allows the opposing Player to make Covering Fire against your Assaulting Units, you have less terrain benefits and are limited to 4 Units Assaulting the Hex. By contrast, Fights allow Units to attack enemy Units from range and has none of the above hindrances, but cannot secure a Hex and is less likely to do serious damage to the opposition.
Motorized Movement Phase: Motorized Units are all Vehicle Platoons plus any other Unit with the little wheels at the bottom. Any of such Units can move during this Phase. In lieu of moving, they may instead make a 50/50 attempt to Un-pin themselves from the hex (but they couldn't have moved anyway).
Vehicle Assault Phase: During this Phase Vehicles Platoons (not all Motorized Units) may make Assaults.
Full Turn: A Full Turn consists of Weather Determination and Forecasting followed by a Player Turn from each Player. The Offensive Player always goes first, which is also the Allied Player in the Utah Beach Historical Scenario. There are three Full Turns each Day representing the Morning, Afternoon and Night. Preceding each Morning Turn and the beginning of the day both Players should conduct a Dawn Briefing." - Foxhole Rulebook, page 36.


The only thing the above misses is a fun little weather forecasting and resolution where players forecast the weather two turns ahead of time, and it may or may not actually end up being the weather they thought it was going to be (but *probably* will), adding a lot a pressure/tenseness as the commanders look overhead to see whether those clouds will clear up, start a drizzle, or remain overcast as predicted.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Secret Unit Deployment, Simulation

name: The Greatest Invasion in History
description:
Desk top publishing from TDF.

The game covers the whole season of "Ultraseven" TV series.
https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ultraseven

The invasion player controls all of the aliens which appeared in the TV series. He can get the cards from the deck then allocate his action points to place the alien, and proceed its invasion.
If the invasion comes to the determined amount, then it must be revealed and could be farther proceeded.

The Seven player can search hidden invasion by placing TDF members in each area. Once the invasion is revealed, he can attack them with TDF members or Ultraseven.

The game continues until the invasion succeeds or all invasion are destroyed by the Seven player.

10 sheets of cards
rulebook
markers
categories: Card Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction

name: The Truckers version 1.5 tune-up kit
description:
Expansion kit for The Truckers 1st edition user.
Thus please see description of the original game about game-play and goal.

You should replace the original map with this new map.
Rules are revised and tuned-up 1st edition into high spec more enjoyable game!

components
1 new map board
1 round marker
5 order markers
1 new rule sheet

Main changing

Enhanced player-interaction with scrambling containers
Truck-introducing rule changed more flexible
Reduced disadvantage of First Player
Forbidden Negotiation
The game will end after 2nd player reached the goal, not 1st player.
Simplified and some adding of Scoring
Introduced Score Track around the game board
mechanics: Pick-up and Deliver, Set Collection, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Lock 'n Load: Heroes of the Faith
description:
Lock ‘n Load: Heroes of the Faith brings the famous Lock ‘n Load system to the war-torn hills of the Golan Heights. It’s October of 1973 and the Israelis and Syrians battle viciously to control the thin strip of land that separates the two countries.

This is a complete, Lock ‘n Load module. Lead Israeli Centurions, Super Shermans, and infantry as you fight against the Syrian’s troops, and the Soviet-made T-62 and T-55 tanks. Eight scenarios cover everything from small infantry skirmishes to some of the largest tank battles yet depicted in the Lock ‘n Load system.

—description from the publisher

name: Suburbia
description:
Suburbia is a party game in which players have to complete activities in each of the eight catagories in order to successfully move their pawn around the board. The catagories are:

-Acting Out: Act out the answer without talking or making noises.
-Ambidoodle: Draw with your non-dominant hand without talking...
-Brain Clutter: Trivia questions
-Common Thread: Figure out what three words have in common
-Mixed Messages: Unscramble letters to make up an anwser.
-Noise Violations: Make noises without talking or using words or gestures.
-Scribbles: Draw without talking...
-Unmentionables: Give descriptions without revealing the word.
mechanics: Acting, Line Drawing, Paper-and-Pencil, Pattern Recognition, Team-Based Game

name: Toy Story: Toys Power!
description:
From The Rules:

Woody is missing!
Let us run to the rescue! Nice cowboy disappeared. All toys have decided to organize a team and find a lost friend. It's difficult and dangerous job, on way awaits them a lot of surprises and bad ambushes. Take the challenge! Lean more about the disappearance and more friends will join your team, the greater the chances to find Woody and win!

To start the game
Choose a player token and place it on the "Start" field.

Objective
To collect the biggest amount of tokens - points.

Gameplay
Youngest player will start. You move by rolling the dice and collect token when moving. Every place on board has a token, until it is removed for some reason. Then the place get unactibe or contains a picture, which hold a surprise or a trap.

STOP - think about things and miss a turn
DICE+1 - Roll again to find Woody faster

+ 3 - step three extra steps

YELLOW STAR - take free token

The game has many paths to choose from. Some tokens contains special abilities like extra move or one less move, which help you to collect more token when you move around the board. When the last token has been collected, it means, that Woody now has been found and the race to the finish line now begins. While the race is on to the finish, player who lands one the DICE+1 space, can roll the dice and that to the final score or move the number rolled ahead. The first one to reach the finish will get all unused tokens next to the game board. If there aren't any left, can roll dice and take the amount of tokens from other players.

PS! Tokens with picture of Cowgirl, Woody and Buzz gives 2 points, while all the other ones 1 point.

Count the score and the one with the biggest score is the winner and hero who saved Woody!
categories: Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Pick-up and Deliver, Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Civil War Commander
description:
Civil War Commander is a card game, in which you are a Brigidier General for either the Union or the Confederate army. You have command of 5 regiments consisting of infantry companies, artillery batteries, and cavalry troops.
Your mission is to hold 5 sectors of terrian either by defending or capturing them. How you deploy your given troops, how you use your reserves, and the abilities of your regimental commanders will determine the outcome.
Win and you'll be a hero and may be promoted. Lose and you may be removed from command. Such is the life of a CIVIL WAR COMMANDER.

(From Publishers Website)

name: Bakugan: Torneio dos Mundos
description: "Bakugan: Torneio dos Mundos" is a contest to see which player can win more tournaments in the 6 worlds of "Bakugan Battle Brawlers". Each round, a world is randomly chosen. Players then select one Bakugan card from their hands, and then one "special effects" card. All variables are added up and the owner of the most powerful Bakugan places a token on the world where the tournament was played. The first player to achieve a number of victories wins the game (text by the game's designer).

name: Weird N.J. Trivia Game
description:
From the back of the box:
Actual inscription on a NJ tombstone: "I told you I was sick. And get off my grave."
FACT or FICTION?
In this fast-paced trivia game, your aim is to blitz the competition and amaze them with your knowledge about the local legends and best kept secrets of the State of New Jersey.

From the day to day, to the truly bizarre, you will be asked the one question that really counts -- is it FACT or FICTION?

Watch out for the crazy Rush Hour where you can earn double points if you're fast enough and if you stop laughing for long enough.

Take the challenge, put on your thinking cap, and remember: it comes down to two words -- FACT or FICTION!

name: Rabaseiklus (Adventure of Fen)
description:
Board game about Estonian fens nature.

In Estonian fens there are many interesting animals, birds, insects and plants.A group of explorers have made a decision to go to fen and find most interesting species. Moving in fen isn`t easy, You have to build boardwalks and observation platforms. But you have to be careful because any time can come freshet an destroy your roads and platforms.

On the game board there are 81 squares (9 X 9), in the middle of the board there is a starting square and the rest of the board is partly covered by 12 squares with animals, birds, insects and so on. At the start players must divvy up these 12 squares and then they start to build roads from starting square to the animals, birds, insects that they've got. For that they use various road tiles. Player who connect all of his squares with animals, birds, insects to the starting square is the winner.
mechanics: Hand Management, Network and Route Building, Tile Placement

name: BattleTech: Historical Turning Points ‚Äì Galtor
description:
From the back of the book: Several years before titanic events erupted into the Fourth Succession War, the last significant battle of the Third Succession War took place in 3025, on the sleepy, border world of Galtor.

Hanse Davion, Prince of the Federated Suns, attempted to regain control of the stalemate along his border with House Kurita by leaking the existence of a fake hidden Star League cache on Galtor. Once the Dragon took the bait, House Davion forces would spring their trap. Yet when a real Star League cache is found, all bets are off and Davion forces are fighting for their lives, while attempting to secure the ancient ruins that could hold ancient treasures!

Historical Turning Points: Galtor extracts the sourcebook details from the classic Galtor Campaign scenario book and represents it in the phenomenally successful Jihad Turning Points PDF exclusive format. Return to an earlier time in BattleTech history, when centuries of Succession Wars have honed an animosity to a razor's edge between the Great Houses of Davion and Kurita! This campaign series uses the Chaos Campaign rules and gives players the option of fighting individual battles, following a campaign arc, inserting it into their own campaigns and even create their own scenarios. This PDF exclusive includes a detailed map of the world of Galtor, a run down of the forces involved in the conflict, and several tracks that players can use to run simple lance-on-lance battles, or stage up to a world-wide invasion. Only the players' imaginations are the limits.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Role Playing, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game

name: Deadly 60 Trading Card Game
description:
From the Childrens BBC 'Deadly 60' television program comes the official card game.

Collect 165 different cards of the worlds deadliest creatures and face them off against one and other using the stats printed on the card.

Each card contains a picture and name of a deadly animal, along with their stats based on 'Size, Speed, Weapons and Deadliness'. Also on each card is a 'Deadly Fact' about the animal.

Play three different types of games, Deadly Attack, Skull Strike and Habitat Hunt. All game rules and more information can be found at www.deadly60cards.com

Available as 8 card randomized booster packs.

Though similar to Top Trumps, this game differs in its various play-styles as well as collectible format.

name: Trivial Pursuit: Danmarksudgave
description:
A supplement to the famous Trivial Pursuit game.

A trivia game where players try to collect 6 pieces by answering questions in 6 different categories. In this Danish edition players try to answer questions about Denmark.

Contents:
- 250 question cards in Danish
- rules
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Party Game, Trivia

name: Target: Il gioco del marketing
description:
Target is the first italian game about simulated application of a geo-demographic system of market segmentation.
It is based upon commercial opportunity: not only sell items, but sell them at higher price.
From 2 to 6 players compete with selling abilities to achieve better commercial opportunities.
The main board represnts a virtual city and is segmented into 3 areas: Center, Suburbs and Hinterland.
Different areas have different customers... and different customers need different goods.
(user summary from original booklet)

name: The Curling Game
description:
In this card driven simulation of the game of Curling, players are given a number of cards representing curling shots, with each position (lead, second, third and skip) having its own distinct set of cards. Two cards per position will be played, in order, over a series of eight ends. As each position will have sixteen cards available, care must be taken in how the cards are managed.

As cards are played, disks (representing curling stones) are added or removed from the board, representing the results of the 'shot' taken. A good deal of leeway is allowed in the position of the stones. This is important, as some cards will be able to affect stones in some positions, but not others.

In this way, choosing your shots and placing your markers, players can utilize (and learn) actual curling strategy.

Advanced rules has one player on each team acting as the skip or captain. This player calls for the shot, and the shooter (active player) must try to play a card matching the shot.

name: War in Rio
description:
User Summary: What originally was intended to be just a bad joke and a infamous critique against the chaotic situation of violence caused by the continued struggle for power between the government and the several organized crime groups in the city of Rio de Janeiro can become the first wargame situated in an authentic Brazilian context... if it would ever come to be published!

War in Rio is a politically incorrect wargame based in the traditional Risk. The main rules and mechanics from the classic wargame remain all the same, but the original board is replaced by one depicting the city of Rio de Janeiro. This new board is divided in 42 "favelas" - how the slums and shanty towns are called in Brazil -, which are arranged in six different sections, following the geopolitical areas of the city of Rio de Janeiro.

In addition, the colored armies now represent the different groups struggling to control the "wonderful city". Two colors represent the government forces: black is the "BOPE" (Special Police Operations Battalion) and blue is the "Polícia Militar" (Military Police). Three colors represent the major criminal organizations in Rio: red for "Comando Vermelho", green for "Terceiro Comando" and yellow for "Amigos dos Amigos". The white pieces represent the several other militias "Milícias" that also play a role in the urban war.

Fabio Lopez, the Brazilian designer who created the game, has already informed that he didn't intend to publish the game or even share it for free. His purpose with War in Rio was solely "to generate a discussion through a shameless invitation to enjoyment." However, such an original idea could not be ignored by Brazilian players and several anonymous fans soon joined forces to recreate the map and the cards based in the original photos posted by Lopez in his blog.

Given the subversive status of this idea, this game probably will never be officially published.
categories: Humor, Print & Play, Territory Building, Wargame
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Area Movement, Dice Rolling, Set Collection

name: Data Fortress
description:
Data Fortress is set in the virtual reality version of the Internet. In this reality, corporations maintain vast data fortresses that act as their servers and storefronts in cyberspace. Users of cyberspace plug their minds into this world wide reality to work, be entertained, or socialize. While the daily use of cyberspace holds the world's attention, beneath the surface rests the world of hackers and those who stand against them.

In Data Fortress, two players pit themselves against each other in an attempt to either crash a company's data fortress or to defend it. One player takes control of the Hacker, entering the area through the use of hidden Jack Points while the other player sets up the defensive protocols of his company's data fortress. The Hacker initializes and maneuvers his programs through cyberspace attempting to crash the defensive programs on his way to destroying all protection the Central unit has over its data. Meanwhile, the Admin brings his own programs to the fray as he holds off the Hacker until the rest of the Sys-Admins can log into the network. A truly skilled Admin can even trace the Hacker back to his actual Jack Point and crash the connection.

The game uses 54 tiles that represent programs, computer network and Jack Points. During a player's turn, he will be able to move a tile and play a tile in either order. Results of program-on-program interaction is based on the strength of all tiles that form a solid line to the interaction. The Hacker and Admin utilize different programs that have their own movement and abilities in this asymmetrical tile maneuvering game.
mechanics: Hand Management, Secret Unit Deployment, Tile Placement

name: High and Low
description:
A betting game made to emulate an 1800's style bar betting game where there would be no "bank"

The starting player rolls two dice. They're placed to the side and their total is noted. In clockwise order, players place bets as to whether their roll will be higher or lower than the first roll. Maximum bet is the number of players in the current round. Minimum bet is 1. Then in clockwise order the players roll the die again. If their total is higher than the original noted roll they take the "High" bets. If their total is lower than the original noted role they take the "Low" bets. On a roll that matches the original noted roll they take both piles.

When players tie for high and low they must split evenly leaving the remainder in the betting pools. If a player or players roll a match then no "High" or "Low" players win and all bets are divided equally among winners leaving remainders in their original betting pools.

name: Heian Shogi
description:
From the rules found on pg 15 of this document, a document with citations by Nader Daoud Daou (made free by the author for non-commercial distribution).

The game is a traditional Japanese game of the chess family which can be played with an international chess set. It is of the shogi branch of the chess family but does not involve drops. Set-up is on the back row identical to international chess except that king is placed on the center left column for either player so that kings are not facing each other. Pawn however occupy the third rather than the second row.

For simplicity, I'm using the international chess names of pieces rather than the traditional Japanese names. The king moves one space in any direction but castling does not exist. The queen moves one space in any direction except diagonally backwards. Bishops move either one space diagonally in any direction or one space forward. Knights move only forward in an otherwise normal knight's move so that the piece jumps to a space on either side of the space two rows ahead of its starting position. Rooks move only forward but otherwise like a standard rook. Pawns move only one space forward with no initial two-step move, and all pieces including pawns capture as they move.

The promotion zone is the last three rows on the board for either player. All pieces except the king and queen promote to the queen. Promotion is optional so long as a piece still has a legal move in its non-promoted state. The promotion happens at the end of the move and the move must either begin or end in the promotion zone.

The object is to check-mate the opponent's king. Both bared king and stalemate count as a win, but a bared king becomes a draw if the other player can bare one's king in the next move.

name: Tausend Zahlw√∂rter
description:
The game consists of 50 number cards and 60 numeral cards. There are various ways to play with these, aimed at children with dyscalculia issues, but grown-ups can also play this.
The main rule set requires players to just use the numeral cards. The game starts with one card on the table. Now the players take turns either adding a card from their hand or replacing a card with one or more card(s) from their hand. The only condition is that the numeral on the table has to get bigger each time. A player who cannot increase the number on the table loses a point and the cards are dealt again. The maximum number that can be achieved with the included cards is nine hundred ninety nine thousand eight hundred and ninety eight (which is one word in German).

(User summary by HilkMAN)
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Educational, Math

name: My Little Vineyard
description:
A print-and-play dice (and resource management) game of making wine. All that is required is a lot of 6-sided dice, and a score sheet for each player.

Players roll a bunch of dice to create a central communal pool, and then take turns pulling out groups of dice from the center pool of dice to buy supplies. Eventually, a player will have enough supplies to make a barrel of wine and score points.

However, the trick is that since the center pool of dice is constantly dwindling, a player has to plan accordingly, since on future turns the dice pool may not have the correct kinds of dice that a player needs to get the desired supply he wants.

A new addition in the market board, which makes the timing of selling your wine all the more important.


The game is up to version 7 or something, but the game is now strong enough that I refuse to call it a beta anymore. I have placed all of the files into a single zip file, as linked below:

http://www.boardgamegeek.com/filepage/66776/my-little-vineya...

name: The Longest Day in Sengoku
description:
This is expansion kit of the "Sengoku Gunyuden" series.
NB: "Sengoku no Ichiban-nagai-hi" means the Longest day of the Warring States (Sengoku) period.

"The Longest Day in Sengoku" covers the major battle of Sekigahara, popularly known as the Battle for the Sundered Realm. This kit requires all 7 series game map for play.

Four scenarios are included in this kit. "Campaign of Keicho 5" is a historical campaign game for all 7 series maps. "Ishida Mitunari's Dream" is a fictional campaign game with no use of betrayal„ÄÄrules. "Longest day of the Warring States Period" is a short game on the battle of Sekigahara and only requires map number 5. "Punitive expedition against the Uesugi clan" is a fictional short game on the Eastern army invasion of the Uesugi territory.

Each players control one or more clans. The clan's combat units are organized into troops.
The game repeats the game turn decided by the scenario. There are four action stages in each game turn. The number of stages where each troop can act is decided by commander's activation ability. In the action stage, each troop selects one action. The action that can be selected are movement, field combat, siege, moral recovery, reorganization and replacement.

The victor of the games is the player receives the most victory points. The victory point are provided by the control of the castle and the removal of the enemy units.

SCALE:
each map hex is roughly 6000 meters. Each game turn represents one week of real time; each land combat unit about 500-1000 soldiers and each naval unit about 200 ships.

name: Muzundrum
description:
Muzundrum is a game of creating musical triads and scales by placing 12-sided musical dice on a hexagon-based playing board.

From the publishers' website:

Muzundrum is a crossword-style game of music theory developed by composer J S Kingfisher. Players interlace 12-sided musical dice to form scales and triads on a giant honeycomb, forming unique tonal weaves... it’s great for beginners, challenging for pros, and always mind-bending fun!

In the box

21 Twelve-sided Musician’s Dice
The Honeycomb Gameboard
Embroidered dice pouch
Instruction Booklet

Number of players, time required

Muzundrum can be played by 1 to 4 musicians of any age (see “knowledge required” below); or by 2 to 4 teams of musicians (playing in teams allows musical novices to learn from their more experienced partners). The average game lasts 15 to 30 minutes.

Object of the game

In Muzundrum, players intertwine triads with scales, rather like a musical crossword puzzle (albeit a three way one). Triads are built vertically; scales are built diagonally. Points are earned as players add to or complete triads and scales; double and triple scores are earned when dice are played in the “honeypot” cells (the ones marked with 2’s and 3’s). The game is over when all of the dice are played; points are then tallied, and the player or team with the most points wins.

Knowledge required

A basic working knowledge of key centers, major scales, and triad construction is needed to play Muzundrum – all stuff taught in first-year Music Theory classes and by most private music instructors. In addition to being a heap o’ fun, Muzundrum is quite educational: it’s a great way to become fluent in all 12 keys.

name: Magical Strike
description:
From the rules: Magical Strike is a free cooperative miniature figure game inspired by anime series Strike Witches.

Defend the Earth! Only the teenage Witches, with the help of 1940’s best flying technology the Striker units, can stop the alien Neuroi invasion. Fly over the massive Neuroi, clearing beam points, while searching for the core. Hurry, to the core segments and destroy them before the Neuroi reaches your home base! Each turn the Neuroi will charge up its deadly beams and attack any Witches that get too close!

Magical Strike is a team game. One or more players try and beat the Neuroi, while it responds according to the game rules. You all win or lose together!

Everything you need to play can be found online here:
https://docs.google.com/document/edit?id=1axUiJQdptkzo2JK1Db...;hl=en#
categories: Miniatures, Print & Play, Science Fiction, World War II
mechanics: Action Points, Cooperative Game, Hand Management, Modular Board, Variable Player Powers

name: Balloon Tycoon
description:
Balloons make people happy, and making people happy can make a fella rich. So naturally you want more balloons! ... But there’s a string attached (actually many strings) ... because so does everyone else.

In Balloon Tycoon players try to build collections of balloons (by linking similar coloured balloons together) to fulfill a particular game winning goal ... but beware! ... that goal can change at any moment.

Game play is simple. On your turn you take a card and then you play a card. But what card will you play? Will you play a Balloon Card to build up your collection? Will you play an Action Card to wreak havoc on your opponents? Or will you play a Goal Card so you can win?

Just remember, what goes around comes around! And other players can win with your Goal just as easily as you can!
categories: Abstract Strategy, Card Game, Print & Play
mechanics: Open Drafting, Set Collection, Tile Placement

name: Peregrinus
description:
The XVII. the king scented the plans of the noblemen conspiring against it in England on a century's waist, that down it wants to be repelled from the throne. He deprived all those, who were getting involved in a suspicion, of their title, their property and their name because of this. As a last opportunity, offered it to the ones driven into the exile in order for them to prove their innocence, that who gets into the utmost nook of his realm as the first, it proves it with his desperation, worthy that way, that gets back his goods taken away. Your rivals will make your road harder, save up at what more thalers, that give yourself to benefits and be able to hold back your adversaries.

Be the most resolute one and reach the aim, the long one and tiring one firstly on a road, defying the obstacles, that regain all that, from which falsely bereft!

Peregrinus is a game that is still under development and just before publishing. Consequently, the rules are not complete yet but are still changing. In the game you have to come up with different colour combinations with four cards, and you can proceed in the game with these combinations. You can collect money, points, action cards and treasures. All this will be converted into victory points at the end of the game. You can create obstacles for your opponents, and you can turn the action cards into your advantage but can also annoy your opponents with these cards.

The aim of the game is to collect the most VPs

name: Nagashino Shitaragahara
description:
Issue game of Wargame Japanese History #7.

Small card-driven game covering a famous battle during the Sengoku era.
In 1575, Katsuyori Takeda ((Ê≠¶Áî∞ ÂãùÈ†º) invaded Mikawa controlled by Ieyasu Tokugawa (Âæ≥Â∑ù ÂÆ∂Â∫∑). Nobunaga Oda decided to reinforce Tokugawa. He fought Takeda's traditional horsemen with innovative tactics and arquebusiers.
http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Battle_of_Nagashino

Takeda must conquer the Nagashino castle before the game ends and Tokugawa must prevent him to succeed.

Components:

1 map
80 counters
4 pages rulebook
30 cards
2 dice
mechanics: Area Movement, Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Dice Rolling

name: Platarot
description:
Choose your EVOKER and evoke powerful ENTI to defeat your rival. ENTI (plural for ENTIS) are powerful beings from another realm, the Dream Realm, who aid you in battle. You can also call upon hordes of monsters in the meantime to protect and strike for you!

Basic Play Rules

-Each player must have a deck of at least 30 cards. At least 1 of those cards MUST be an EVOKER card. The minimum is 30 but you may have more, as many as you wish.

-There are no doubles allowed of EVOKER or ENTIS cards (you may have 2 cards of the
same name as long as the illustration is different) but you may have up to 3 copies of all MONSTER/BOSS and SKILL cards.

-Each player starts with 90HP.

Select an EVOKER to start then shuffle your deck and draw 5 cards (this applies to both starting players).

Roll a dice to see who plays their EVOKER first. If its you draw a card and play an ENTIS or MONSTER/BOSS card(s). You may not attack on your 1st turn (this applies to both starting players).
When both players have set-up defenses, ENTIS or MONSTER/BOSS card(s) then another dice roll is done and whoever has the highest dice roll may attack and have their 2nd turn.

After that, turns just alternate accordingly.

How a Battle Turn Goes...
1.Draw a card.
2.Play an EVOKER, ENTIS and/or MONSTER/BOSS card(s).
3.Play any Add-Ons or SKILL cards.
4.Attack (Enter Battle Mode)
5.Play ONLY any other SKILL cards you wish.
6.Turn end.

An Encounter (the entire course of your game) proceeds until one of you loses all their HP or a player can no longer draw cards.

02/02/11

NEW**



Theme Decks out!
Starlit Night Deck: Use a deck brimming with the chaotic energy of the stars!

Harness the unpredictable power of the stars (Star-Type Cards) in this all new strategically structured theme deck. Use "Affuse" to evoke and then re-evoke fallen Enti all the while playing lady-luck by using Star Monsters and their random, high-risk effect Abilities.

If you like to tempt fate (while using "Marlain" to redo your die rolls) then this deck is for you. Watch as your opponent's well laid plans crumble.

OR

Darkside Moon Deck: Decimate foes with raw power and the inverse strategy of dark matter!

Darkness and destruction await all those who face the power of the moon (Moon-Type Cards). This deck while lacking in Enti power relies on hordes of Monster/Boss Cards particularly "Cronie" a dark bird who returns automatically once defeated.

Master dark matter and increase your attack power, all the while using inverse tactics to raise your HP and reduce your opponents. Without having to lift a single finger...

name: Micronomic
description:
In Micronomic players bid for the initial class A buildings that will produce commodities (food, raw materials, money, basic workers, energy) and soon after, they will auction and build some of the class B ones. Once the University is operative, class C buildings come to the available pool. Once the Foundry is operative, class D buildings become available and whenever a class D building is operative, class E buildings will become available.

Every building is different and produces or transforms some commodity into another (skilled workers, manufactured goods, machines, Victory Points). Some buildings upgrade existing ones and players can force upgrades on unwilling building owners by investing in them and taking over the original building, leaving the original owner with the upgraded one.

First player to reach or exceed 50 Victory Points is the winner.

Micronomic is an economic game that can play in under an hour and it's also small in box size, unlike most economic games.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Commodity Speculation, Team-Based Game, Trading

name: Time Travel Chess
description:
Ever play a game of chess and say "I wish I hadn't made that move"? This chess variant allows you that possibility.

From the introduction, by G K Gifford:
"...A standard 8 x 8 chessboard and 32 piece set are used. But you may need two extra Kings for each side (or markers to represent them). To play face-to-face, i.e., over-the-board, you will need 5 score sheets for each player. Some of the sheets may go unused.

The object of the game is to checkmate your opponent, or to win by having one of your opponent’s Kings (or King) "Lost in Time" during his time traveling.

How to Play Time Travel Chess

Pieces move as in western chess. The difference is that they can travel forward in time up to 10 moves. In addition, the King can travel back in time up to 5 moves..."

name: Little Busters-EX: DOTABATA Ranking Battle
description:
The English name for this games is Little Busters-EX: DOTABATA Ranking Battle. As with other card games published by Arclight Games, this game follows the deck building system made popular by Dominion.

The theme of this Japanese card game is based on a 2007 Japanese visual novel and manga by the same name. According to Wikipedia, the story behind the game features a group of high school friends who go by the name, "Little Busters." Characters include Kudryavka N≈çmi („ÇØ„Éâ, "Kudo"), Rin Natsume, and Saya Tokido.
'Little Busters!' on Wikipedia

In similar style to the physical fights depicted in the visual novel, players of the card game battle classmates against each other armed with slapstick weapons like volleyballs, sea urchins, cats and eel pie to accumulate points to win the game.

The base game consists of 300 cards and a copy of the rules in Japanese.
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management, Open Drafting

name: Utopian Conflict
description:
Players compete to build the best society and struggle from the earliest technologies to the technology of today. They attempt to claim great people and achievements before the others can, use their technology more effectively, and eek out more VP points.

Each player starts with a small deck of cards that represents their society. To improve their society they build new settlements and research new technology. These cards get added to their own discard and their discard eventually becomes their new deck to draw from. There are many paths to victory and ways to gain VP.

The game takes place in a limited # of rounds and attempts to give all players equal footing with a means to claim first player in the round order. A timeline of cards changes the game priorities every time and indicates the # of rounds left in the game.

Players collect resources based on their cards throughout the game. Resources stay from turn to turn to allow you to build up between turns.

The game will also come with a role selection variant to increase the player interaction and replay-ability.
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management, Open Drafting

name: Battle of Kawanakajima
description: "Battle of Kawanakajima" is the 2nd postcard wargame published by Formosa Force Game. It simulates the 4th "Battle of Kawanakajima" during the warring states period in Japan. Two player lead Takeda and Uesugi army respectively. You can choose to move to adjacent area and fight happened in the are contain both sides army. Who accompolishes the victory condition in 5th turn wins the game.

name: Ti Rakau
description:
This Maori Stick Game is called 'Ti Rakau' in Maori.

This game is played with two people or, at a more advanced level, four people. Each player needs one pair of wooden sticks. Players kneel on the floor across from each other and hold their sticks straight up, ends touching the floor. In unison, they perform a series of movements with their sticks, tapping their sticks together or against their partner's, progressing to throwing a stick to their partner and catching the one being thrown to them.

The aim is to keep going for as long as possible without dropping your sticks.

The last person who hasn't dropped a stick is the winner!

name: ShuffleBowl
description:
Players alternate turns rolling pucks, bouncing them off two rubber bands and trying to land in a scoring area similar to curling or shuffleboard. The object of the game is to score exactly 21 points. (User summary from rule sheet)

The board is similar to the one used in Rebound but has two shooting lanes with players at opposite ends of the board.

name: Legend of the Dragon's Fortune
description:
Legend has it that once every hundred years a dragon descends from the sky and bestows a large fortune upon the magician who has the best control of the elements. It has been a hundred years since the last contest and mages from all over the land have gathered in anticipation. In spite of being a young mage you have proven your mettle by outlasting all but six other mages. Suddenly the skies are lit by a blinding light and out of the sky emerges the most magnificent of all creatures. The Dragon has arrived and perched on Mount Fuji, the legend is true! Your resolve has redoubled; the time to make your mark on the world and gain a fantastic fortune is close.

Can you keep your focus and control the elements to win?

Dragon's Fortune is a print and play set collection game. The player who can cast the right spells and score the most points wins. Dragon's Fortune can currently be printed via artscow.

Here are links to the artscow decks. You will need to print both decks to play the game.
Deck 1: Link coming soon!
Deck 2: Link coming soon!

name: ‰πù‰∏ÉÂºè‰∏≠Êà¶Ëªä (Type 97 medium tank)
description:
"Type 97 medium tank" is 4th game of "Tank Combat series". This game represent tactical tank to tank combat in„ÄÄPacific theater. This game include 29 Japanese tanks, 10 Russian tanks, 9 US tanks and 10 anti-tank guns.

Each player control one or more tanks and battle for opponent tanks or guns by scenario order.

Each turn divided 6 Impulse. Each impulse repeat movement then fire and overrun. Game proceeds very slowly, but near simultaneous progress with not pre-plotted.

SCALE : Each unit represent one AFV or one anti-tank gun. Each turn represent 30 seconds in real time.

name: Low Tanks
description:
Unauthorized, re-themed Parody of No Thanks!

It is an unofficial multiplayer parody version of the card game No Thanks!, which was created by Thorsten Gimmler. This parody is not associated with or endorsed by Thorsten Gimmler or any of the publishers.

As in No Thanks!, players are given the choice of taking a card or laying a chip on the card to pass. The player who takes the card also gets all of the chips that have been placed on it. At the end of the game, a player's score is the total of all cards taken (or the lowest card in a run of cards), less chips; lowest score is the winner

(Per the instructions included with the game.)

name: Quantum Legions: Vanguard
description:
The publisher's blurb:
Quantum Legions™ is a game of science fiction ground combat — or more specifically, a series of games simulating battalion-level conflict within the universe of the Thirteen Provinces.

Innovative command and combat mechanics allow players to quickly and easily fight out any number of battles of varying sizes, keeping the focus on tactics rather than rules. Though designed as a "hex-n-counter" board game, Quantum Legions can easily be adapted as a miniatures wargame. Details on how this can be accomplished are provided in the rulebook.

Finally, like most Majestic Twelve products, Quantum Legions includes rules for creating your own units so you can add to its exciting background, simulate your favorite movies and television shows, or create your very own universe!

Quantum Legions: Wargaming on an Epic Scale.

Additional Details:
Units are represented by counters with basic information (movement, range, attack dice, etc.) Players roll 2d6 for the number of command points available at the beginning of the turn. Command points are used to remove suppression markers, activate ordered units and place orders on units to activate on future turns. Combat is bucket of dice with the target number depending on the attack order and number of dice modified by the target's terrain.

The PDF includes five 11"x17" map sections. Two map sections are used in the basic scenario. Also included are 1" unit counters and 5/8" order and suppression markers.

name: Nooks
description:
Nooks is two-player abstract strategy game of area enclosure. The standard game is played on a regular hexagonal game board, divided into hexagons with 8 hexagons to a side. Players take turns placing walls in an attempt to enclosure small areas called nooks.

A wall is created by placing four stones on four empty cells that are aligned and connected, forming what is equivalent to a straight tetromino.

A nook is an enclosed area which can not contain a wall. An area can be enclosed by wall stones and/or the edge of the board.

Players get to place scoring stones in each cell of each nook created during their turn. The game ends when the game board is completely filled and the player with the most scoring stones on the board wins the game. Ties are not possible.

name: Juggler
description:
From the publisher's website: "JUGGLER is a word game for 2 to 6 players, played on a table with a special deck of 70 alphabetic cards (one letter per card, with a score value - E is worth 1, J is worth 8 ...etc). The Juggler card deck actually consists of two decks, one of 22 vowel cards with red backs and faces, the other of 48 black consonant cards.

Object/Overview

"A game comprises several ‘rounds’. At the start of each round, each player is dealt just seven of the black consonant cards; the remaining cards are placed face down on the table as two decks (one red, one black). Players play in turns around the table in a clockwise direction. The aim is to build the best word you can in your hand by drawing and discarding cards. If you turn your whole hand into a word, you can then ‘declare’, which means you stop the round, hoping to catch the other players with valuable cards they can’t use.

"After a player has declared, everybody else has just one more turn in which to make the best of their hand. When play comes back round to the declarer, all the players place their hand of cards onto the table, announcing their word for that round and scoring the total face value of all the cards they have used for their word (MINUS the total face value of any remaining unused in their hand). The scores for each round are recorded on paper and when any player’s running total hits 70 or more, the highest total wins. "

name: Epic Space Empires
description: Just the Epic Stuff!!! Quick playing Card game with a Space Empire theme. Timing and targeting are critical to combat. Use your Fleets to capture planets and defend them. a plethora of Worlds, Races, Governments, Technologies, and Fleet types all have a multitude of special traits and abilities with which to help you defeat your alien rivals.
mechanics: Hand Management, Open Drafting, Variable Player Powers

name: Khan: the Golden Yurts
description:
Promo expansion from Essen 2010. From the package:

Instead of an ordinary yurt, each player may also place his Golden Yurt once per game. If a conquer tile is built over this yurt, one yurt of the player in question is in any case (also) placed on the tile, regardless of which player has the majority. The Golden Yurt is then put back into the box.

name: Mobile Suit Gundam: Last Fight
description:
"Last Fight" is tactical space combat game based on Japanese TV animation series "Mobile Suit Gundam".

Each unit represent one humanoid weapons called mobile suits(MS). Unit ability isn't mentioned on the unit, and it is on the data cards.

Each player control one or few MS and aims at the destruction of the opponent's MS.

Players writes down the plan of the movement and the battle in the log. Then, that is disclosed and resolve at simultaneous. The law of the inertia acts on the movement in the outer space.
categories: Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction, Wargame

name: Ghosts of Iga
description:
Ghosts of Iga is a twenty-card expansion pack to be played along with the card and dice game ‘Seppuku’. This set introduces Shinobi (ninja) and their tactics. Iga was a province in feudal Japan and is considered the birthplace of the ninja.

The expansion pack consists of (20) cards. There are (4) Shinobi, (10) Tactics (3) Armaments, and (3) Action Cards.
categories: Adventure, Card Game, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Wargame
publishers: Epic Atom Game Lab, The Game Crafter, LLC

name: Black Jack Dice
description:
This is a dice game in Onsworld's Jackpot Dice series.
The game comes with five special dice that show an Ace, deuce, four, eight ten and Jack. There are also cards showing each of these denominations and four cards showing pay-offs.

A player takes on the role of banker and hands a die to another player to cast. After rolling the first die, that player decides how much to bet and subsequently decides whether to roll more dice, one by one, attempting to come as close to a total of twenty-one but not exceeding it. If he exceeds twenty-one the banker takes the player's stake, but if he stops below twenty-one, the banker then rolls two dice and attempts to beat or equal the player's roll. If the banker fails to equal the roll or goes bust, the player wins the appropriate amount as indicated on the cards.

Optionally, the players may play with side bets. For this purpose, the other cards showing card faces are laid out and players may bet on these faces appearing on the dice for each roll of the dice.

The instructions mention that other games in the Jackpot Dice series include Clipper, Crown and Anchor, Liar and Crossword Dice.

name: Le Super Morpion Tournant
description:
Le Super Morpion Tournant (The Great Turning Tic Tac Toe) is a "tri-dimensional turning tactical game" according to the label on the side of the game box. The game is 3D four-in-a-row game with some distinct differences from the common forms such as Score Four:

The game is for two or four players.
The game box contains a brief rule sheet in French, a game board, and 64 beads in four colors, 16 of each color.
The middle of the game board consists of a four by four array of 16 rods, the central four of which are placed on a turntable. Thus, the central four rods may be turned relative to the board. In the periphery of the game board is space for an additional 16 rods which may be arranged in the corners (four player game) or along the ends (two player game). Each rod is able to contain a stack of four beads.

At the beginning of the game each player starts out with 32 beads, eight of each color (two player game) or 16 beads, for of each color (four player game). All of beads are positioned at the peripheral rods at start.

On turn, each player is either placing one of his/her beads on one of the 16 central rods on the game board, or turning the central plate 90 degrees clockwise.

The objective of the game is to create alignments of four different colored beads. Each such alignment earns the player one point. The player with most points at the end of the game (when all the beads have been played) is the winner.

name: Paranoia
description:
Paranoia is a game of tiles fast-paced and furious. And that happens because there are no turns. As in a discussion without a moderator, where no one respects the word and all speak at once, in Paranoia all play at once. But, in the middle of this whirlpool, there are rules that everyone must respect and give the game a fair balance between the noise and reflection, between order and chaos ...

Initially, all players receive 10 hexagonal tiles and they must put them in their stand.

The objective is to be the first to play all your pieces.

name: Wend-maze
description: Wend-maze is a path building game in the Wend family for two to four players. The players use Wend tiles to construct a maze which they are trying to escape from. They have a series of actions they can take to place tiles, move or rotate them, switch the lights on or off, or move along the maze. They roll dice to determine the action they will take. The object of the game is to be the first player to escape from the maze.

name: Bcmll
description:
A word game based on the popular Catalan TV show "Bocamoll", aired by TV3 Televisió de Catalunya since 2007. Following the show structure, it is composed by six different tests on words: matching words with their definitions, guessing words from images and symbols, filling-in popular song lyrics with the correct words, deciphering SMS language texts, etc.

The game includes:
- board
- 500 cards
- 4 markers
- bag
- hourglass
- rules booklet
categories: Educational, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Word Game

name: Imperiale Strategie
description: A diceless game of strategy set in the Napoleonic era. The game comes with 3 maps: Austerlitz, Borodino and Villodrigo. The players manage one army each (either blue or white). These armies are identical with only the generals being different. The blue army appear to represent France and the white army seems more generic. This game uses a square pattern for the maps. Each square has a strength value depending of the type of terrain represented in it. For example, in squares representing plains, the cavalry unit are strongest, but it is rather different for the cities and wooded terrain types. Each army contains artillery, cavalry, infantry and guard units. The artillery units must be used by infantry or guard units, never alone. The objectives include the destruction of the opponent's army, eliminating the opponent's general or capturing cities.

name: Shahbol
description:
Shahbol is a cross between chess and football.
The game is played on a field size of 5x8 cells. Gates occupy the first and last row of the field.
Each player has 7 pieces: 3 forwards, 3 defense and a goalie, another figure depicts the ball. Players move the one piece per turn, trying to send the ball into the opponent's gate.

name: What Could Be Worse?
description:
Publisher Blurb:

What is worse? Addressing congress or being naked in public? Or addressing a naked congress? Or being naked, while addressing a naked congress? Or sitting on a baby?

These are the kinds of things you'll have to figure out when you play "What Could Be Worse?"

You and several of your friends (or maybe they're strangers, or maybe you're playing this in prison where the other people aren't quite strangers but don't really count as friends) take turns deciding what to compare your comparisons to.

Roll a die to figure out whether it's something Worse, Better, or As Bad As a card from your hand.

Then there's a lot of cards with funny crap on them, and whatever- there's no point teaching the game in a blurb. Buy the game, play it, laugh your butt off, and thank us later.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Simultaneous Action Selection, Voting

name: Huckepack durch die W√ºste
description:
Huckepack durch die Wüste - freely translated "Porters through the Desert" - is a adventurous dice game.

Game components:
- a cloth game board, 49 x 49 cm
- 4 sets of 3 wooden game pawns (12 in total)
- 1 die
- the rules

From the game:
Somewhere in Arabia, in a small settlement on the border of the never ending desert, a great tension can be felt. In the shadow of an old palm tree four bold nomad sons are planning a dare-devil adventure. What is their plan? Will they really try to cross the desert by the infamous west route? Don't they know the treacherous quicksand and all those other dangers which lie in wait for them? Have no fear! With cautiousness, good companionship and some luck this route is passable. Each caravan still has one place open - dare this adventure and join them!

The rules:
Each player has three pawns with which to reach the large oasis in the middle of the board. Pawns are moved by throwing the die. A pawn can get stuck in quicksand, and then has to be rescued by another pawn of the same player. (Optional: or by rolling a six.) A rescued pawn is carried on the back of the other to the next oasis, where the pawn which was stuck has to rest till another pawn ends its turn there, or a six is rolled by the player.

When a pawn ends its move on a field where another pawn already is, it can climb on the others back, and be carried/ported by it. This is possible with both your own or other players pawns. (Multiply carrying is allowed.) However: a carried pawn should hop off before reaching the next oasis, as once the porter reaches it, it will drop off all carried pawns in the oasis! And likewise with resting pawns from being stuck in the quicksand: formerly carried pawns will have to rest till another pawn ends its turn there, or a six is rolled by the corresponding player.

When a pawn ends it turn on a place from which a short track continues (shown by a road sign), this may be taken on the next turn. Any carried pawns are carried along.
To reach the end oasis, a pawn has to reach it, either by throwing the required number exactly or higher.

Winner of this adventurous journey is the player who has crossed the desert with his or her three pawns first.

name: Gauntlet
description:
Played on an 8X8 board, Gauntlet is a game of unequal forces.

White has six pieces centred on last row on one side of board.

Black has six in each adjacent side (2 sides for 12 pieces)

MOVEMENT - All stones move in just one direction one space at a time

The right Black stones move left,
The left Black stones move right,

The White stones move away from their start row.
White runner player moves first!
