On the game table there are five rows, labeled A to E, of treasure cards with numbers 2, 3, 4, 7 or –4. Each round, one treasure card is added to each row, and players secretly choose one of the rows and reveal their choices simultaneously. If two or more players choose the same row, they get nothing and the row is untouched. Players who are alone in their choice get all the treasure cards in that row. No player can choose the same row two rounds in a row.

Game lasts for 12 rounds, and at the end of the game, having three cards of the same value earns the player that many points. The player with the most points at the end wins.

Translated box back
You are thieves specializing in jewelry, and each night, you announce in beforehand which shop you are aiming at. But beware, only one thief can enter each shop per night. If another thief has chosen the same place, your pride won't allow you to share. And while others thieves are staring at each other, you have your chance next night… but don't forget that that's what everybody else thinks, too…!

name: Unfair Quest
description:
User summary
A semi-cooperative bluffing board game. Players each take the role of an adventure party member and help out defeating monsters. Once the game ends, each player puts forward the treasures that he has earned, however everyone is allowed to stash away anything he suspects the other players didn't notice him getting. Players can then accuse each other for not being honest, and anyone caught in the act has to pay a penalty. The player with the most treasures at the end wins.

Translated box back
Players cooperate to form a party and defeat the monster in the Lost Forest. When all is done, the gems that players have earned are all divided. But that's not wholly true. You are allowed to hide away the gems you believe your party members don't remember you getting. If you get away with it, you can keep it for yourself. And the player who have earned the most money wins.

name: Shake Spell
description:
A simple word game. Each player rolls the eight dice. Seven of the dice are white with a letter on each face. The eighth die is black and has a symbol on it such as a question mark. Just make a word that goes with the symbol.
The publisher describes it as a cross between Scrabble and Boggle.
The game comes in a carry case so it makes a good game to take on holiday.

name: Trivial Pursuit: Food & Drink ‚Äì Bite-Size
description:
Trivial Pursuit Bite Size ... Our favourite game now doesn't take a day to play! You can ask and answer 600 questions about ingredients, fast food, techniques and utensils, fine dining, drinks and world food.

This is another in the "Bite-Size" range of Trivial Pursuit games. It is intended as a portable travel game. The game is packaged in a wedge ("piece-of-pie") shaped box.

The game does not feature a game board, and thus, there is no roll-and-move mechanic. Instead, players roll the color-coded die, and answers a question matching the color rolled. If a player correctly answers a question, he may "go for a wedge" by answering another question in the same category. If he does so, he keeps that card. If the player answers a question incorrectly, it is the next player's turn. Play ends when a player has collected six cards/correctly answered 12 questions.

For 2 or more players.

name: Lost City
description: You and your guide travel through the jungle in search of map pieces that will lead to LOST CITY and the priceless DIAMOND. Return to Safari Village with the diamond and you WIN the game.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Open Drafting, Roll / Spin and Move, Tile Placement

name: Glob
description:
Positional strategy game originally authored for the Piecepack system where 2-4 players strive to connect a die or pawn orthogonally with a group of exactly five coins (orthogonally connected as well); this group must fulfil an extra condition (two coins matching the suit of the die, three coins matching the suit of the pawn).

The setup is the same for all game configurations: two players use two suits each, three players use their own suit and the remaining suit is used by all, four players use a suit each.

Players can in their turn play any coin onto the board, move any coin on the board over free spaces, or move their own die or pawn over free spaces or coins onto a free space.


The game underwent extensive revision between 2012 and 2013. Some rough edges were smoothed and three new features were added: a procedure for free setups, play on a closed surface and a tactical approach to offering draws.

name: Prik Pret
description:
There is a vertical 2-sided window with blocks between players with fishes and other sea creatures on the blocks.
Bottom of the window is 2 rotary dials where 2 pictures appear every round.
Both players run at the same time the rotary dial. If it stops, players must find four pictures which are on the two rotary dials. If they find, they must push these blocks through the game window,

Player with the least blocks is the winner if there are no blocks left inside the window.

name: Market Mayhem
description:
Market Mayhem is a simple Fighting Fantasy-inspired boardgame published in Warlock (Issue 3 - Volume 1, Number 3).

The game takes place in the marketplace of Port Blacksand (the city of thieves in the Fighting Fantasy universe). One of the players is chosen to be the gamemaster, each of the other players is given a character with a secret objective. The gamemaster controls non-playing characters and is the only one to know each character's goal. Each character has three stats (SKILL, STAMINA and MOVE), some of them have extra rules, like a spell they can cast or a magic item they can use.

Each turn, players move their character on the board, then characters adjacent to each other can interact, often by fighting but other interactions are possible (like exchanging objects, talking...). Combat is resolved using standard Fighting Fantasy rules.

The goal of the game is to be the last character standing, having fulfilled his/her objective.

In April 2020, Ian Livingstone made the game available as a print and play with updated art assets. This is a free download, and he asks that a charitable donation be made to the National Videogame Museum. (See the Web Links section.)
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Square Grid, Variable Player Powers

name: No Safe Port: WW2 Naval Warfare
description:
"No Safe Port" is a board game covering Operational and Tactical-level naval combat during the Second World War.

"No Safe Port" is designed to cover many of the major navies that fought during WW2 and includes submarines, carriers, aircraft, battleships, battlecruisers, heavy cruisers, light cruisers, destroyers, coastal batteries, land units, and more. User printable data/record sheets show the combat details of each individual class of ship, sub, and aircraft, each with a side view graphic. Solitaire and multiplayer rules are included.

This is a significant revision of the original 'NW:WW2' game series, and adds additional details and rules to the system (including floatation loss and individualized weapon data). The Rules are modular, allowing for Basic, Advanced, and Optional/Expanded rules systems that you can choose to use or not as you wish.

This game is professionally printed with mounted couters and full color heavy cardstock maps. The 'data cards' from the previous game series has been discarded in favor of user-printable data sheets on a CD-ROM included with the game; each sheet contains combat logs for up to 7 ships/subs or squadrons of aircraft.

Features include:


Countries included: United States, Great Britain, Germany, France, Japan, Italy, Soviet Union, Australia, Denmark, and Netherlands.



Detailed yet streamlined combat mechanics including basic, advanced, optional, and solitaire rules.



Data CD-ROM with fully printable data/record sheets covering 230 ship classes (including merchants, raiders, and transports), 100+ aircraft models, 35 submarine classes, 16 types of land units.



Each printable Data/Record Sheet contains the combat statistics for the unit, condensed combat tables to help during combat, a side view of the unit, with logs for ammunition/damage records for 7 ships/subs or aircraft squadrons pre-printed on each sheet.



58 page printed Rules Manual with 24 scenarios, including historical and hypothetical scenarios.



9 Color maps 11" x 17", a color combat matrix, and 280 die-cut 1/2" color counters.



Search Matrix, 2 Play Sequence charts and 5 color reference charts.



Includes 4 six-sided dice (only standard 6-sided die are used for play).



Semi-historical Campaigns covering the Pacific, North Atlantic, Mediterranean, and Arctic theatres.



Tactical and Operational battles covering surface combat, seaplane carriers, convoys, submarines, aircraft, amphibious operations, bombardments, etc...



Combat examples are included as well as condensed combat tables on each unit data/record sheet.



The game is inteded to be played either as as a board game or with miniatures.

name: Genpei War
description:
Issue game of Wargame Japanese History #10.

Covering the campaign between Taira and Minamoto clans during the Genpei war (1180–1185) - (http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Genpei_War).

The game engine is a card-driven and the map is divided into areas.
This game covers the period from battle of Ujigawa to the end of the campaign. Due to the period and the map, the battles are fought around Seto and the inside sea.

Components:

1 map
80 counters
4 pages rulebook
30 cards
mechanics: Area Movement, Campaign / Battle Card Driven

name: Rummy Z
description: Rummz Z is played with 106 tiles which correspond to two decks of cards, including two jokers. The regular suites - Clubs, Spades, Hearts and Diamonds - are replaced by four colors bearing numbers 1 through 13 consecutively. The numbers, 1, 11, 12, and 13 replace the Ace, Jack, Queen and King respectively. The primary object of each round is to be the first to play all of your tiles from your rack to the table. The secondary objective is to hold as few points as possible at the end of each round. The winner of the game is the player to first score minus 1000 points.

name: Scenario 300's
description:
A pad with 10 G.I. Anvil of Victory scenarios for the Squad Leader series.

The pad includes the following scenarios:
300: TRIAL BY COMBAT; February 27, 1945; Elsdorf, Germany
301: THE CLEARING; October 10, 1944; Huertgen Forest, Germany
302: STAND FAST; December 10, 1944; Hamlet outside Obergeich, Germany
303: TRUST AND PARRY; March 15, 1945; Pfaffenheck, Germany
304: RIPOSTE; March 15, 1945; near Pfaffenheck, Germany
305: THE DUEL; March 15, 1945; in and around Pfaffenheck, Germany
306: THE RAG TAG CIRCUS; April 12, 1945; Barby on the Elbe, Germany
307: POINT D'APPUI; October 9, 1944; outside Bardenberg, Germany
308: HAN-SUR-NEID; November 11, 1944; Han-Sur-Neid, France
309: THE ROER BRIDGEHEAD; February 23, 1945; Koerrenzig, Germany
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Modular Board

name: He's Out! The New Test Match Game
description:
The rules say "With this game it is possible to follow exactly the normal course of a test match from the selection of the teams down to the final bowling analysis".
The game uses a spinner mechanism which overlays 3 generic batting cards, allowing the player to simulate different quality batsmen and bowlers.
A simple cricket game from the 20s, and one with some potential to modify if you put the effort in to create unique player discs for each batsman. The mechanism is similar to the one used in the classic Cadaco’s All Star Baseball, which was released 13 years after He’s Out. The game is endorsed by Wally Hammond.

name: Windfall: Galaxy
description:
Windfall: Galaxy is a game of expansion and business on a galaxy wide scale. Each player represents one of earth's major companies in the governing conglomerate. They have to work together, using each other as a resource, to build and make better the structures they own to create a better future for everyone. But, when it comes to business, someone has to get ahead, and in the universe of Windfall, being the best means being the one with power.

Windfall: Galaxy is a tableau building game where the goal is to get the most VP's from the central pool and build the best structures. It's fast paced as player turns are just 1 action, and unlike other games, everything on the table can be used, not just by the player that controls it.

Windfall: Galaxy takes trading to heart as one of the first things a player gets to do during his turn. There are many reasons to trade: To get a resource you need, to make a card you own better, or to use something of someone elses.

The sector board gives players a chance to use other player's turns to their advantage. By piggy backing of an action, they can use their structures in the same sector, to perform a small action like drawing cards or taking small amounts of VP's, before it even gets to their turn.
categories: Industry / Manufacturing, Print & Play, Science Fiction, Space Exploration
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Hand Management, Trading

name: 1314 A.D.
description:
Around 1300 A.D., Scotland and England are at war. The Scottish clans no longer tolerate the oppression by the English kings and ally themselves with each other in order to gain their freedom. Only by working together can they overcome the powerful English army in the battles of Stirling, Falkirk and Bannockburn. But there is a heavy rivalry between the clans; each of the clan leaders wants to contribute as much as possible in order to be crowned as king of Scotland in the end, and they are not afraid to resort to treachery if needed.

In order to have the most points at the end of 1314 A.D. and rule over Scotland, you will need to increase your clan's prosperity without neglecting warfare and heroism.

name: TF22
description:
In the 22nd century, the white mineral has become one of the most important resources. The material is a catalyst that enables many new production processes. Each player is a pilot of one of his company’s spacecraft, on the way to the planet GH-328 in the Panajay system. This undeveloped planet has large deposits of the white mineral.

The goal of each player in TF22 is to leave the planet with as much white mineral and as many units as possible. At the start of the game, each player lands on the planet with a landing craft and several units: a production unit, transporters, and combat units. The production unit can be used to create new units by consuming white mineral. The transports can be used to gather ore and bring it to the landing craft (though they can also carry some of the other units). The combat units can be used to capture or destroy enemy units. Each turn, players receive a number of action points to perform these actions.

Players should not only watch out for the units of other players. They also need to keep an eye on the tide. This can change every round. Areas that were previously accessible only by naval units may suddenly become accessible to land units instead, and vice versa.
mechanics: Action Points, Hexagon Grid, Pick-up and Deliver

name: Canada at War #1
description:
A collection of six scenarios for Advanced Squad Leader, featuring Canadian units during World War II:

MLR1: HANA-SAKU; 19 December 1941; Mt. Butler, Hong Kong Island
MLR2: TROTEVAL FARM; 24 July 1944; Near Verrieres, Normandy, France
MLR3: MOOSHOF MELEE; 26 February 1945; Mooshof, Germany
MLR4: SNEAK ATTACK; 16 April 1945; The Village of Sneek, Holland
MLR5: THIRD TIME LUCKY; 1 August 1944; St. Martin-de-Fontenay, France
MLR6: GRENADE AND BAYONET; 1 March 1945; The Siegfried Line on the western edge of the Hochwald Forest, Germany
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Modular Board

name: Detetive J√∫nior Turma da M√¥nica
description: Based on the Detetive (Cluedo) I.P. but with very different mechanics. Players have to discover who is the secret character, based on four characteristics: male/female, child/adult, dark hair/light hair, with hat/without hat. Simple rules, aimed at children.

name: Legend of the Cipher: The Game of Hip-Hop
description:
Legend of the Cipher: The Game of Hip Hop

Legend of the Cipher (LOC) is a race to the top in professional hip hop. In order to succeed, you’ll make Moves, collaborate with Allies, put on Shows, employ Crew, experiment with Venture strategies, and buy Shine. As your Hype and Cash grow, your Career will evolve with your Opportunities, and you’ll learn to count your Bars as you kick your rhymes in a cycle of Ciphers and Battles that lead to the acquisition of skills, wisdom, and respect. Strategic deckbuilding and card play gives rise to multiple lyrical Battles and Ciphers in a revolutionary game that concisely emulates the reality of hip hop today... ALL of hip hop.

Gameplay Summary

Legend of the Cipher is a deckbuilding game, where players start with a basic deck that produces Bars and Cash, which they will use to acquire Opportunity cards each turn to add to their deck. Each turn, players must also perform at Shows, using their Bars to attempt to out-rap the other players. This involves actual rapping, although one can easily play the included variant without raps. Successful raps will be rewarded with Hype, which is used to level up your rapper, in turn increasing both your hand size and production of Bars. The objective of LOC is to be the first player to level up enough to become a Legend of the Cipher.
categories: Card Game, Humor, Music, Party Game
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management, Singing

name: Dinosaur Cowboys
description:
Dinosaur Cowboys is a fast playing (45 to 60 minutes) skirmish game of competing posses composed of up to 5 members and 1 dinosaur. Each character in the posse can be customized to fulfill a different role and purchase weapons and equipment from the many options available. Combat takes place in the futuristic landscape of the year 2285, where a supervolcano erupted and changed the course of mankind forever.

In the general the game is built around D12s and is meant to be light, thematic, and fast playing. Players build a Posse containing a Leader, 2-4 Members, and up to 1 Dinosaur, all of which benefit from some unique mechanics. Each Member has an Allegiance such as Duster or Neotechnoist which helps differentiate them (both thematically and statistically). Otherwise there are fairly standard statistics (Speed, Defense, Hitpoints, etc.) which can be customized by spending Improvement Points to really help define a role for each character. Furthermore Active and Passive Traits are selected to let characters do cool things like Crippling Shot, Speed Reload, Go For the Eyes, etc. Weapons and equipment are then purchased from a list of over 75 items ranging from laser Six-Shooters to plasma Shotguns.

A standard game takes place on a tabletop covered in terrain and uses 28mm miniatures and plastic dinosaur toys. Activation of entities is done on a model-by-model basis instead of the entire Posse at once, so the battles are very fluid with plenty of time to react to the enemy. This is especially true as Initiative is rolled at the start of each Activation "set" instead of staying the same for the whole turn.

Posses battle each other in one-off standalone games or in a linked campaign where further Improvement Points and Neodollars can be used to build and grow the group. Likewise injuries can accrue on characters that were taken out of action during an encounter. Deployment, objectives, and features can be used to add depth and variety to each battle beyond "kill everything".

The full rules are free to download and can be used with any range of miniatures. There is also a free "beginner version" (called Quickdraw) which condenses the core mechanics to under 10 pages, so players can jump into the game very easily.
categories: American West, Dice, Miniatures, Prehistoric, Science Fiction
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Role Playing, Variable Phase Order, Variable Player Powers

name: Spao
description:
Spao is a 3-player ball-stacking game that can be played with a Series: Shibumi set. It uses a '4x4 holes board' and balls in 3 colours.

Each player has an allocated colour (white, black and red). Players take turns placing a ball of their colour in a legal position (hole or 2x2 platform). When the pyramid is full the game ends. To get your score multiply the sizes of your groups. Highest score wins.

Variant for 2 players:

Red balls are neutral. Each player takes 10 balls of his colour (white or black) and 5 red balls. On your turn you place one of your balls in a legal position. Same scoring.

Rules for this game are included in the soft cover Shibumi Rule Book

name: Dein Volkswagen
description:
Objective: Be the first to arrive at field 70

Simple 'Roll and Move' game; different editions - rare collector's item: communicates strong economical grow of
early W-German economy, remake of an elder KdF ('Kraft durch Freude')game - see images
categories: Children's Game, Dice, Industry / Manufacturing, Racing
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Vehicles! A Supplement for Operation Squad: World War Two
description: After fighting dozens of battles with your men, the time has come to deploy some armour! Motorbikes, cars, trucks, armoured cars, half-tracks and tanks are ready to take part in your games and make them even more exciting. But now the infantry have got some anti-tank weapons to face these steel monsters too... The Rules are still fast and easy to learn so enrich your army with some vehicles and have twice the fun.

name: Khan
description:
From Zillions of Games

Khan is played on a 10x10 square board. Each player starts the game with twenty Soldiers and six Khans. The different types of motion are:

Step: Any piece can move one space orthogonally or diagonally to an empty adjacent square.

Jump: A Khan can jump an adjacent piece of either color and land in the empty square beyond. Jumping can take place along an orthogonal or diagonal line. A Khan can continue to jump as long as jumps are available but is not required to. To pass on further jumps, click the pass button.

Push: A Khan can push a straight line of friendly Soldiers (called a "phalanx") one space orthogonally or diagonally. If the lead Soldier is pushed onto an enemy piece, the enemy piece is captured.

Capture: A Khan captures an enemy piece by custodian capture, i.e., by sandwiching an enemy between the moving Khan and another friendly Khan. The capturing Khans and the captured piece must lie along an orthogonal or diagonal line. A Khan can make multiple captures when jumping.

Support: A Khan supports a special move by a Soldier. If a Soldier is adjacent to a friendly Khan, the Soldier can move to any empty square also adjacent to the Khan. The Soldier can continue to make support moves if available but is not required to.

Win by moving a Soldier to the opposite row or by capturing all enemy Soldiers.

name: Pocket Quiz: Die 70er Jahre
description:
This is a small, pocket-sized trivia game. It contains 50 cards with 3 questions each, most of them with multiple choice answers. The backside of each card contains the answers and offers additional information. Most of the cards also show small illustrations.

The title translates to "The 70's" and the questions center around lifestyle, culture, arts, sports, politics und the music of that era.

name: Brrrr!
description:
The title is meant to sound like an car engine when you accelerate.
A party game. Pin the 9 Place Cards on the walls of the house or garden, at suitable distances apart depending on the area available for play. Give each player a Log Card which it will be noted bears the name of a car. Explain that they must use the side marked 1st Race. Ensure that each player has a pencil.
At the word Go each player sets out to find in the left column of a Place Card the name of the place printed on the first line of his Log Card. He then copies in the Speed Column the speed printed on the Place Card alongside the place name. He also writes on the next line the name of the place printed on the right of the Place Card next to the speed figure. He then proceeds to find the latter place name in the left column of a Place Card and enters up his Log Card as before. He continues entering up the card until he reaches London which is the last place on his journey.
The players try to complete the journey as quickly as possible, filling in the Log Card as described above.
The winner is the player who is first to hand to the host a correctly completed Log Card.
The Log Cards are printed on the reverse side for a second race. Twelve Log Cards are provided for twelve players. If more are taking part extra Log Cards should be obtained.
The game can be played over and over again. New Log Cards will of course be needed and they are supplied in packets of 12. The game comes in a box, with an illustration showing a speeding motor-car driven by a young lady, zipping down the leafy lanes of Britain.

name: Pocket Quiz: Die 80er Jahre
description:
This is a small, pocket-sized trivia game. It contains 50 cards with 3 questions each, most of them with multiple choice options. The backside of each card contains the answers and offers additional information. Most of the cards also show small illustrations.

The title translates to "The 80's" and the questions center around lifestyle, culture, arts, sports, politics und the music of that era.

name: Pocket Quiz: Erfindungen
description:
This is a small, pocket-sized trivia game. It contains 50 cards with 3 questions each, most of them with multiple choice options. The backside of each card contains the answers and offers additional information. Most of the cards also show small illustrations.

The title translates to "Inventions" and the questions are about that topic.

name: Pocket Quiz: Essen & Trinken
description:
This is a small, pocket-sized trivia game. It contains 50 cards with 3 questions each, most of them with multiple choice options. The backside of each card contains the answers and offers additional information. Most of the cards also show small illustrations.

The title translates to "Food & Drinks" and the questions are about food, cooks, restaurants and drinks.

name: Pocket Quiz: Film & Fernsehen
description:
This is a small, pocket-sized trivia game. It contains 50 cards with 3 questions each, most of them with multiple choice options. The backside of each card contains the answers and offers additional information. Most of the cards also show small illustrations.

The title translates to "Movies & Television" and the questions are all about these topics.
categories: Card Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Trivia

name: Pocket Quiz: Flugzeuge
description:
This is a small, pocket-sized trivia game. It contains 50 cards with 3 questions each, most of them with multiple choice options. The backside of each card contains the answers and offers additional information. Most of the cards also show small illustrations.

The title translates to "Aircrafts" and the questions are about that topic.

name: Pocket Quiz: Italien
description:
This is a small, pocket-sized trivia game. It contains 50 cards with 3 questions each, most of them with multiple choice options. The backside of each card contains the answers and offers additional information. Most of the cards also show small illustrations.

The title translates to "Italy" and all questions are about that country.

name: Pocket Quiz: Landleben
description:
This is a small, pocket-sized trivia game. It contains 50 cards with 3 questions each, most of them with multiple choice options. The backside of each card contains the answers and offers additional information. Most of the cards also show small illustrations.

The title translates to "Country Life" and the questions are about that topic.

name: Pocket Quiz: Sport
description:
This is a small, pocket-sized trivia game. It contains 50 cards with 3 questions each, most of them with multiple choice options. The backside of each card contains the answers and offers additional information. Most of the cards also show small illustrations.

The questions are all about sports.

name: Touchdown SportACTION Card Game
description:
User review: Football-themed rummy variant.

Each player is dealt six cards. In turn, each player repleshes one's hand to six and draws an extra card, then plays a card or discards a card. Some cards allow a player to force an opponent to miss turns or forfeit cards.

The object of the game is to assemble a complete set of cards of one color along with a touchdown card and a field goal card.

name: Power Tower
description: Building towers, or rather build one tower by a joint effort. Who manages to place the roof or place the last block? The game is directed by cards. On a square basis area the triangular basis block is set up. The cards are stacked. In your turn you reveal the top building card - the cards determine which block must be placed with which hand. There are also cards offering free choice or change of turn order or cards demanding placement of a roof. If you can place a roof or the last block without tumbling the tower you receive a chip. If you collect three chips you win the game.

name: Four Kingdoms
description:
A two player card game, in the similar style to Lost Cities, but different. It currently has no theme, and can as of now be played with two standard playing card decks, shuffled together.

The game involves the player in solitaire style card moving, card organization, thoughtful hand management, constant card battling with opponent, and fast quick turns, with drawing, recycling old cards, and discarding useless ones. The game is designed to be very completive, use risk management, be tactically complex in options, and played through multiple rounds, with some games yielding multiple game points, so the far behind loser has a reason to fight with a bad hand.

Players involve themselves in gameplay in which they draw cards during their turn, maintaining hand sizes of 10, and play those cards down on differing piles, to accumulate points, matching the suits. However, the opposing player is constantly battling for victory as well, with his piles point totals. Players also discard and recycle cards onto the various piles. Many cards have special attributes which mix up the play. First player to reach an objective of 5 game points, (added from various round points), is the winner.

name: 3 mit Kopf & Pfote: Wettbewerb der Tiere
description: 20 animal cubes are placed within the board, white side up. In his move a player determines a starting animal by placing his chip on the cube. The colour die determines the category, speed, breeding time, size, weight or age, the Symbol die determines whether the chosen animals must be stronger or weaker in the category than the starting animal. All players in turn take one cube till all pass, then first the active player and then all others compare the colour codes of the chosen animals - for correct choices they move 1 spot forward, for a wrong choice 1 spot back. Dog spots on the scoring scale earn a point for actions, rabbit actions earn one point for the active player if he finds out which animal cube was removed behind his back.

name: Unfathomable Encounters
description:
Background:The depths of the oceans were the last unexploited frontier on our world, until scientists detected a new element formed by the combination of high pressure and intense volcanic heat.

The element, Gottahavium, exists as a quantum fluid. This wonder element acts as a super conductor, and would launch a new epoch in technology for all humankind, and the Conglomocorporation that controls stands to make a fortune.

Since Gottahavium can only be found in deepest reaches of the ocean, a very inhospitable places for humans, Deep Sea Drones (DSDs) are utilized to locate and then mine the deposits.

With so much on the line, the ConCorps have covertly shifted resources from military contracts to ensure they will be the sole proprietors. And so, a quiet little war has sprung up under the sea.



Gameplay:Each player controls one of three ConCorp exploratory forces, which are vying for control of the limited deposits in the volatile oceanic depths.

The game is patterned after the classic Micro/Mini-games in the late 70’s early 80’s, and is meant to be a light quick wargame that can be played in a single session.

Before starting, players must choose the scale of the game they wish to play. This can range from a small skirmish, allowing for multiple sessions in a night, or have a much larger scale conflict that would allow for a much more in depth battle.

Once the size of the game is decided, player will pick a ConCorp to represent, and the pick their force of DSDs. Each ConCorp has 5 different drones to choose from, with an overall theme for each of the 3 ConCorps.

After setup, players take turns mining & moving, with a simultaneous fire phase between each player’s move phase, so as not to give any one player an advantage in being able to move in, without repercussions.

However, this is not just a straight up shooting gallery. As with many games of this genre, the map is hex based, and the terrain has an impact on both movement and combat. There are also oceanic events, such as strong currents, undersea volcanoes and seaquakes that provide a random element that can ruin even the best-laid plans of AIs and Drones.

While the main goal is to attempt to mine a set number of resources (depending on game size), players can also take a more offensive stance and attempt to annihilate the other player’s base going for the more brutal total victory.



The Future?:The game was created as part of the Microgame contest here on BGG, but there are plans to expand it beyond the bounds of the initial restraints of that contest.

The goal will be to release expansion modules over time, which will add new drones, ConCorps , maps and rules, all of which will be compatible with the existing system, including having map halves being interchangeable.

name: Veni Vidi Vici
description: A Chess-like move and capture game played on an 8 x 8 board which includes terrain, which enables ambushes, has swamps to avoid and forts into which retreats may be conducted, but which may also be besieged.

name: Jerusalem: The Beggar
description:
The Beggar is a new Action card for Jerusalem.

Just add the card to the basic Action card deck to play with it.

When you play this Action card, place it under one of your squire who's inside one area of the gameboard. That Squire will become a beggar for the rest of the game. Each time an opponent places one (or more) squire inside that area, must give 1 silver Bezant to the beggar.
Note 1: If an opponent plays "Turncoat", the beggar changes his faction!
Note 2: If that squire is removed from the game after a War event or he's killed (the new Assassin card), the card is removed too.

name: Operation Iceberg: Battle of Okinawa
description:
In the summer of 1945 the United States had a firm grasp of the Pacific Theater. Japans once mighty fleet was all but shattered and unable to support any garrisoned island against an U.S. attack. With Iwo Jima taken earlier in the year the U.S. had an island to land damaged bombers that were hitting the mainland island. To launch an invasion of the main island of Japan the U.S. would need a bigger stepping stone to launch from; Okinawa was the answer.

This is a 2 player game set on the island of Okinawa and surrounding waters that recreates the battle between U.S. and Japanese forces during World War 2. The basic rules follow the concepts laid out in Axis & Allies, but combat resolution has been modified to a D12 system. The game can be played to 10 turns or 20 depending on the length of time desired; and victory is determined by the number of airbases held or carriers destroyed. The map is divided into areas that are controlled by the players' armies represented by the plastic Axis & Allies pieces.

The rules incorporate a number of new features to the Axis & Allies style of play including terrain effects, country specific units, and all new unit types including flame tanks and LCMs.
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Area Movement, Simulation, Variable Phase Order

name: Power Trip Card Game
description:
Power Trip is a thrilling, fast-paced card game that can change directions at any time. Players race to get rid of all their cards first by attempting to match or beat the cards played by others, or by playing a Clear or Power Trip card to clear the discard pile. The first player to do so becomes the Ruler. Be the first player to become Ruler three times to WIN THE GAME. Play out of turn to complete four of a kind and use Action and Rule cards to squash your competition.

Easily score your Power Trip games and keep players on the edge of their seats by generating new and existing rule cards with the iPhone and Android Power Trip app.

name: Creative Kitchen: The Game
description:
Creative Kitchen is board game that brings together your creative and culinary skills while mixing in a few good laughs. Originally designed to help engage students at a local culinary training program in Savannah, Georgia (Starfish Café), the game has earned rave reviews from both home cooks and professional chefs in prototyping sessions.

The game is played by dealing each “chef contestant” a set of ingredient cards. Based off the mystery box ingredient concept popular in shows such as Food Network’s Chopped and Iron Chef, players can discard and pick up new ingredients in their quest to make the best recipe out of their hand. Contestants then have to name and illustrate their dish on provided recipe cards and sell it to their panel of judges (their fellow contestants!). Creative Kitchen is a great way to gather recipes from friends and share a few laughs over “interesting” recipes. Cheers to Creative Kitchen’s next master chef!

Currently, the board game design includes 110 ingredient cards (expansion decks to come!), game board, kitchen timing device, pad of blank recipe cards and eye catching Creative Kitchen box.

name: Zombie Mosh 2.5
description:
Zombie Mosh puts you in the role of a human survivor or the walking undead in a table top environment, using your scenery and miniatures. It takes place during modern times.

Game-play consists of the sides (survivors and zombies) taking turns with move, shoot and melee phases. The game uses 6 sided dice for all outcomes. There are rules for over 30 different weapons to kill the zombies with and rules for vehicle movement and running down zombies with. There are also several scenarios to use which include maps and modifying suggestions to make each scenario more replayable. Each scenario has different goals and set ups. With these rules it would be easy to play out any scene from any of your favorite zombie movies. There are also all of the markers and templates needed to play included.

Everything is in full color. It is available in pdf format at this time and has 56 pages. Was originally written in 2007, 2.0 was released in 2008 and 2.5 was released in 2011. There is a rumor of a 3.0 release.
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Role Playing, Simulation

name: Risu-Game-On
description:
User summary:

A Dominion-esque Japanese small press deck building game based on web-based role playing game "False Island". All players start with a small set of cards containing money and some victory points, and may each turn play cards from their hand to purchase better cards. The cards available for purchase vary each turn, as they are drawn and displayed 4 at a time from a shuffled pile of various cards. Money cards and victory point cards can always be drawn.

name: Story of Eastern Illusionary Light
description:
User summary:

A Japanese amateur card game, featuring characters of Shrine Maiden fame. The game simulates a race, and the deck of cards consists of character cards with numbers 1–6 and special powers of varying sorts. Each player starts with a hand of 5 cards, and each turn draws a card and may choose to play a card on theiur own "route" (representing that they are advancing), onto another player (representing an enemy), or generally using a card's special power. The player may also choose to score one of their route cards. Defeating enemies that other players have played on you may also generate points.

Once at 5 route cards, the stage is cleared and the player receives one of the route cards as stage clear bonus, and once a player has cleared 4 stages, the game ends at which point the player with the highest amount of points wins.

name: Helin√§-keiju: Helin√§ ja kastepisarat
description:
Tinker-bell game.

Players try to get rid of all of their glass balls. First a player draws a card with a number or a simple calculation like 3-1, and then the player throws a die which shows either - or +. If the die shows +, player puts as many glass balls as was written on the card on the flower in the middle of the board. If the die shows - player takes glass balls from the flower. When the flower falls down, player has to take all the fallen glass balls.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Children's Game, Dice, Educational, Math

name: Disposable Heroes: Point Blank
description:
Point Blank is a brand new squad level skirmish system for 1:1 modern tactical firearm combat. Players are in charge of a squad or several fire teams and control the individual actions of their soldiers, weapon teams, vehicles or support weapons. The rules are focused on the tactical concepts of fire and maneuver, command and control, and morale as well as training and experience. Any period of modern firearms combat can be simulated, from The Great War all the way to today and beyond.

The Point Blank book contains everything you need to run games with infantry, artillery, and vehicles as well as rules for spotting and hiding, as well as night, weather, smoke, and fog. There are three major periods represented for the army lists in the book: WWII (which includes Germany, U.S., Soviet, British, French, and Polish. Vietnam (which includes U.S., ARVN, Australian, NVA, and VC. As well as modern forces for the Global War on Terror or any other modern hot spot (which includes U.S., British, Mujahideen, and Insurgent). Rounding out the book are three scenarios, each one concentrating on one of the periods covered in the book and focusing on a tactical concept. The missions include Combat Patrol, Ambush, and a VIP Snatch. There is lots more besides in this 94 page rulebook to keep players busy and gaming.
categories: Dice, Miniatures, Modern Warfare, Vietnam War, Wargame, World War I, World War II

name: Game of Voyage Round the World
description:
This game is a roll-and-move game with wonderful graphics on the gameboard (world map) and especially interesting for collectors on the box cover: It shows a large Zeppelin waiting to be tossed into its hangar.
It's supposed to be the so called "Reparations - Zeppelin" LZ 126, which obviously inspired the artist to draw this box cover

This is actually a yacht racing game - not an air race despite the cover. Players sail from New York and the first player who lands in London wins. Each port has a number which matches an event on the board. Players must perform each event as they land on each spot. Rules are pasted on the inside of the box and are in English, French and Spanish.

Components:

4 player tokens
2 spinners (numbered 1-12)
game board
rules
mechanics: Events, Point to Point Movement, Race, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Ordb√§vning
description:
A game published in junction with the student carnival "Lundakarnevalen 2010". The game is a word-game, where players try to descibe words without mentioning specifics (very similar to Alias).

Players take turn to try to describe the words on the card, each one with a specific theme, without mentioning the specific word or part of the word. The other players, teammates or opponents depending on the variant, try to guess as many as possible in a set period of time; and players score accordingly. First one to a set target of points is the winner.

What sets the game apart from Alias is the distinct tongue-in-cheek "lundahumor", i.e. humour from the student city of Lund. The themes and words on the different cards are often odd, screwball or intergroup.

In addition to the original rules, several variants is included in the base-game.

name: Skarab√§us
description:
Merrills-meets-memory game where players try to eliminate stones of the opponent by getting three of their own pieces in a row. All pieces, though, are hidden, and all of them have the same figure on their backs: initially the orientation shows which figure is which but after a couple of turns players will have moved, swapped and twisted the pieces often enough to confuse anyone without a very reliable memory.

To add insult to injury, some special pieces (Horus falcons) can be uncovered, with fatal consequences for either player (depending on the situation).

name: P√°rty
description:
In game Párty you take a role of a guest on a party.

Your goal is to become most favorite person on the Party. Players exchange their sympathy between each other, when are drinking and eating, or dancing. First player, who have sympathy of each color, except his own, wins.

name: WWII Micro Squad: The 1:1 Scale Game
description:
Based on the popular Micro Armour: The Game - WWII platoon scale rules, Micro Squad: The 1:1 Scale Game - WWII is designed for both the history buff and the 6mm wargamer. Training, experience, and "cohesion" of players' forces are important factors in deciding the outcome of each battle.

The rules include:


23 pages of weapons and aircraft data for the US, UK, France, Poland, Soviet Union, Germany, Italy, and Japan.
Full color game markers
Quick reference Combat Table Card
How-to guide for designing scenarios
10 ready-to-play scenarios


GAME SCALE: 1 miniature = 1 vehicle/weapon/infantry squad, 1 inch = 25 yds/meters, 1 turn = 1 real time minute
categories: Book, Miniatures, Wargame, World War II

name: MARCO POLO REISE-SPIEL Italien
description:
Objective: collect as many bonus points as possible, but don't miss to be back home on time
- tactical (geographical) quiz - so called on back of box
3 phases - moving by turn - each player starts on his marked/coloured area
I move around collecting cards/images
II answer questions regarding images/cards you hold - if you fail discard card
III get back home (can be difficult) - don't miss the plane/boat
content:
1 board, 60 cards/images, 6 ports/cards, 20 red chips, 4 vehicles with stand-ups, 8 'double-sided' stones to point out directions, 2 rain slides, 1 die, 1 rule
3 similar editions existing for France, Germany & US
categories: Card Game, Dice, Educational, Travel, Trivia

name: Cat's Race
description:
A children's game (speed, fun and animals). It's time to return home for a night's sleep, but it will not be easy with restaurants, concerts, rendez-vous and fighting with dogs.
Life is not easy for a cat.
Who will be the first to back home for bedtime ?
This game recreates the entire lifespan of a cat.
There are 6 cats involved in a race, each on its track. Each player rolls 6 dice and moves the cats by one case by matching die. Eg : If you roll 1,1,1,3,5 and 6, the cat # 1 moves 3 cases; #3, #5 and #6 move 1 case each. But be carefull with food, music, rendez-vous, whatever the number of dice you obtain the cat can only move one case by turn. And just before the finish line, there are dogs, the cat must jump over it to cross the line, it can't stop on it (2 dice are required so).
A funny game for rainy day.
PS : You can put candies on the play zone after the finish line, kids love it.
categories: Animals, Children's Game, Dice, Humor, Print & Play

name: Alexander the Great in Italy
description:
An expansion for The Great Battles of Alexander: Deluxe Edition, this module is found in GMT's C3i Magazine Nr5. It covers a hypothetical situation where Alexander lives and wages war in Italy aganist the Romans.

Battles:
Siris, 319 B.C.
The Last Battle, 318 B.C.

name: I'll Kill this Monster
description:
This is web-published wargame based on Japanese Science Fiction TV series "The Return of Ultraman". This game represent tactical level combat between Monsters(Kaiju) and Ultraman(Hero from outer space).

Players control either Monster side or mankind side. The mankind side include Ultraman and defense force. The main engine of this game is used chit-pull system.

There are 20 scenarios based on the episode of the TV story. Victory conditions vary by scenario. Common condition is the removal of civil and destruction of buildings.
categories: Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction

name: Sponnect
description:
Sponnect is a simple connection game for 2 players that can be played with a Series: Shibumi set.

The board starts with 5 red marbles forming a pyramid in the middle of the board.

Starting with white, each player places a marble on an empty space or platform (2x2 arrangement of marbles).
A player may also pass if the other player didn't pass on his turn.

White wins by forming a chain of touching marbles connecting the east and the west side. Black wins by connecting the south and the north side.

Included in the Shibumi Rule Book

Soft cover:

http://www.lulu.com/shop/cameron-browne-and-nestor-romeral-a...

Downloadable PDF:

http://www.nestorgames.com/rulebooks/SHIBUMI_EN.pdf

name: Logo
description: Each player tries to put his cards on the use of basic arithmetic operations as quickly as possible. Each player gets five cards, the rest is available as a face-down deck and the top card is revealed. On his turn player try to achieve this result with two of his cards, the card must be used first, the color of the card shows results.

name: Spagyric (White-Black-Red)
description:
Spagyric (a.k.a. White-Black-Red) is a two-player game designed for play with a Shibumi set. It uses a 4×4-holed board, and balls in three colors (white, black, and red).

White beats Black beats Red beats White

Goal: Create a connected group of 4 same-colored balls, neither first creating a group of only 3 same-colored balls, nor creating a group of 5 or more same-colored balls. If you create a group of precisely 3 or more than 4 same-colored balls, you lose. If the pyramid fills with 30 balls before a winner or loser is determined, each player takes 1 white, 1 black, and 1 red, and the winner is decided by a sudden-death white-black-red (see below).

Rules: The 4×4 board starts empty. Each player starts with 8 white, 8 black, and 8 red balls. Keep this supply of 24 balls hidden from your opponent at all times during the game. Use an opaque container (e.g. the Shibumi bag) to receive defeated balls over the course of the game. It should be able to hold 24 balls. Never look in this bag of defeat during the game.
Both players simultaneously and secretly select a ball from their supplies. Simultaneously reveal them on a count of "White, black, red, go!" The stronger ball (White beats Black beats Red beats White) goes into play wherever the "winner" likes; the weaker goes into the bag of defeat. If both players revealed the same color, those are stunned, and set aside until this turn is done; then they will go back into your supplies. The game ends when your supplies are empty, even if it’s due to stunning.

Included in the Shibumi Rule Book

Soft cover:

http://www.lulu.com/shop/cameron-browne-and-nestor-romeral-a...

Downloadable PDF:

http://www.nestorgames.com/rulebooks/SHIBUMI_EN.pdf

name: Superman Flying Bingo
description:
This has nothing to do with the traditional game of Bingo.

Each player is given a supply of Superman discs. There are four colours so four can play. Each player flicks their discs on to the board which is a grid of 5 x 5 pockets. If a disc settles within a pocket, it stays there. The objective of each player is to form a row of five of his colour discs, to win the game. Getting five in a row is the only link to a Bingo game.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Comic Book / Strip, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Activity 1997
description: Expansion for the Activity with 110 new cards about what happens in 1997.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Party Game

name: Anima Tactics: Church Agent
description:
Church Agent's are the special forces available to the Churches
highest circles of power. Many have been trained in Caedus since childhood to hunt down and destroy the forces that threaten humanity, while others learn to use the divine gifts they where born with to further the Churches work. While they come from disparate walks of life, every church agent has been drawn to the fold to become an instrument of their god's will on Gaia.


Neutral Church Warrior or Mystic - Lv. 20+
At 4 | Dm 2 | Df 8 | Ar 0 | LP: 10 | Re 10 | Mo 6/10 | AP 2/4
Agent: Church Agents are not unique characters and you may include 1 for every 150 Levels in a Church Alliance Party. For example, a party of 300 levels could include up to two Church Agents.
ooo - Deus Ex Terra (Ki, Attack)
+3 Attack / +2 Damage. Deus Ex Terra can only be used if the Agent is a Warrior.
ooo - Healing (Magic, Effect)
A friendly Character within the Agent's Control Zone is healed 2 Life Points. Healing can only be used if the Agent is a Mystic.

Church Agent Skill Card
A Church Agent can possess any combination of the following options, as long the added levels do not take their total level above 40. Any option cannot be chosen more than once. Options from the Inquisitor section of this card cannot be chosen if any options from the Saint section are chosen and vice versa.
•The Agent recovers one more Action per turn. Lv. +10
•The Agent's Speed is increased to 8/12. Lv. +5
Inquisitor
•The Agent's attacks against Light Characters get +4 damage. Lv. +5
•The Agent's attacks against Dark Characters get +4 damage. Lv. +5
•The Agent's attacks against Mystic Characters get +4 damage. Lv. +5
•The Agent gets +1 attack and +2 damage. Lv. +5
•The Agent gets +4 Life Points. Lv. +5
Saint
•The Agent's Healing skill heals 5 Life Points instead of 2. Lv. +10
•Innate Ability: All Friendly Characters in the Agent's Control Zone get +1 Resistance. Lv +10
•The Agent gets the following ability: Lv. +5
oo - Holy Protection (Magic, Effect)
A Friendly Character with the Control Zone of the Agent gets Shield Lv.1 and Protection Lv.1.
Alignment: If options from the Inquisitor section are chosen, then the Agent is Dark faction and a Warrior. If options from the Saint section are chosen, then the Agent is Light faction and a Mystic. If no options are chosen from either section, the Agent is Neutral and you decide whether they are either a Warrior or Mystic.

name: ZOMBIE APOCALYPSE: Zombie Card Game & Zombie Twins Promo
description:
New promo card that can only be acquired by getting the Z-Day bundle with all 15 expansions!

Zombie Twins:
Can team up with any one Zombie group. Counts as two zombies.

"Zombie Card Game" is no longer included in the ZA edition.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Horror, Zombies
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management, Open Drafting

name: ZOMBIE APOCALYPSE: Zombie Grizzly Promo Card
description:
This new promo can only be acquired by getting the Z-Day bundle with all 15 expansions!

Zombie Grizzly:
Attack the most powerful character not protected by a Refuge each turn. All characters killed are placed in the Crisis Event's Kill Pile.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Horror, Zombies
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Open Drafting

name: ZOMBIE APOCALYPSE: Crisis Event  Promo Cards
description:
These new 3 promo cards can only be acquired by getting the Z-Day bundle with all 15 expansions!

Occult Artifact:
Place the Necronomicon with the most powerful Human in play. That Human is now +5/+10 and can only be attacked by Humans. The most powerful characters in the Kill Piles is summoned each turn. Place all summoned cards in the Crisis Event's Kill Pile.'

Nuclear Assault:
All cards in play are destroyed. Each player places their destroyed cards in their opponent's Kill Pile (or the player to the left in multiplayer).

Marauders:
Attacks the weakest Human in play each turn. If the weakest Human is in a Refuge, the Refuge and any Weapons are destroyed. Place all taken cards in the Crisis Event's Kill Pile.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Horror, Zombies
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Open Drafting

name: Anima Tactics: Ahriman, Lord of Darkness
description:
The Ahriman are the dark twins of the maidens of light. The most powerful known dark elementals. With their unique powers, they are virtually unstoppable. The lords of Darkness have once again set their sites on Gaia.

Dark Summon Warrior/Mystic
Level 40 version
At 5 | Dm 5 | Df 9 | Ar 1 | LP: 17 | Re 11 | Mo 8/12 | AP 3/4
Cost to Summon: oo | Affinity: Dark
Atman: 60 | Bind: 1 | Stability: 8 | Shock: +1
Innate Abilities: Immunity (Blind).
Soul Disruption: If Ahriman deals 5 or more damage with a hand-to-hand attack, the target suffers Seal Lv.2. Units with Damage Resistance are immune to this skill. Effect 15.
Darkness Claws: Ahriman's attacks ignore the Shield and Protection states on enemy units.
o - Darkness (Magic, Effect)
An enemy Unit within Ahriman's Control Zone suffers Blind Lv.1. Effect 15. Limit: Once per turn.
oo - Doom (Magic, Effect)
All enemy Units within Ahriman's Control Zone when this skill is used get -1 Attack and Defense until the end of the turn. Effect 16.
ooo - Catastrophic Darkness (Magic, Ranged Attack)
Distance (16 Inch). +2 Damage. If this attack hits the target, all Units within 3 Inches to the target also suffer the attack.
ooo - Dark Ender (Ki, Attack)
+1 Attack. Dark Ender can target an enemy Unit up to a distance of 2 Inches away, even if Ahriman is not in base contact with it.

Level 50 version
At 6 | Dm 5 | Df 9 | Ar 1 | LP: 17 | Re 11 | Mo 8/12 | AP 3/4
Cost to Summon: oo | Affinity: Dark
Atman: 60 | Bind: 2 | Stability: 8 | Shock: +1
Innate Abilities: Intangibility, Immunity (Blind).
Soul Disruption: If Ahriman deals 5 or more damage with a hand-to-hand attack, the target suffers Seal Lv.2. Units with Damage Resistance are immune to this skill. Effect 16.
Darkness Claws: Ahriman's attacks ignore the Shield and Protection states on enemy units.
o - Darkness (Magic, Effect)
An enemy Unit within Ahriman's Control Zone suffers Blind Lv.1. Effect 15. Limit: Once per turn.
oo - Doom (Magic, Effect)
All enemy Units within Ahriman's Control Zone when this skill is used get -1 Attack and Defense until the end of the turn. Effect 16.
ooo - Catastrophic Darkness (Magic, Ranged Attack)
Distance (16 Inch). +2 Damage. If this attack hits the target, all Units within 3 Inches to the target also suffer the attack.
ooo - Dark Ender (Ki, Attack)
+1 Attack. Dark Ender can target an enemy Unit up to a distance of 2 Inches away, even if Ahriman is not in base contact with it.

name: 300 all'Ora
description:
"300 all'Ora: il vero gioco delle corse automobilistiche" is a simple board game focused on the Formula 1 races. The movement of the cars is determined by the throw of two dice and the winner will be the player who first complete all the laps of the circuit.

The game is played in two phases.
The first step is to take a ride in the track "Collaudo", collecting many coins every time with the throw of double dices you stoped over a box with a wheel icon.
This coins permit every player to move an extra space over the dices in the second phase of the game.

The second phase is played in the race track 8-shaped.
You throw two dices and you must move your car as the result of the dice.
The first one that turns 3 rounds of the track wins.

name: Haar-Spielerei
description: Rapunzel is coming home to her tower and wants to tell about her adventures - if she has forgotten the word for something she uses her magical hair to draw the item. Each player receives a tower. In your turn you look at a hair tile and use the hair string to lay out the contours of the item. The others guess, who guesses correctly receives the tile and adds it to his tower. Special cards win or lose you cards. If you have added four tiles to your tower you win.

name: Anima Tactics: Momiji
description:
From the shadows of the eastern lands, the young Kitsune Momiji
has come to serve Samael and the Fallen Angels as one of the top
spies of the organization. Trained as a perfect ninja from the moment she was just a cub, she combines her natural fox magic with the deadliest assassin’s arts.

Dark Samael Prowler - Lv. 45

At 5 | Dm 3 | Df 9 | Ar 0 | LP: 12 | Re 10 | Mo 12/16 | AP 3/4

oo - Stealth (Subterfuge, Effect)
Momiji becomes Hidden. Upkeep: o

ooo - Tsukinoiri (Subterfuge, Charge)

+ 4 Attack / +2 Damage. This attack cannot be intercepted. This skill can be used only if Momiji is Hidden.

ooo - Kitsune-Bi (Magic, Ranged Attack)
Distance (12 inches). +2 Damage.

o - Kagebunshin (Ki, Effect, Reactive)
If Momiji's Life Points would be reduced to zero, replace her with a Decoy token instead. In the Recovery Phase of the next turn put Momiji back into play within 4 inches of the Decoy token with the same Life Points she had when she used this skill, and then retire the Decoy token. If Momiji is not one the table at the end of the game, she counts as a casualty.
Limit: Once per game.

ooo - Maboroshi Shuriken (Subterfuge, Ranged Attack)
Distance (8 inches). +1 damage. Maboroshi Shuriken cannot be intercepted by the Shield maneuver and the target cannot use a Dodge action. This skill can only be used if Momiji is Hidden

oo - Kage Kitsune (Ki, Effect)
Momiji becomes Intangible until the end of the turn.

name: Anima Tactics: Yuki
description:
Yuki's most striking feature is her icy beauty. One of the last Ice Maidens of Varje, she has been assigned to observe humanity in the name of the fallen angels of Samael. Her powerful elemental powers should help keep her safe during her sojourn.

Neutral Samael Mystic - Lv. 35

At 4 | Dm 2 | Df 8 | Ar 0 | LP: 12 | Re 11 | Mo / | AP 2/4

Spirit of the Snow: Yuki cannot Walk, Run, Charge, or use Free Movement.

ooo - Tree Frost (Magic, Movement)
Place Yuki anywhere within 24 inches of her current position. This movement cannot be intercepted and ignores all movement penalties.

ooo - Absolute Zero (Magic, Effect)
Enemy Units within 12 inches and in Line of Sight of Yuki cannot make any kind of movement or Charge for the rest of the Turn. Effect 18:
Limit: Once per game.

oo - Ice Splinters (Magic, Ranged Attack)
Distance 16 inches. +1 Attack / +2 Damage.

oo - Blizzard (Magic, Effect)
One enemy Unit within 20 inches and in Line of Sight of Yuki suffers Slow Lv. 1 and has the distance of its Ranged Attacks as well as the Speed of its Movements halved until the end of the Turn. Effect 16.

name: A Day at the Races
description: An exciting card game of horse track racing, odds and wagering. Horses (cards) advance on the track (cards) each assigned odds of winning (based on card value) and wagers (punts) are made by the players before the race based on those odds. There are six races in a game and the player who wins the most "money" is the winner.
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Point to Point Movement

name: Anima Tactics: Cordelia Rosalind
description:
With Cordelia’s enhanced senses and armed with the latest Wissenchaft technology, she is the best sniper throughout all of Gaïa.

Dark Wissenschaft Prowler - Lv. 45

At 4 | Dm 1 | Df 8 | Ar 0 | LP: 9 | Re 10 | Mo 6/10 | AP 3/4

Innate Abilities: Advanced Deployment, Cordelia may have two Advantage Cards attached to her.

oo - Stealth (Subterfuge, Effect)
Cordelia becomes Hidden.
Upkeep: o

oo - Dark Sniper (Subterfuge, Ranged Attack)
Distance (20 inches). +1 Attack / +4 Damage / -2 Armor. This skill can only be used if Cordelia is Hidden.

ooo - Hollow Bullet (Subterfuge, Ranged Attack)
Distance (20 inches). +4 Attack / +4 Damage / -4 Armor. This skill can only be used if Cordelia is Hidden.

ooo - Vortex Shot (Magic, Ranged Attack)
Distance (16 inches). +2 Attack / +5 Damage. If this Attack hits the target, all units within 2 inches of the target character also suffer the Attack.

name: Anima Tactics: Wissenschaft Agent
description:
Nobody knows how the enigmatic Prince Lucanor selects his agents. The motivations that bring someone like him to choose wholly disparate individuals to join their organization are also a mystery. Regardless they are all bound to Wissenschaft by ties stronger than loyalty. Some owe their lives to the Prince or have found in Wissenschaft the only place they truly feel at home. While they may not all appear to have anything in common, Wissenschaft is the focus of their lives.

Neutral Wissenschaft Prowler - Lv. 20+

At 4 | Dm 3 | Df 9 | Ar 0 | LP: 10 | Re 8 | Mo 8/12 | AP 2/4

Agent: Wissenschaft Agents are not unique characters and you may include 1 for every 150 Levels in an Wissenschaft Party. For example, a party of 300 levels could include up to two Wissenschaft Agents.

Innate Abilities: The Agent may have two advantage cards attached to them.

ooo - Chain of Blows (Ki, Attack)
The Agent makes two consecutive attacks against the same target

Wissenschaft Agent Skill Card

A Wissenschaft Agent can possess any combination of the following options, as long the added levels do not take their total level above 40. Any option cannot be chosen more than once.

The Agent recovers one more Action point per turn. Lv. +10
Targets get -2 Armor against the Agent's attacks (both normal and special). Lv. +5
The Agent gets the Innate Ability Ranged Attack, Distance (16 inch). Lv. +5
The Agent gets Advanced Deployment and Open Movement. Lv. +5
The Agent gets +1 Attack and +1 Defense. Lv. +5
The Agent gets +4 Life Points. Lv. +5
The Agent's Speed is increased to 12/16. Lv. +5
The Agent gets the follwing ability: Lv. +5
o - Combined Assault (Ki, Attack)
This attack may only be used immediately after resolving a successful Charge
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Miniatures

name: Bremer Stadtmusikanten
description:
As in the fairy tale the animals must jump on each others’ backs.

Some donkey cards are on the table. Each player receives six cards, which he keeps hidden in his hand. The remaining cards form the draw pile.

In his turn player play a card on the table.
He may play dog sitting on donkey, cat sitting on dog and rooster sitting on cat. Additionally player may play card upon another card with same color
If the player has no matching card, he draws one from the draw pile and his turn is over.

But beware! The rooster will mess up the entire game. If the player has placed a rooster, then he draws a card from the deck and looks out one of the two animals shown. Then the card is placed to the left player and asked if he has the animal in the selected color in his the hand. If no, he takes it to his hand. If Yes the both cards move to next player unitl someone has taken all this cards.

The player who discards the last card must make the sound of one of the animals depicted on the last card.
The winner is the first who plays his last card.
categories: Animals, Card Game, Children's Game, Novel-based

name: Journeys Thru Johnstown
description:
Similar to Monopoly, this game has you buying properties and collecting rent on them. The financial scale is a bit different and one is buying franchises as opposed to houses and hotels.

All of the properties/franchises are related to Johnstown, Pennsylvania. It was published to sponsor and promote the Conemaugh Valley Hospital, Junior Auxiliary, Group 9.

name: DiceAFARI: Double Map Card
description: A larger DiceAFARI map can be created by combining the components of two or more games together, which provides a longer, more strategic game. The Double Map Card is a double-sided card containing 2 large maps that require 2 copies of the game in order to play.
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Set Collection

name: Spin
description:
SPIN. A solitaire game for the Series: Shibumi set

Starting the game
The player starts with a given hand of marbles of diferent colours. The other balls remain in the bag and are used as a resource pool.

The turn
1. The player places one ball from his hand on the board.
2. If the marble touches another ball of a different colour, both balls are replaced with two balls (taken from the pool) of the other third colour.

Game end
The player wins if every ball from his hand is on the board and all of them are of the same colour.

name: Club Golf
description:
The number and nature of the cards have been calculated to present a game of skill, as near to the true game of golf as possible (says the publisher).

Each player's ability is affected by the handicap drawn, both in the distance the ball is struck and the number of hazards encountered. The types of club used are represented by club cards. Hazards commonly encountered in the game are represented by hazard cards. The limitations imposed on a player by their handicap, are further controlled by the hazard handicap detail tables. Penalty cards have to be drawn as indicated by some hazard cards.

There are course score cards for three levels of play - Short, Long and Championship. There is also a Pro Golf Game to play.

The game says "As played by John Richardson" , but I have no idea who he is. At least a professional golfer I hope.

Contents
2 Packs of Hazard Cards(75 Per Pack).
2 Packs of Club Cards(29 Per Pack).
1 Pack of Handicap Cards.
4 Penalty Cards.
22 Score Cards(3 Types).
Money in Two Denominations.
1 Set of Rules.
2 Sets of Rules For Pro Golf.

name: Twaddle
description:
A basic dictionary game. Players create definitions to words and try to determine which is the real answer.

Choosing the correct definition gets a player 2 points, having a player's definition chosen gets 1 point, and the card reader gets 3 points if nobody chooses the real definition.

Points are tallied and the winner is the one with the most points at the end of the game.

name: Vocambolo
description: A word game played on an hexagonal grid, with tiles for consonants and generic tokens for vowels. Every player have an initial dotation of vowels, each turns he get two consonant, and wins when he uses all of his vowels.

name: Das √ú-40 Partyspiel
description:
Objective:
be the first climbing up the board to the top by knowing the correct answers & describing the challenges confronted with (data out of the 80's)
- acting by turn -
A quiz game for people who just turned 40 and want to test their knowledge about trendy things from those times.

Can you remember 'Schwarzwaldklinik', Rubik's Cube,...?
You must explain or guess these 'terms', sometimes in a creative way!
Whoever's guess is correct advances on the scoring board faster than other players.
More fun is achieved by reaching marked/coloured fields on the board; allowed ways of explaining are significantly reduced;
categories: Card Game, Dice, Humor, Party Game, Real-time, Trivia, Word Game
mechanics: Acting, Open Drafting, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Dark Legacy
description:
Welcome to world of Dark Legacy. A world ruled by the ruthless battle mage by the name of the Kaiser. The planet of Titan is at war. The Kaiser is bringing the world to its knees. This is a war where anything is possible and anyone can become a legend. It is here where your journey begins.

Will you join the Kaiser and his allies in the total domination of the planet or will you be part of the opposition? You get to decide how this story will tell itself. Make sure to choose wisely, for the fate of the planet lies within your hands.

Make your choice!

Dark Legacy is a unique strategy game that mixes the best elements of Magic the Gathering, Dungeons and Dragons and Chess and wraps them all up into a in-depth sci-fi/fantasy story. In Dark Legacy, players are no longer bystanders of the battle, they get to be part of it as a war general within one of six different factions. With the unique and various weapons, armor and relics, that a player can equip themselves with, players can become whomever they imagine themselves to be.

In Dark Legacy, it is the players objective to destroy their opponents and their armies, by building a deck of magic spells that no one can withstand, rolling the d20 in their favor and strategically summoning their army to be the strongest. Just like in real battle you will have to anticipate the probability of the unexpected. Don't make choices too hastily for they may be the demise of your army and yourself.

Dark Legacy is a game that can be played one-on-one or in team battle.

Here are the type of cards that can be played in Dark Legacy:

Enhancement cards are for summoned creatures, weapons and the Hero. These cards can either strengthen or weaken that which it is place upon.
Creature cards are just that. They are the faction specific cards that each one of the six different factions use to strengthen their army to win the battle.
Magic cards are the spell cards used to tip the balance in battle. There are faction specific magic cards and general magic cards.
Armor cards are only for the Heroes in battle. This gives each Hero extra defense points on top of their life points.
Weapon cards are only for the Heroes in battle. There is a wide variety of weapon cards and as the Hero levels up there are stronger and more magical weapons that become available to them.
Relic cards are ancient cards with abilities that are available to every player if you find them. There are relics that will fit every players style of fighting.


The Evolution System for Battle

Before the battle begins, players must decide who is going first.
At the beginning of every battle each player draws five cards.
Each player is now allowed to place one card on the equip side of the mat. This card has to cost 0 and the player has to have the correct skill level to put that card down.
There is no damage permitted for the first round in battle, meaning that no one can attack or cast spells that deal damage until it is the first person’s turn again.
The player that is going first must begin the battle by drawing a card. (At the beginning of every turn players will draw a card.)
In order to cast any of the player’s cards they must roll the d20. There is only one roll per turn, unless there is a card in play that allows for another roll. The number that you roll will be the


number of casting points you have to cast cards from your hand.

In order to cast spells you have to have a high enough SKILL LEVEL (SL) and have enough CASTING POINTS (CP).
The player can then cast any number of cards as long as they have the proper SL and CP.
If the opponent has the ability to counter the spell they can do so after the card is cast.


Now the second round begins. At the beginning of the player’s turn they must draw a card and then decide weather to attack or cast and use the cards abilities to help you win the battle.

Charging Field

Players may put any card, within their faction or subsection, on this field face down. This card is now charging. This field is to be used for cards that are above of your skill level.
You may place cards that are in your skill range, but that would defeat the purpose of charging the card. In order to cast the card that you put on the charging field, it must charge for the difference of your skill level and the skill level required to cast
categories: Card Game, Collectible Components, Fantasy, Science Fiction
mechanics: Action Points, Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Role Playing, Storytelling

name: Championship Horse Racing    Sport of Kings
description:
This is a horse race simulation board game. In this game a roll of a D6 is referenced to a chart to determine the movement of each horse. Each horse has a separate card with its movement chart thereon. The charts have three rows of numbers, each for a different section of the track. Turn order is by lane in the first round and then till the finish, turn order is by leader. Lane changes are permitted only as the very first move of a pawn (horse) on its turn. The first lane change is allowed as a forward diagonal movement of the pawn. Additional lane changes in a turn are at a cost of one movement point each, So, if you have five movement points and make two lane changes as the first two movements of your pawn then you can move four spaces forward along the track. There are areas on the track where lane changes are prohibited.
A bit of statistical analysis was made by Cincinnati native Howard Hughes in creating the horse cards. The horse cards reflect the performance of real horses in that those that excel in sprints fair poorly in long distance races and vice versa. There is no provision for betting in this game. The components are somewhat primitive, consisting of; horse movement cards, pawns and coin money all punched from a perforated sheet of card stock. The box art has a beautiful charcoal drawing of a jockey on his horse making their way to the starting gate.

name: Minden Rose
description:
Wargames Rules for European Battles of the Seven Years War (1756-1763) by Barry Lee

Useable with 10-28mm figures. Covers the Seven Years War and includes 2 Scenarios (Minden and Zorndorf). Units of 3-6 bases/elements with 2-6 Units per Brigade. Includes Army Lists and notes for all protagonists. Playable by 2 or more players per side. Quick Reference Sheet included. Fastplay.


Rules now available in Free PDF form at MindenRose Yahoo Group**
categories: Age of Reason, Book, Miniatures, Wargame

name: DIG: the Card Game ‚Äì Luck Mitigation Die
description:
The Luck Mitigation Die is meant to add varying levels of fun and chance to DIG: the Card Game. It has three blank faces and three faces with icons that correspond to three types of cards in the game: Tunnel, Cave-In, and Gemstone.

Simple and Fun Rules

Each time you draw a Cave-In Card, roll the Luck Mitigation Die:



If you roll a blank, nothing happens. Continue drawing, if appropriate.
If you roll the Cave-In Icon, activate the Cave-In Card. Stop drawing cards for that Tunnel.
If you roll the Tunnel Icon, play a free, next-level Tunnel. Continue drawing cards, if appropriate.
If you roll the Gemstone Icon, draw one extra card.



If you encounter another Cave-In during any successive card draws, follow the steps above again.

Advanced Strategic Rules


Before you draw a card during the Mine Phase, you may choose to pay for use of the Luck Mitigation Die as follows: Apprentice Dwarves: 1 Gold, Journeymen Dwarves: 2 Gold, and Master Dwarves: 3 Gold. You may make this payment (to the bank) with only one dwarf per Day.
Draw cards from the Mine deck, as appropriate, one card at a time. If you draw a Cave-In Card, roll the Luck Mitigation Die.



If you roll a blank, nothing happens. Continue drawing, if appropriate.
If you roll the Cave-In Icon, activate the Cave-In Card. Stop drawing cards for this Tunnel.
If you roll the Tunnel Icon, play a free, next-level Tunnel. Continue drawing cards, if appropriate.
If you roll the Gemstone Icon, draw one extra card.



If you encounter another Cave-In during any successive card draws, activate the Cave-In as normal--do not roll the die again.

name: Klug √ºberlegt
description:
