Each card belongs to 1 of 4 areas on the field so chaining cards together to move up the field and score is where the excitement and strategy comes through.

Fantastic Football captures the excitement and unpredictability of soccer in a fast-paced action card game.

https://www.thegamecrafter.com/games/fantastic-football

name: Penchant
description:
Penchant is a two-person trick-taking card game invented in 1893 by John Smith McTear (aka “Jack Sharpe”), but lost to history. It is in the “marriage” family of traditional card games, along with Bezique and Pinochle, and uses a "piquet" deck of 7-A in four suits. Penchant’s unique scoring, method of setting trump, and the addition of blocking melds add extra dimensions of skill to the basic bezique framework.

Each round consists of two phases: the first ten tricks and an end-game of six tricks played from each player's melds drawn back into his or her hand.

Players score for winning aces, 10s, and 7s in tricks (“brisques”), and for melding combinations. Scoring combinations include four of a kind, marriage (king and queen of same suit), sequences, and Penchants (queen and jack). Players systematically block and unblock each other from melding by playing “elder” (face) combinations. Scoring includes a “book bonus” of the most brisques reminiscent of Whist.

name: Rig
description:
Taken from the game's official web site:

"Cobble together your steampunk contraption before your opponent leaves you in a cloud of smoke!

When a flying steam-powered city starts to crash, will you escape to the skies or go down with the rubble? Rig up your escape contraption by raiding the salvage pile and sabotaging your opponent’s machinations. This quick, easy-to-learn game of luck and strategy will leave you eager to play round after round!"

Both players roll 4 six-sided dice each. The player's goal is to be the first to build an escape vehicle with 1 of each type of available rig parts (six in total) found in a pile in the middle of the playing area. Both players roll their dice simultaneously and tally the results. On the player's turn, they may take one token for each color that they rolled, assuming there are enough to grab from the pile. After collecting the tokens, they are placed into the player's queue, but the player must decide for each token if it is going to be a part to their rig or an action. On the player's turn, the top two tokens from the queue are always activated. If it is a part, it is attached to the player's rig. If it is an action, the action is taken and the token is returned to the pile. The first player to collect 1 of each 6 parts to complete their rig wins!
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Pattern Recognition, Set Collection, Variable Player Powers

name: Mc Wiz des Grands
description:
Show your knowledge... Be ready to learn some new things!

A trivia game on celebrities or characters that are grouped in 8 different categories and aimed at French-Canadians.

Each card has 5 questions on a single celebrity that the player must answer. A wrong answer will result in the question redirected at the other players and the card will be placed on the board in a memorization bank. Good answers will let the players progress on the two-sided board.

When the memorization bank reaches 10 cards, they are shuffled and put back in play to be answered really quickly by the players. The player who reaches the end of the path on the game-board wins.

Game components


480 question cards (2400 questions)
1 two-sided game-board
4 pawns
1 ten-sided die

name: Was ist Was: Junior ‚Äì Baustelle Kartenspiel
description:
A card game that teaches children about buildings and building equipments.

The aim of the card game is to solve certain tasks for building something successfully. There are building equipments and people and correct cards must be collected for certain tasks.
If they are successful, they earn that challenge card and the points written on the card. The game ends when one player has collected 10 points or when the last card has been drawn. The player with the most points wins the game.

Components: 16 challenge boards, 53 cards, rules

name: Battle of Hachioji Castle
description:
Issue game of Wargame Japanese History #15.

The battle of Hachioji was fought in 1590. This was part of Hideyoshi's Odawara campaign (http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hachi≈çji_Castle) against the Hojo clan.
The game focuses only on the siege of Hachioji Castle.

Toyotomi's army is divided into 5 clans and each clan has it's own turn. Between two Toyotomi turns, the Hojo player can act. Both players are active five times.

The game ends at the end of 13th turn. If Toyotomi captures the honmaru, he wins. Otherwise, Hojo wins.

Contains 1 map, 1 rulebook, 1 countersheet.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement

name: Diamond
description:
Another connection game by Larry Back uses a unique, diamond-shaped board made of interlocking squares and triangles.
Equipment: 12 black and 12 white pieces for two players, with a neutral set of 15 red pieces. These will be played onto the points of the squares and triangles, and there is a total of 62 playable points on the board. Goal: to occupy the the four corners of any square with your pieces.

Game play: during the first phase, players take turns placing their pieces onto any point of the board. If the winning configuration hasn't been achieved yet, then the second phase begins, in which pieces can be moved to an adjacent point in any direction.

Capturing: a piece can only be captured if it is on a corner of a triangle and is the only piece an opponent has on that triangle or pair thereof. This means that only one piece can be captured at a time; if a move causes you to corner two of an opponent's pieces nothing happens. A captured piece is replaced with a red one.

Red pieces: once placed, they cannot be moved around, but must remain next to at least one black or white piece. If they become isolated, then during a player's turn, he or she may decide to remove such an isolate instead of moving one of his or her pieces.

name: Wings Over Suez
description:
From the website:

Wings Over Suez is part of the Wings at War series of wargames rules from Tumbling Dice. Wings is designed for recreating Arab-Israeli War air combat using Tumbling Dice's 1/600th scale aircraft models.

The games are designed to last around one or two hours. As the sky tends to be a lot less cluttered than the ground, games can be set up quickly and fewer models are required - making for a cheaper night out.

Any number of people can play. As the victory target is dependant on the size of a force, opposing sides don't have to be equally balanced, a smaller or less sophisticated mix of planes can defeat a larger or more advanced enemy by reaching their (lower) victory target first.

Each model represents an individual aircraft or balloon. Elevation is abstracted using 4 levels, and the game uses D6 and D3 (a d6 numbered 1,1,2,2,3,3) for combat resolution.
categories: Aviation / Flight, Miniatures, Modern Warfare, Wargame

name: Panzerschiff
description:
Panzerschiff is a introductory level, low complexity, two-player game of World War II naval combat.

Authentically rated battleships and battlecruisers from Great Britain, Germany, France, Italy, Japan, and the United States fight surface battles on the high seas. The game was originally released in Panzer Digest, and the expanded second edition contains more ships, upgraded components, and advanced rules.

The game includes:

a 16-page illustrated rules booklet,
24 color, thick card ship counters that need to be cut apart prior to play,
color Reference Card, and
small map.


Ships are rated for type, gun size, speed, and armor, and include the following ships:
Britain: Hood, Prince of Wales, Rodney, King George V, Renown, and Queen Elizabeth;
Germany: Bismarck, Tirpitz, Gneisenau, and Scharnhorst;
France: Dunkerque, Strasbourg, and Richelieu;
Italy: Littorio, V.Veneto, and Roma;
Japan: Yamato, Kongo, Musashi, and Nagato;
USA: Iowa, Alaska, Missouri, and North Carolina.

The game system is simple, sets up quickly and plays quickly (most scenarios can easily be completed in 15 or 20 minutes). The game allows you to set up actual or hypothetical WW2 encounters involving battleships and play them to conclusion in a short period of time.

—description from the publisher

name: Stig-Helmers s√§llskapsspel
description: User Summary: Stig-Helmers sällskapsspel is a game with theme from the five swedish movies about Stig-Helmer Olsson. The game is a point to point movement game, but with a twist. With money ("Peseta") you can bribe yourself forward. And there is also cards (Händelsekort/"Filmisar") that can help you or make you overturn. First to the finish with a full itinerary wins.
categories: Movies / TV / Radio theme, Party Game
mechanics: Open Drafting, Point to Point Movement

name: British Bulldog
description:
Description from the publisher:

Britain’s favourite playground game as a board game! Can the Runners make it safely across the playground avoiding the Bulldog? The Teachers can help, but if the Runners get caught it’s “British Bulldog”!

Further details:

One player moves the Runners by rolling a number die and a direction die, whilst the other player moves the Bulldog a number of squares restricted by how many Runners have been caught to date. If all the Runners make it safely across the playground without being caught that player is the winner; if the Bulldog catches all the Runners then that player is the winner. Additional Teacher Squares offer protection for the Runners as the Bulldog cannot enter or pass through these squares.

The game introduces elements of both chess and draughts, and combines luck with strategy making it an easy game to learn but with additional depth for older players.

name: Infinite Space Explorers X-1
description: The first expansion for Infinite Space Explorers provides a new player starship(Muktian) and access to more of the items and races from the Weird Worlds setting.
categories: Science Fiction, Space Exploration, Video Game Theme

name: Âè¨ÂñöÂ∏´Êà∞Áà≠ÔºöËµ∑ÂßãÂ•óË£ù
description:
This Chinese edition of Summoner Wars Starter pack is published by Wargames Club Publishing. The starter pack provides core materials for 1 player, containing a rulebook, 20 damage tokens, and 1 battlefield mapboard of 1 player-side. The mapboard is produced of equal or better quality level as the english version of Premium Set mapboard. Players are required to purchase separate faction packs to play the game.

[Chinese]
Âú®Âè¨ÂñöÂ∏´Êà∞Áà≠‰∏≠‰Ω†ÊâÆÊºî‰∏ÄÂÄãÂè¨ÂñöÂ∏´ÁöÑËßíËâ≤„ÄÇ‰Ω†Ë¢´Âè¨Âñö‰πãÁü≥Ë≥¶

Ê¥æÁ≥ªÂ•óÁâåÊúÉÁç®Á´ã‰∏äÂ∏Ç*
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Variable Player Powers

name: War-Chess: The Game of Battle
description:
"The Game of Battle represents two antagonistic armies, one of which, the Attacking (or Invading) Army, is composed of four figures, each representing a regiment of Light Infantry; five figures, each representing a regiment of Infantry of the Line ; two figures, each representing a regiment of Cavalry; two figures, each representing a battery of Artillery ; and one figure (a wagon), representing the "Supply Train," in which it is to be supposed is carried all of the subsistence, ordnance stores, etc., necessary for the maintenance and effectiveness of the army.

The object of the Attacking Army will be to capture the Citadel.

The other army, called the Defending Army, is composed of four figures, each representing a regiment of Light Infantry; five figures, each representing a regiment of Infantry of the Line ; two figures, each representing a regiment of Cavalry; two figures, each representing a battery of Artillery; and one figure, the Citadel, representing a city in which are arms, ammunition, foundries, subsistence supplies, and all kinds of government property, which it is of vital importance to hold.

The object, therefore, of the Defending Army will be to secure the Citadel against capture."

(From the rulebook Introduction.)

The game is played with miniatures on a board covered with diagonal squares. Across the centre of the board is a river crossed by one bridge and two fords.

name: Urknall: Pulsar
description:
The "Pulsar" expansion to the game Urknall consists of a detachable DIN A6 sheet included in a Mücke Spiele flyer. The sheet displays an image representing a pulsar on one side and the expansion rules on the other.

At the beginning of the game, one of the four 3er-celestial bodies is placed on the pulsar. With four players, an additional free 1er-celestial body is placed on the pulsar so that the celestial body there becomes a 4er-CB.

In a pulsar, the ownership of the elements can change before the active player throws the die. This uncertainty is rewarded because at the end of the game the asset markers placed in the pulsar get twice as many points.

The active player, before throwing the die, sees whether there are unoccupied elements on the pulsar and, if so, the 3er-celestial body in the pulsar is rearranged as follows: a-b-c becomes b-c-a, but the asset markers remains were they laid, so the ownership structure on the celestial body changes (with four players, the 4er-CB changes from a-b-c-d to b-c-d-a).
mechanics: Acting, Point to Point Movement, Set Collection

name: History of War: Philippinen 1944
description:
Philippinen 1944 is a new base set for the game system History of War which can be played all alone, but adds new Japanese and US Marines cards to the game system as well. It can be fully combined with the previous sets.

This new edition consists of two sets - one with the Japanese forces and one with the US Marines forces. You need at least one of each deck, rules are included in each set.

Included are also special scenario rules and Territory Cards for the recreation of the Battle of the Philippine Sea.
categories: Card Game, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Hand Management, Open Drafting

name: Lai Shai
description:
Lai Shai is a two-player game that uses a 10 x 10 red- and white-checkered board. Its square, wood pieces are either red or black (with their designations painted on in gold paint) and placed on red squares only. Players' halves of the board are separated by a "chinese wall" that marks the boundary of their home court vs. their enemy court. Each player has the following pieces: 1 Emperor, 1 Empress, 3 Princes, 5 Guards, and 5 Archers. To begin a game, the pieces are arranged as follows: the red square in the player's lower left corner has a pagoda and gets the Empress, the red square in the lower right corner has a crown and gets the Emperor, between them (in the row nearest the player) are the 3 Princes, on the next row's red squares are placed the 5 Guards, and on the third row's red squares are placed the 5 Archers.

Players then roll dice every turn to determine how many moves each may make, depending on the difference between the numbers they have rolled. Moves may be made with any combination of the player's pieces, for example: one piece moving three times in a row, or three pieces each moving once. The pieces are moved only on red squares, with each type of piece having its own type of moving privilege. Movements must be from one red square to the next unoccupied red square; if the next square is occupied by an enemy piece but the one after is not, the enemy piece must be jumped and removed from the board, and points are scored depending on the point value for that type of piece.

Archers may only move towards enemy court until they reach the enemy's home row and are then turned over to become Princes. Guards, while in home court, may only move towards enemy court, but having crossed the Chinese Wall can then move in either direction. When a Guard reaches the enemy's home row it becomes a Prince. Emperor, Empress, and Princes may move in either direction from the start.

The winning player removes both his enemy's Emperor and Empress by jumping. Point totals have accrued throughout the game, and the instructions are not clear as to what this has to do with the ending outcome, though the text on the cover of the game box indicates these scoring rules may be optional. There are additional choices to be made to do with the effect the dice rolls have on movements and scores, some optional, some not.

name: Napoleonic Rules for a Large-Scale Wargame With Small-Scale Miniatures
description:
Napoleonic Big Battles rules' system for 2/6mm. Regiment/brigade base units. Variable length bound and interesting COS (change of situation) system. A Change of Situation (COS) may be enemy forces appear, you are fired upon, you receive a message etc. COS happen at every level, so a COS for a brigade is also a COS for every higher level formation. The rules list 13 kinds of COS and provide for each a set of possible responses. Responses include sending a message, taking defensive action etc.
Movement is simultaneous. There is no "movement phase". Players simply begin acting on orders until a COS occurs.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Simultaneous Action Selection, Variable Phase Order

name: S.E.A.R.C.H.
description:
Synergic Entropy and Ramifying Closed Hour

User summary

A Japanese indie card game simulating the "endless day loop" fiction genre. Game is played on a 6 card wide and 5 cards high "timeline", and players take turns inserting cards on the timeline by pushing the other cards around. Pushing certain cards activate special powers, pushing others causes other effects. The goal is to finish each "day" with as many of your own character's event cards ending up beside other cards of the same colour.

Each round begins with players selecting one of their character's events to add to the time deck, from which cards are drawn to form the timeline. But beware of the time-eating girl Fragment, who will not only eat cards, but cause time implosions that end the day prematurely.

The player with the most points after six "days" wins.

name: U.S. President
description:
U.S. President is Easy-Fast-Fun game with pyramids.

With 3 sets of pyramids you will go through last 9 weeks of presidential election campaign. With more sets you can experience more weeks and longer game.


At the beginning every player has a lead in some of swing states. (Deal cards)
Than players invest their funds to ads and try to convince voters in swing states. (Place one pyramid per round.)
Last 3 weeks of campaing are really hectic. Mood of voters changies quickly. Candidates have no time to monitor and respond to all attacks. (All players place their pyramids simultaneously.)
On Election Day all votes are counted, and the winner becomes the new president. (Players count electors of swing states they secured.)


Elementary, my dear Watson, just secure absolute majority of electors.

To be a president or not to be, that is the question.



Modified map and State cardsEleven key or swing states are marked on the modified map to send the total of 145 electors.
Each of the eleven key states has its State card, which indicates the number of electors in the State.


Montana - 3
Nevada - 6
Iowa - 6
Colorado - 9
Wisconsin - 10
Virginia - 13
North Carolina - 15
Michigan - 16
Ohio - 18
Pennsylvania - 20
Florida - 29 (but be sure you have sufficient lead according to the rules)


Did you know that even winning in three biggest states does not mean a victory?



Awards:US President is the winner of the Game of the year 2013 Competition (Czech fan-organized competition open for all games with pyramids).



Summary:
The game is a simulation of the U.S. presidential election.
The object of the game is to gain an absolute majority of the electors in key or swing states.
There is a modified map of USA to play on and eleven State cards to play with.
You need at least three sets of pyramids to play the game.


The game was first published as a gift for all fans of pyramids in 2012.

name: Hansa Tradelines
description:
Hansa Tradelines is a route and pattern building game in which players take the roles of merchant citizens of a city part of the old European Hansa league.

It allows many simple and complex play modalities, but in the basic one players have to build their routes and connect their cities to a single starting city which is placed in the middle of the table. In their turn, players have to decide wether to place a route-tile, which is taken from a common face-down tile pile, or a city-tile, which is taken from the players own limited city-tile reserve. Players have to decide the best position for each of their tiles so that they ensure their own connections and prevent other players from doing so in order to achieve victory, which is based on a pointing system related to the geometric connectivity of a hexagon.
categories: Abstract Strategy, Medieval, Print & Play, Puzzle, Renaissance, Territory Building
mechanics: Enclosure, Modular Board, Network and Route Building, Pattern Building, Tile Placement

name: Lalaloopsy: Tea Party Game
description:
From publisher:

Lalaloopsy has invited you to a tea party! Press the tea pot to watch it spin and see if you get a delicious sweet. The tea pot directs your movement around the board. Collect the four sweets and the pretty teacup to complete your tea party and win!

name: Phil Dunn's Sea Battle Games: Naval Wargaming 1650-1945
description:
From the back of the book:

'Sea Battles was a marvelously detailed book on recreating naval warfare. ' Donald Featherstone - author of over 40 books on wargaming and military history This book covers all aspects of naval wargaming with a detailed examination of the key factors affecting gunnery and damage. Chapters include: Napoleonic period rules Ironclad rules Pre-dreadnought rules World War I and II rules Map campaigns This revised edition includes new chapters, illustrations and a Sink the Bismarck game based on Dunn's concepts by the well-known military historian Paddy Griffith. The History of Wargaming Project is edited by John Curry. It aims to present the very best wargaming books and rules to a modern audience. Further details can be found at www.johncurryevents.co.uk.

266 pages. Photos and illustrations.
categories: Book, Miniatures, Napoleonic, Nautical, Wargame, World War I, World War II
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Simulation
publishers: Model & Allied Publications Ltd., The History of Wargaming Project

name: Chapman Pro Football
description: Chapman Pro Football is made of wood and plastic - "You Actually Put the Ball in Play." Uses a "plinko" style area to determine the results of various plays. The ball is moved along a wire above the playing field. There is an American and a Canadian version. Parker Brothers eventually purchased the rights to this game and released it, with the identical board, but different box as Parker Pro Football Game, in both American and Canadian versions.

name: Stock Exchange
description:
"Trade your stocks right away and be a millionaire!"

In this game players take on the role of speculators in the stock market, buying and selling shares in six companies.

There are a variable number of rounds, depending on how long of a game is desired. In each round, players are dealt ten cards which move the price of one stock up or down. (There are also a few special cards which allow special actions.) They then go around the table taking one action each (buy shares in one company, sell shares in one company, or play a special card.). After each player has taken three actions all of the cards are revealed, and the changes to each stock's price are tallied, as is the tax or interest rate for cash in hand.

The first player to get to 50% holding in a company is its Chair, and may suppress the worst price-reduction card (played by anyone) affecting that company in each round. Players holding between 25 and 49.5% of a company may suppress one of their own cards, of any type. (The Chair may veto plays affecting their own company.)

At the end of the game the player with the greatest net worth wins.
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Commodity Speculation, Income, Investment, Market, Ownership, Stock Holding

name: Elves vs Goblins
description:
Overnight, the Goblin King and his henchmen snuck into the Elven King’s treasury and stole all the magical coins stored in it.

Players try to get back as many of the precious coins as possible.

They do so by overcoming Evildoers like Goblin Minions, Trolls, Dragons and even the Goblin Queen and King themselves with the aid of Friends, like Elvish Warriors and Magicians, helpful animals, good Dragons and other helpers. In their quest to outsmart the Goblin King's minions to get the magic gold coins back, enchanted Treasures strengthen the Friends you play.

In this easy-to-pick-up card game for 2 - 4 players, which is mainly geared at children and/or families, players do not play against each other, they cooperate in order to get back the stolen gold coins. The unique cooperative mechanics make this game ideal for kids as they learn how to work together to overcome great evil without leaving any player behind.

The aim of the game is that each player collects a given number of gold coins depending on the number of players. Players draw cards from a shared draw pile of 60 cards that contain "Evildoers", "Friends" and "Treasures". Friends are used to get rid of Evildoers, whilst Treasures help your friends in doing so. When a player manages to beat a bad guy on his or her own, he or she gets 2 gold coins. If other players assisted him or her in doing so, every involved player gets 1 gold coin. When the draw pile runs out everybody counts their gold coins. If one or more players did not manage to acquire the given number of coins, all players lose.

In "Elves vs Goblins" either all players win together by cooperating and playing their Friend cards wisely, or all lose if even only one player is "left behind"!

This game is a children's version of my "Social Worker Game" "Together We Are Strong".
categories: Abstract Strategy, Adventure, Card Game, Children's Game, Fantasy, Fighting, Humor

name: Ugolki
description:
This is a game related to Halma or Chinese Checkers played on an 8x8 board. Each player of 2 players starts with 16 pieces in a 4x4 quarter of the board in a corner. No captures are made, but pieces can move vertically or horizontally only either jumping in an empty space immediately beyond an adjacent piece or into an adjacent empty square. If a jump is made, the same piece can jump again indefinitely i the board position permits. A win is either by being the first to occupy all 16 spaces of the opponent's starting position or having the most in the other player's starting area when either player has no legal move.

Notaly it improves on some of the faults of the related game Grasshopper.

Taken on its own, it is a game where every move to a player's own advantage is likely also to benefit the opponent. Therein lies the challenge.

name: Shattered Stars
description:
Unleash giant robots! Deploy deadly assassins! Betray your friends! Conquer the galaxy!

Shattered Stars is a fast, fun strategy game for 3-4 players. Set in a futuristic universe, it's a game of cunning, deception and treachery in which you'll need make quick decisions and outwit your rivals. Be a cunning diplomat, forging alliances and playing your opponents against each other. Or go just blast them to pieces with giant orbital lasers!

Players race to capture planets, earning them victory points. The first player to reach 10 victory points is the winner. With limited resources, players must choose between conquering new planets, or preventing other players from doing the same.

Each turn consists of 2 phases: Diplomacy and Domination. With special cards and strategies to employ in each phase, there are lots of ways to conquer the galaxy. Players are never knocked out of the game, meaning that there's always a chance to get revenge!
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Modular Board

name: Echo Dungeon
description:
Welcome skilled treasure hunter to the ever-changing Echo Dungeon. It will take strategy, skill, and a fair amount of luck to make it to the treasure. Choose your equipment well for it may be the difference between untold wealth and leaving empty handed. However, the real question isn't if you can make it to the treasure but if you can make it back out.

Echo Dungeon is a light PnP dungeon crawler. Where the objective is to make it to the Treasure Room and back to the Entrance Stairs first. The only drawback is that most of rooms have traps that are trying to prevent you from doing so. This is achieved by placing randomly picked tiles as you make your way through the dungeon.

This game can be played with 1-4 players.

name: States: After the Fall
description:
The government has collapsed. The military has mutinied. Will you be the leader who reunites the country through superior fire power, strategy, and combo-driven tactics?

States: After the Fall is a combo-driven, strategic area control game where players battle to take control of the former United States of America. Each State a player controls is not only a fertile recruitment ground, but also comes with an ability that can award them an edge. These abilities, often anachronistic in theme, can combo to execute wide-sweeping strategic agendas and turn the tide of war!

Combat is quick and determined without dice. The game will have various game modes included scenarios and of course, domination.
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Area Movement, Variable Player Powers

name: 5150: Star Navy
description:
"Without the Star Navy there is no Star Army!"

"The Star Army motto is “We take the war to the enemy; one planet at a time.” They do a fine job of it but we take them to those planets and we get them back. And unless we do our job they can’t do their job. So listen up Cadet and I’ll tell you how we do it…”

In 5150-Star Navy you can command a squadron of ships or a fleet if you like. Your job is simple; sweep the stars of the enemy. For you it’s not who the enemies are but where they are. Your missions will range from hunting pirates to flying the flag and in between you’ll be fighting other Factions and Races, all intent on seeing your ships turned into debris. In 5150 - Star Navy you’ll find:

· Rules for fleet scale spaceship combat.
· Pre-generated scenarios covering a variety of missions.
· A variety of Factions and Races including those found in 5150: Star Army.
· Rules to BYOS - Build your own ships.
· Complete campaign rules that are easy on the book keeping.

5150 - Star Navy can be played solo, same side with everyone against the game, and of course head-to head against your friends. Playable with any ship models, in any scale, this easy to learn yet tough to master game, is perfect for the casual or battle hardened space gamer.

No matter how many times you’ve done it before you still feel the rush when you “blink in”. Scanners confirm what you’ve suspected, the enemy is at hand. As the individual crews rush to battle stations your ships advance in formation. The order to engage is given and the battle is on. Everyone must do their jobs and remember …

"Without the Star Navy there is no Star Army!"
categories: Book, Dice, Fighting, Miniatures, Print & Play, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Secret Unit Deployment, Variable Player Powers

name: JautrƒÅ Sƒìta
description: Every player choose 3 animals. Goal is to collect a maximums numbers of coins. Coins are earned by drawing a product card that match your animal card. The player who has collected the greatest amount of coins after 2 rounds wins the game.

name: Into Battle
description:
Into Battle - Eastern front mid war. This is a tactical WWII game, with individual squads and vehicles being represented on the battlefield.

The complexity level is at the lower end of tactical gaming, using a system based around 5’s and 6’s to give hits etc.

The ‘feel’ of battle comes from command and control rules that reduce a players ability to command everything, morale rules that prevents ‘fight to the last counter’ type games and movement rates that are conducive to the caution needed amidst a raging firefight. The basic game gives 4 scenarios but the counter mix allows for some scenario creation by the user.

name: Grand Prix
description:
"Grand Prix" is one of the bestselling Polish games in the 80's. Its first version showed up in 1984. Its successor is "Formu≈Ça 1" (published in 2007) by the same authors (Jan Rojewski and Micha≈Ç Stajszczak), which is in fact renewed "Grand Prix" with some corrections and changes to the rules and track design.

Game mechanics of both games mentioned above is quite similar to the "Formula 1" from Waddingtons, which was published in 1962 (see: Formula 1).

In every turn the players set the speed of their cars and try to drive through curves without an accident to reach the finish line before opponents. The speed is converted into number of boards which their cars can pass by - every 30 kmph is one board. Maximum speed is 270 kmph.

When safe speed for the curve is exceeded, the player has to roll the dice specified number of times to check if the car would stay on the track after breaking or if the accident (and some additional damage to the tyres and brakes) would happen.

The players are equipped with some amount of tyres and brakes points (represented by cards), which are used during the game when players brake hard to indicate the tyres and brakes wear.

Both types of damage points could be reset to the amount from the beggining of the game in the pit stop during the race.

During the race players can also use tactical cards. Everyone gets 4 types of cards: "Safe braking" ("Hamowanie"), "Start with speed 180 kmph" ("Start 180 km/h"), "+1 board" ("1 Pole"), "+2 boards" ("2 Pola"). Players who start from 2nd and 3rd line get extra cards ("+1 board" and "+2 boards").

There were three editions of the game. Artwork for the two first editions was done by Tomasz Poniatowicz. In the third edition game box artwork was done by Andrzej Gosik.

name: Donald Featherstone's Wargaming Airborne Operations
description:
From the backcover:
"Crete and Arnhem - the two major airborne operations of World War two form the basis for this imaginative and exciting book on wargaming. Airborne dropped by parachute or landed by glider created completely new and different aspects in warfare; tactics, placement, the element of surprise, the mere psychological effect of the threat that must be taken into account. In this book, Donald Featherstone shows how to re-stage the major operations of the war to make many fascinating games. No aspect is neglected: how airborne forces came into existence, their uniforms, equipment, weapons, vehicles and aircraft, British, German and American. He discusses in detail several major engagements., including the two mentioned above, and then goes on to suggest how to adapt these for table-top games, with advice on rules, models and terrain. This edition contains a new set of rules Tarred and Feathered that have developed the original rules of Tarr and Featherstone for the modern wargamer."
categories: Book, Miniatures, Wargame, World War II

name: Het Geheugenspel
description:
Who is able to memorize everything and all actions within the time? Who will collect the most cards at the end of the game? Who can remember crazy words and perform actions and sounds? The Memory Game is a hilarious card game where both children and adults against each recording. Hilarity is guaranteed!

This card game contains 3 types of cards: nonsense words, actions and sounds. A player takes one card from each pile and get thirty seconds to get it all in his minds. Then it is the turn of the opponents: They get 30 seconds to distract the player. Can player 1 say the nonsense word, imitate the action and the sound?

name: Grave Robber
description:
In the 19th Century, Medical Schools needed Cadavers to further their knowledge but there weren’t that many available. This is where you come in. Your job is to dig up graves to provide the Medical schools with enough body parts so they can continue their research. But it isn’t that easy, the police are trying to stop you and of course you have to be careful because there are more than just dead bodies in the graveyard.

Grave Robber is a fun family game for 2 - 4 players where players try and dig up and sell body parts with the aim of making the most money. Each player takes the role of a grave robber (body snatcher) and on their turn they roll two dice and move both their piece to try to dig up/sell body parts and a Police figure to try and hinder/arrest other players. You can visit the Tavern to get help in the form of Tavern Cards and there's a choice of two medical schools - one pays a little more if you're lucky. The church is their in case of trouble with the monsters.
mechanics: Pick-up and Deliver, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Future INC. High-Tech Stakes
description:
Game designed by creative team Lans Macabre. It's an area control strategy based on resource use, betting and bluffing. Players take the roles of megacorporations’ CEOs to enlarge influence and dominance of the world. To do so they must spend resources to get control of cyberpunk freelancers - but it's not as easy as it sounds. The cyberpunks are very hard to control and everyone will try to recruit them. Each player will bet on different resources to get best results.
Future INC. is all about getting control over locations and gathering resources.
Each player starts with the same amount of skyscrapers and tries to expand by building new and capturing or destroying those belonging to other players. Thanks to skyscrapers players gain control over locations – areas of the cyberpunk world - and gather resources.

There are five types of resources in the game:
Credits - represent financial capabilities - used to build new skyscrapers.
Cybernetics - represent technological advancement - used to change ownership of enemy skyscrapers to yours.
Gear - represents military potential - used to destroy skyscrapers.
Programs- represent defense against "cyber terrorism" - used to counter enemy actions.
Influence - represents political power and intel – used to gain an advantage by manipulating game’s mechanics.

The most important thing in Future INC. is using free mercenaries - known as Cyberpunks - to do the dirty work. Using resources, corporation may influence a group of Cyberpunks to capture enemy building and gain victory points.

Game is divided into five turns, each has three phases:
1st phase, collecting resources: in which players gather resources, determine new targets for Cyberpunks and update points status.
2nd phase, mission: in which players, using bluff, bet on resources to gain control over the Cyberpunks.
3rd phase, actions of corporations: in which players spend resources to perform actions against each other.
Points are gathered by winning control over Cyberpunks and locations. The player with the highest score at the end of the fifth turn wins the game.

Future INC. High-Tech Stakes is a dynamic strategy for everyone who likes power struggle and a poker-like experience.
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Betting and Bluffing

name: What Bird Am I?
description:
The object of the game is to identify the bird species in as few clues as possible in order to win the most points for that card. With a point scale of one to five, a player can earn the most points by identifying the bird in just one clue. If it takes a player five clues before identifying the bird, then one point is awarded. A beautiful photo of the bird is on one side of the card for all to see, after the bird has been identified, or if all the clues have been given.

Player with the most points is the winner.

name: Malifaux: Oiran
description:
From the Malifaux Tactica Wiki:

Oiran are the Ten Thunders escorts in Malifaux. They understand the power of words, and find their place in the city by whispering secrets and lies, twisting others to their objectives.

Oiran only have their Concealed Weapon, which is close range. If Oiran is Harmless when they make a Concealed Weapon Strike, you can choose to add a positive flip to either the attack or damage flip, which helps them out a lot.

Oiran are Harmless, and have two ways to regain Harmless after they have lost it, (1) Sultry, and a Cb trigger for killing a model with Concealed Weapons.
Expert Defense improves the benefits of taking a Defensive Stance, giving Oiran an extra positive flip, and only reduces walk and charge by -1/-1.

The Defensive Dance trigger allows Oiran to assume a Defensive Stance after casting Tranquil Dance for a 6+ mask. If you have the card to spare, this allows you to buff your crew or debuff the opponent, if in range, while still protecting Oiran.
If fighting a Wp duel heavy list, keeping models around Oiran can be very useful. She can (0) Appealing to give Wp +1, and (1) Tranquil Dance can give a positive flip to Wp Resist Duels to models within 6".

name: Malifaux: Colette Avatar of Deception
description:
From the Malifaux Tactica Wiki:

Colette, Avatar of Deception is a 3 model master, two of which may be revealed as Decoy Minions.

The Avatar of Deception's main mechanic is hand and deck manipulation of your opponent. The Aetheric Subterfuge Spell and Card Tricks Action which your opponent is unable to resist will allow you to stack your opponent's deck. The Bedazzle Spell and Pick a Card Action will allow you to mess with your opponent's hand.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Horror, Miniatures

name: Robinson Crusoe Game
description: Spin and move game with stunning box cover art by Mcloughlin Brothers. Travel from leaving the port till home.

name: Malifaux: Scales of Justice
description:
From the Malifaux Tactica Wiki:

Scales of Justice is a Totem for Lady Justice. He is on the average scale for a lot of its stats.

The part where the Scales shine brightest though, is its Tip the Scales spell. It requires a high card, but it can be any suit, and if cast, can inflict a positive, or negative twist on its target during its next duel. The opponent can resist it, but if you manage to cast it, it can set up a huge power play. Or, cast it on a friendly target, and give it a better chance at fighting, or resisting a spell.

The Scales also have one (0) action, that allows you to cycle your hand, one card at a time. Use it to get rid of any low cards you might not want, and draw a new one.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Horror, Miniatures

name: Malifaux: Peacekeeper
description:
From the Malifaux Tactica Wiki:

The Peacekeeper is the Guild's massive premiere construct. Its heavy armor and powerful weaponry are offset by a pair of setback Talents that can Paralyze the Peacekeeper or reduce its defense.

Despite its bulk, the Peacekeeper is a very fast model, especially considering it's a Guild model. His movement is slightly above average 5/8, but he is allowed to discard a card to take an additional Walk action each activation due to (+1) Relentless.

The Peacekeeper has two separate abilities it can use to move models. This is a great way to put enemy models into harmful terrain. It is also a great way to get them to drop a Treasure Counter or just move them off the terrain they need to be on for there Strategy or Scheme.

The Peacekeeper is a big mean-looking model and people naturally want to take him out. This is actually a great trick to take advantage of. Many players will concentrate a lot of firepower on the Peacekeeper and ignore the rest of your crew. The fact that the Peacekeeper can survive a beating means they have to dedicate resources for several turns sometimes. Take advantage of this. Let your enemy take out the Peacekeeper while you maneuver to take the Strategies and Schemes you need to win the game

Like most Guild Minions there is not a whole lot of synergy with the Peacekeeper. He works okay in Perdita and Lady Justice crews. He does better in Sonnia Crews because he can use his abilities to push models onto Flame Pillars.

The exception is Hoffman. In a lot of ways they seem made for each other. Hoffman can make the Peacekeeper ignore his Experimental Automation and Faulty Circuits abilities. Meanwhile the Peacekeeper can be a great ride for Hoffman.

Leveticus
This Guild construct is a big brutal enforcer with some solid stats and good Cb. It will return its investment in Scrap Counters on death as well. However, it can be unreliable and is a Control Card hog, so be wary as it could leave Leveticus high and dry. There is no additional benefit to giving this minion Blessings of Desolation.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Horror, Miniatures

name: Extra Impetus 5
description:
New army lists, new campaigns, new rules clarifications for the Impetus miniature wargames rules.
The supplement covers the following armies:

FEUDAL EUROPE
Feudal French
Anglo Norman
Early Feudal English
Later Feudal English
Welsh
Scots
Isles and Highlands
Irish
Anglo Irish
Frisia and Free Cantons
Scandinavian Kingdoms

ITALY AND THE EMPIRE
Italian Communal (1150-1200 AD)
Imperial German
Italian Communal (1200-1320 AD)
Kingdom of Sicily and Naples
Papal States

EL CID AND THE RECONQUISTA
Later Andalusians
El Cid
Almoravids
Almohads
Feudal Castilian, Leonese and Portuguese
Feudal Catalan and Aragonese
Navarrese
Early Nasrids

THE CRUSADES IN THE NORTH
Teutonic Order
Lithuanians or Samogitians
Estonians
Prussians
Kingdom of Serbia
Polish
Kingdom of Hungary
Cumans

THE MONGOL EMPIRE
AND THE FAR EAST
Mongol Conquest
Golden Horde
Ilkhanids
Hsi-Hsia
Koryo Koreans
Jin
Later Sung Chinese
Yuan Chinese
Early Ming
Later Ming
Early Samurai
Middle Samurai
Later Samurai
Ikko Ikki
Yi (Choson) Koreans
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Medieval, Miniatures, Wargame

name: Let's Go Joe
description:
The official GI Joe game of Action - Strategy - Offense - Defense.

The object of this game is to be the first player to score 15 points.

The game board Attack and Defense Area is divided into 91 grid squares. Each grid square is divided into 4 squares on which the soldiers move. The soldiers can move forward, backward, sideways, and diagonally. In the center of the Game Board, there are 3 bridges. The Attacking soldiers can move across the Game Board only by crossing the bridges.

name: Fringe Wars
description:
On a desolate fringe-world, miners discover powerful technology buried in the ruins of an ancient alien civilization. Soon the wasteland erupts in conflict as desperate factions vie for control of the region. Mercenaries from far-away lands converge on the wastes: tech-wizards, warriors in robotic armor, zog-riders and archaeologists, all eager to be hired and join in the impending struggle. Battle is coming. Rally your forces and outgun the opposition!

Fringe Wars is a fast-paced board game where 2-5 players lead small, competing factions hell-bent on controlling the wasteland and procuring the alien artifacts it holds. Players use hero cards to recruit and deploy troops, and fight for control of key locations. Hero cards can be used in combinations to make actions stronger, and deciding how to use each card is vital to winning. Players attack each other and the vicious beasts that live in the wasteland to take control of territories. The player who is able to obtain the most alien artifacts through the heated battle is the winner.
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building
publishers: (Looking for a publisher), Red Raven Games

name: Transformartian
description:
A 2 or 4 Player strategy game.

Players’ attempt to score points by exchanging the positions of coloured pyramids on a grid in order to form specified shapes of one colour. The choices of colours that can be moved have limitations, and the first to score each shape get most points.

(An ICEHOUSE adaptation of Sid Sacksons’ TRANSFORMATION – expanded and with a Variant, “TRANSFORMARTIAN EXXTRA”, to increase the options available. Plus how to play with 3 or 6 Players!).

name: Disney Gummi Bears: The Secret of Gummi Glen Game
description: The Pantry shelf is empty and it's your task to fill it with some freshly brewed gummiberry juice. As you travel through Gummi Glen collecting needed ingredients, you'll visit scenic "Old Rumbler" Falls and the most delicious gummiberry patch in all the kingdom. You choose the route, but you must make all the stops, turning on the water in the pump room, racing through the quicktunnel and, of course, having the brew stirred in Grammi Gummi's kitchen. Be the first to reach the pantry after completing your journey and you will win the game.

name: Hunt for the Ragnarok
description:
Hunt for the Ragnarok is a hidden movement board game for 2-5 players in which one player takes the role of the last heir of a fallen galactic empire fleeing for his life and title aboard the freighter Ragnarok while the rebellious nobles houses pursue.
The desperate and damaged Ragnarok must cross the vast reaches of space - avoiding other inhabited worlds and using stealth and deception to avoid capture. The other players, acting as ships of the rebellious nobles, search for the Ragnarok - each seeking to be the first to find the heir and strengthen their own claim to the title before one of the others can do the same.

The Ragnarok has limited resources and moves slowly. It must rely on deception, misdirection and stealth to avoid the ships of the opposing players.
The Hunters ships have more options for movement, but find tracking the Ragnarok to be the challenge. As they move, they scan space around them and receive data back from the Ragnarok player in the form of cards.
Each Hunter only receives the data derived from their own ship sensors. Since they are working primarily for their own victory and not the collective victory of the Hunters.
Hunters also have access to a once per game power which is derived from a list initially communally available, but each power is removed from the game as it is used.

The Ragnarok wins the game if he can cross a large portion of the board and reach his destination planet.
The Hunter who finds Ragnarok wins the game and claims title to the throne of the empire.

The game includes a variable board set-up, specific scenario set-ups, advanced and optional rules and play formats.

Hunt for the Ragnarok finished second in the 2012 KublaCon Game Design Contest.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Hexagon Grid, Memory, Modular Board, Point to Point Movement, Secret Unit Deployment, Variable Player Powers

name: Intelli Wars
description:
Intelli Wars is a Strategic level Science-Fiction themed space wargame where you manage fleets of spaceships and spend available resources to attack and conquer your opponent’s star systems by deciding when to commit your forces, where they must go and with what support while repairing, refitting and bringing in reinforcements.

It is a 2 player, competitive, turn based, card driven, board-wargame. This is a science-fiction war setting between two space empires. The map is a blank hex grid to allow for various scenarios and thus increase replay value. Players are in the role of fleet commanders in charge of a theater of war with a God’s eye point of view. The scope is that of a campaign operation; events are just part of the wider war.

A unit represents a fleet of spaceships and while the time scale is abstract a turn is meant to represent anywhere from a few weeks to a couple of months. To win you must achieve the scenario's victory point level.

The game in its current format is print & play and files are provided in this page for downloading components and rules in electronic format for printing and assembling.

name: Meerkat Slammers
description:
In the madcap and chaotic card game Meerkat Slammers, the meerkat tribe has lost its leader and descended into anarchy as each competing faction is determined to prove it's the best! Not all meerkats fight fair, though, and players can employ a number of dirty tricks in order to get one up on his rivals.

At the start of the game, each player is dealt 15 cards in five piles, one card in the first pile, two in the second, and so on. Turn the top card of each pile face up, then place the rest of the deck face down in the middle of the playing area. Someone flips over the topmost card of the deck to create the discard pile, then the chaos begins. Every meerkat clan card features a fighting score. You may place any of your face-up cards on the discard pile so long as its fighting score is one below or one above the number of the topmost card on the discard pile. Once you play a card, you can turn over the topmost card of the pile from which it came. In addition, you can always have five individual piles, so if one pile empties, move any face-up card from an existing pile to create a new one.

Event cards can be played at any time. Slam them down next to the discard pile and shout the name of the card. Play stops so that the event instructions can be carried out, after which a new round begins.

The objective is to get rid of all your cards. This alone, however, is not enough to claim victory as many potential clan leaders have come undone at the last moment. As soon as a player is rid of his last card, any player may slam his palm down on the discard pile to claim the victory.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Animals, Card Game, Humor, Party Game

name: The Council
description:
The power is yours...if you dare to take it.

The Council calls to the heroes of the realm in search of a new ruler to guide the kingdom to further prosperity. The Council is in need of a champion, and your past deeds have caught the eye of its members. Show them why you deserve the right to sit amongst the most powerful rulers in the land. This will be no small task as other powerful heroes will be answering the Council's call and building a reputation of their own. Some will create strong alliances, some will harness the earth and elements to awe and inspire the kingdom, while others will carve a bloody wound in the kingdom's enemies. How will you decide to gain the favor of...The Council?

Each turn in The Council, a player moves to a new location, facing random encounters along the way. While at locations, players can attempt to complete quests or recruit assistance for future encounters. When four public quests have been completed, the game ends. Victory points are awarded, and the player with the most VPs becomes the Council's selected champion.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Variable Player Powers

name: Battlecards: World Conflict ‚Äì Western European Campaign: Expansion Pack 3
description:
This 20 card expansion set includes these new cards
British Radar Detection Device
British T-Class Submarine
British Kent Class Cruiser
German ME-163 Rocket Interceptor
German SD KFX-251 Halftrack
German Graf Zeppelin Class Fleet Carrier
Strategic Fire Bombing Conflict Card
Atomic Bomb Conflict Card
Surprise Attack Conflict Card

and extras of
British Illustrious Class Fleet Carrier
British Avro Lancaster
British Supermarine Spitfire
British 25-Pound Gun
British Churchill Tank
German Tiger II Tank
German Jagdpanther Mobile AT Gun
German FW-190
German HE-111
Military Buildup 4/2 Conflict Card
Military Buildup 2/1 Conflict Card
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II

name: Battlecards: World Conflict ‚Äì Western European Campaign: Expansion Pack 4
description:
Expansion to Battlecards Starter Set: Western European Campaign -- Great Britain vs Germany.

This 20 card expansions includes the following:
British T-Class Submarine
Italian Littorio Class Battleship
Italian M1340 Tank
German ME-262 Jet Fighter
German U-Flak Boats (2)
Chemical Warfare Conflict Card
Propaganda Conflict Card

And Extras of:
British Nelson Class Battleship
British DeHavilland Mosquito
British Submarine Spitfire
British Hawker Typhoon
British Crusader Tank
British J-Class Destroyer
German Panther G Tank
German Panzer III
German Junkers Ju-188 Bomber
German Jnkers Ju-87 Dive Bomber
Industrial Strike Conflict Card
Military Buildup 3/1 Conflict Card
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II

name: Battlecards: World Conflict ‚Äì Western European Campaign: Expansion Pack 5
description:
Expansion to Battlecards Starter Set: Western European Campaign -- Great Britain vs Germany.

This 20 card expansion includes the following:
British Special Air Service
British Radar Detection Device
Italian Infantry (2)
German 31 inch Railroad Gun
German V-2 Rocket
Minefield Conflict Card
Mined Harbor Conflict Card

And Extras of:
British CVE Class Escort Carrier
British Wellington Bomber
British Royal Sovereign Class Battleship
British 3.7 inch Anti-Aircraft Artillery
British Hawker Hurricane
German Tiger Tank
German Infantry
German ME-109 Fighter
German U-Boat
Military Buildup 4/2 Conflict Card
Military Buildup 5/3 Conflict Card
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II

name: Monopoly: Valladolid
description:
A monopoly (from Greek monos μœåνος (alone or single) + polein πωλε·øñν (to sell)) exists when a specific person or enterprise is the only supplier of a particular commodity.

Monopoly is a roll-and-move game where players move around the game board buying or trading properties, developing their properties with houses and hotels. When opponents land on players owned property, the owning player collects rent from the landing player. Owning sets of properties increases the rent paid to the player who owns them, by the player who lands on the square. The ultimate goal is to have the most money and drive opponents into bankruptcy.

The classic Monopoly with constructions and other elements from Valladoid, in Spain.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Space Barbarian
description:
Operational level wargame based on Japanese anime series Space Battleship Yamato 2199. The game covering war between Empire of Gamilas and Comet Empire.

Players control star fleet of either the Empire of Gamilas or Comet Empire.
The main engine based on Red Dragon Rising: The Coming War With China. Players manage movement, combat and call for reinforcements to home star.

Winner determined by victory points based on control of star zones or several three death conditions.
categories: Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Area Movement, Secret Unit Deployment

name: Monopoly: Werdenberger & Obertoggenburger
description:
The classic Monopoly with constructions and other elements of the
the two locations Werdenberg and Obertoggenburg, in Switzerland
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Hordes: Gargantuans
description:
From the Publisher's website:

At their most desperate hour, the proud trollkin kriels set out to awaken the legendary mountain kings-ancient monsters of unimaginable size and power. Wurmwood, however, has its own designs on the slumbering beasts and plots to turn them on civilization. Meanwhile, the Skorne Empire seeks retribution against an ancient foe, and Everblight works to perfect his most terrifying dragonspawn yet.

HORDES: Gargantuans brings you the next thrilling chapter of the HORDES saga. Bulk up your game with:

• Powerful new gargantuans-giant warbeasts that tower over armies and bring all-new strategies to the table.
• New warlocks for each faction, including the first-ever warlock units.
• New units and solos to expand HORDES armies.
• New narrative fiction picking up directly after the exciting events of HORDES: Domination.
• A painting and modeling guide to help you prepare your gargantuans for combat.
• Theme Force lists for each new warlock, which allow you to create armies based on specialized forces found in the HORDES world.
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures

name: Lickety Quick
description:
Word-building card game. One set of cards features beginning letters or letter combinations; the other features Lickety Quick clues—part of speech, double letters, number of syllables, and more. Combine the two to make a word first and you win the round and gets the cards as a points.

Player who has collected the most points (cards) at the end of the game is the winner

name: Taunt You a Second Time
description:
This is an expansion for the Monty Python and the Holy Grail CCG.
It is in non-collectible format with 150 new cards. It is also a stand alone game and contains "marquee cards like Tim the Enchanter, the Black Knight, and the Trojan Rabbit.

The tuck box proudly proclaims that "no llamas were harmed during the testing of this product".
categories: Card Game, Humor, Medieval, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: The 7 Habits of Happy Kids Game
description:
This game introduces, practices, and promotes 7 kid-friendly principles of personal happiness. For 3–7 players. Grades 1+

Players choose their playing pieces – characters are from the best-selling 7 Habits of Happy Kids books! They take turns reading cards, responding, and moving around the board to collect tokens for each of the 7 Habits. The first player to fill his or her token holder with 7 tokens becomes the card reader. Play continues until all players have filled their token holders – a true win-win!

description:
[English]
This is the Summoner Wars: Shadow Elves Faction Deck, in Chinese version. The content is the same as the Shadow Elves starter faction in the English Master Set. It expands the Summon Wars with more a new choice of faction. Remark: Faction decks in the Chinese version are published as separate products.

mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Variable Player Powers

name: Âè¨ÂñöÂ∏´Êà∞Áà≠: È≥≥Âá∞Á≤æÈùàÊ¥æÁ≥ªÂ•óÁâå
description:
[English]
This is the Summoner Wars: Phoenix Elves Faction Deck, in Chinese version. The content is the same as the Phoenix Elves starter faction in the English Master Set. It expands the Summon Wars with more a new choice of faction. Remark: Faction decks in the Chinese version are published as separate products.

[Chinese]

categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Variable Player Powers

name: Quack Quack Duck!
description:
Animal Matching Game similar to Go Fish!

Be the first to match the animals to their sounds. Players take turns asking for animals or the sounds those animals make. Tricks are sets of three (two sounds and one animal). The game plays fast and fun, testing your memory.

Animals and sounds are in English and French and the game comes with a special bilingual guide card. French instructions are forthcoming.

name: Cthentacle: Spankham Asylum
description:
Spankham Asylum, a study-ground for those grappling with understanding strange fetishes and psychosexual condition. Doctor Karr investigates a spate of strange, new, tentacular fantasies with the aid of The Patient.

Expand your Cthentacle games into the realm of psychiatry with straitjackets, therapy, tranquilisers and dangerous readings from The Book of Eiboner.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Horror, Humor, Mature / Adult

name: Legend Easy Pack
description:
Easy Pack expands Legend - The History of 1000 Miglia race game.

Thanks to the Easy Pack drivers can now play Legend without writing or calculate their racing time!

You can use your cockpit board to keep track of time, damage and wear and set speed on your Car Performance Card (provided with basic game).

Easy Pack is also a valid support to introduce new gamers to Legend
mechanics: Action Points, Action Queue, Modular Board, Simulation

name: Mabambo
description:
Two sets of 12 stones each are placed in a 5x5 square grid. The first two rows in front of a player, plus the two rightmost pits on the third row contain that player's stones. On his turn, a player must displace one of his stones, performing one of the following legal moves: 1) a stone can be moved orthogonally to an adjacent free field, 2) a stone may jump in a straight line over at least one same-coloured stone, and onto the next free field, 3)a stone can jump over at least one same-coloured stone and into a pit occupied by an opponent's stone which is then captured and removed from the game.

The winner is the first player to capture 10 stones from his opponent or to leave the opponent without legal moves. If both players have only four stones each in play, the game ends in a draw.

The 'Trio Trio' Clemens Gerhards' game set (2010 edition) includes rules and components to play this game, along with two additional Frank Stark's games (Trio Trio and Soli-Bi).

name: Land of the Lost Board Game
description:
from the back of the box

The Prehistoric Land of the Lost - a dry and hot desert, ferocious dinosaurs roaming a steamy jungle, and a steep, rocky precipice, these are just some of the dangers that await you! Join the Porter family and their friends in their quest for the elusive time portal and escape from this primitive land. Escape from Scarface, the ferocious Tyrannosaurus Rex. He will chase you around every path - look out because he's hungry and is coming your way! Also avoid Shung, the Sleestak leader, as he attempts to trap you in his lair! Be the first player to collect three power crystal cards and make your way through the prehistoric pitfalls to the time portal, and then spin to win!

It is notable that this appears to be based on the Krofft Production's 1991 remake of the series rather than the 1974 series.

name: ASL March Madness Double-Blind Pack
description:
The scenario pack features 10 scenarios to be played in a double blind format. 6 of the scenarios are set in World War II, and 4 are from the French Indochina war in 1954. Each side knows its own forces, but has limited information about the other side.

MM15db: Crossroads at Suxy - Suxy, Belgium, 11 May 1940

MM16db: Eve of Destruction - Oktiabr'skii State Farm, west of Prokhorovka, 11 July 1943

MM17db: Busting the Bocage - Vicinity of St. Martin de-Tallevende, France, 6 August 1944

MM18db: Magen David - Vicinity of St. Martin de-Tallevende, France, 6 August 1944

MM19db Strangulation: Hill 674, Hill 674, Dien Bien Phu, Indochina, 22 March 1954

MM20db Isolation: Ban Kho Lai, Ban Kho Lai, Dien Bien Phu, Indochina, 22 March 1954

MM21db Asphyxiation: Dominique 3, Domiminque 3, Dien Bien Phu, Indochina, 30 March 1954

MM22db Frustration: Huguette 7, Hugeuette 7, Dien Bien Phu, Indochina, 2 April 1954

MM23db Djebel el Messeftine, Mateur, Tunisia, 6 May 1945
MM24db Fort IX, Warsaw Poland, 26 September 1939
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Modular Board, Secret Unit Deployment

name: Aizu Campaign
description:
Issue game of Wargame Japanese History #16.

Game covering Aizu campaign of the Boshin War (1868) - (http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Battle_of_Aizu).

With popular TV series “Yae no Sakura” in Japan, Aizu campaign has become much familiar (http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Yae_no_Sakura).

This game uses card-driven mechanics and includes many related events.
It is played in 12 turns and victory is basically determined by control of important areas. The game is usually determined by the final battle at Aizu-Wakamatsu area.
mechanics: Area Movement, Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Dice Rolling

name: Salnave's War: Civil war in Haiti 1867-1870
description:
Salnave's war is Military, Economic and Political game that represents the event that occurred in Haiti form 1867 to 1870. The period of Haitian history called Salnave’s war by some and The War of the Cacos by others saw Haiti split into three competing states and both brilliant naval strategies and inept anti-insurgency campaigns.

The intent of the game is to provide the simple rules, short to medium playing times, indirect player interaction and abstract physical components of a Euro-game and the simulation of strategic combat of a war game.

The game uses a Euro-game approach to simulate the interplay of economics, politics, and military action. This approach is tied to the specific places, personalities, and events of the Caco War to present a compelling way to play out the flow of this intriguing part of history. There are three major modes of play that allow players to follow the events of the war in close historical order, more loosely, or only as a general backdrop.

name: Control Tower
description:
"Control Tower" is a family boardgame about the management of the planes in an airport.
The players are air controllers who must land and take off the planes and distribute those planes in the diferent areas of the airport like repair/maintenance garage or refuelling to satisfice their requeriments.

The game has three phases. Twice of them are played simultaneously the makes the game very agile and exciting. The players feel the tension and anxiety that makes them quick decisions about the suitables planes.

"Control Tower" is addictive boargame for 1 to 4 players, with easy rules but complex making decisions.


"Torre de Control" es un juego de mesa familiar sobre la gestion de aviones en un aeropuerto.
Los jugadores encarnan a controladores aereos de la gestion interna de un aeropuerto y entre sus funciones estan ordenar los aterrizajes y despegues de los aviones y las distribucion de los aviones en los diferentes servicios del aeropuerto tales como repostaje y reparacion y mantenimiento.

El juego se divide en tres fases. Dos de ellas se juegan de manera simultanea dandole al juego vitalidad y ritmo que hace que los jugadores se involucren y sientan la tension y el agobio de la continua llegada de aviones al aeropuerto con distintas necesidades a satisfacer.

"Torre de control" es un juego adictivo de 1 a 4 jugadores, de reglas muy sencillas pero con mucha toma de decisiones.
mechanics: Action Queue, Area Movement, Pick-up and Deliver, Set Collection, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Kill the Powerplay Hockey
description:
A statistical replay game, loosely based on TCS Games previous Olympic Ice Hockey game, High Sticking.
You will find the usual features of TCS team games (rating for attack, defense, killer instinct for Overtime resolution, Third die random modifier), plus advanced rules that put in play even the powerplay opportunities and the penalty killing value of each team, to make each game a little more slower (but still very fast), but much more tense.

It exists a basic version containing rulebook and data for all the WHA seasons (1972-1979) another set with the Early Leagues, from 1887 to 1926 (50 different seasons from manydifferent leagues, NHA, WCHL, PCHA, ECAHA, FAHL, CHA, and so on), a set with NHL from 1917 to 1942, and another set with NHL from 1942 to 1967.

name: F.B.I.
description:
Game for two players. The board represents a city where players must steal atomic energy projector the other player. The movement is done by the adjacency board, eliminating the pieces depends on the type to which they face.


Juego para dos jugadores.El tablero representa una ciudad donde los jugadores deben robar un proyector de energia atómica del otro jugador. El movimiento por el tablero se hace por adyacencia, la eliminación de las piezas depende al tipo a las que se enfrenten.

name: Factory Fever
description:
Factory Fever plays in the warehouse of the Factory Fun factory. Instead of building the machines in your factory, now you must store the products in the warehouse, which is a very different task. What's more, you must store products of the same type in a group or have them connected by conveyors. These products are both dangerous and extremely heavy, so for safety reasons you must not drag them more than once, and all products of one type must be together. Building conveyors helps to connect similar products.

You know which products will need to be stored, but you don't know when and in which combinations, so you must anticipate the future by holding different good options for stocking the goods. The pillar in the middle of your warehouse is as annoying as it was in the factory (Fun) halls.

When your warehouse is finally filled, the game is complete. If each of the six different goods is stored in a single group, you are doing well. For one product that task is easy because you have to store that type of product only once (i.e., 1 tile). The very dangerous product you should place at the wall, and for the mixed product you decide at the end which product type it is. The conveyors should not have dead ends (to the walls or pillar). Each error results in 1 error point, so try to have the fewest errors.

For a new challenge, the B-sides of the boards get used. The player with the best score on the A-sides gets the hardest difficulty level B-side warehouse, and so on.
mechanics: Network and Route Building, Tile Placement

name: Sellsword Miniatures Skirmish Game
description:
Sellsword is a simplified gaming system that prioritizes play. Players command small warbands in small unit combat situations. You can acquire 28mm miniatures from any source you choose. The skirmish game uses a stat card for each unit, and each card has a brief description of an appropriately sculpted and posed miniature.

Sellsword is frequently played with very limited magic. It has a number of different fantasy levels, each listed on a particular unit’s stat cards. The more fantastic a unit’s abilities, the higher its fantasy level. This permits each skirmish played to have a cap on the fantasy level, as the players desire. This is different from a number of roleplaying and skirmish games currently available, where magic runs rampant and high fantasy is the norm. The Sellsword world is perhaps just a bit darker, and a bit grittier. In this way, the Sellsword world is also closer to our own earth. There may be magic, but it is frequently subtle. In similar fashion, science is very limited in Sellsword. You may find that a lightning bolt and a bonfire both do similar types of damage. There is no ‘electrical’ damage, since electricity does not exist. Most people in the Sellsword world know that bad things live in the dark corners of the world, that poison and disease are kindred maladies, and that this is the world where they earn their place in the afterlife.

If the game seems a little daunting, don't despair. The basic game is a good introduction to the system, and you can graduate to the full skirmish game after that. The skirmish game is designed to be played by friends at home, or in a tournament scene.

For those of you that don’t like Grids, we’ll have variant rules for that as well.
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Norway!
description:
This is an small game self-published by Yasushi Nakaguro.
This is an operational level wargame of the German campaign to conquer Norway in 1940.
The game has only 3 pages rulebook and each side has only 15 naval units. And game contiues 15 turns.
Naval movement is an area movement. Combat occured in the same area. Landing and air power are included but very abstracted.
The German player has 2 basic strategies, one is conquering Norway by landing force and the other is advancing one of his trade raider ship to the Atlantic. In both cases, the victory is finally decided by victory points. They are gained by conquering Norway or advancing trade raiders or eliminating enemy units.
The game has small map which are printed on the back side of the rulebook.
The game can be played within 1 hour.
Second game of "long-map mini game trilogy".

name: Railroad game
description: Railroad Game. No. 4661. Object of game is to travel with train from San Francisco to New York. The first player, who reach New York wins the game.
mechanics: Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Jerusalem: Call to Arms
description:
The card called "Call to Arms" is a new Action card for Jerusalem.

Just add the card to the basic Action card deck to play with it.

The player who plays this card may move their squires from one area to another (with the exception of areas blocked by Barons). For each Silver Bezant paid to the Bank, you can move up to 2 squires.

name: Castle Toppe
description:
The conquest of medieval Europe is one which battles kings and countries to dominate these lands through trade, attack, defense, strategic placement, movement and expansion. One requires the strategy of planning for successful offensive military execution as well as for defensive game play, and while the roll of the die may determine specific results, both bold offensives and conservative defensives shall impact the overall outcome. Only with banners held high and rule held sound would the victor reign medieval Europe!

In Castle Toppe - The Game of Sovereigns, players attempt to gain rule of medieval Europe through trade, building, expansion, and conquest. Game play is pulsed with Event Cards which can advantage or disadvantage a player's resources, buildings and tactics. Players can both strategically defend or aggressively conquest with boldness. Boats and Ships are even used in expansions and battles. The player to first successfully fly 5 banners (obtained through building a castle and/or a ship) in at least three ruling countries wins.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Network and Route Building, Set Collection, Trading

name: RinneTensei
description:
Board & Pieces
Rinne and Tensei are played between two opponents on a 5x6 square board.

Each player has 5 pieces, which move as King, Knight, Bishop, Rook, and Queen.

Movements
All pieces start as King, one piece in the goal position on your end, then the four others on a M-shaped line on the 2 and 3 ranks.

Pieces move exactly the same as in normal chess games, except that they cannot be captured as in normal chess. Pieces can be captured, only when they are either in your or oppnent's goal square.

After each move, pieces are promoted:
In Rinne, in a fixed order: King -> Knight -> Bishop -> Rook -> Queen -> King...
In Tensei, promotion of pieces are determined by rolling a dice.

Goal
You win when any of your pieces is placed in the middle square in the last row, your goal square for two consecutive turns, or when there is no legitimate moves left for your opponent.

name: T4
description:
Board & Pieces
T4 is played between two opponents on a 4x4 square board.
Each player has 16 units of 3 different kinds of pieces, 48 pieces in total. No pieces are placed on the board when the game starts.

Movements
Players take the following 2 actions in one turn:
Take one of his/her pieces from outside the board and place it at an empty square on the board, then,
Move a piece or a set of pieces from one square to another on the board.

Pieces can be placed at any empty squares or at already-occupied squares in condition that already-placed pieces are different kind(s) from the one that is going to be placed.

Accordingly, how pieces are placed at a square are 7 different ways as follows: 3 different single pieces and 4 different combination (sets) of pieces. „ÄÄ

After placing a piece on the board, players move a piece or a set of pieces from a square to another.

Players can choose to move either a single piece or a set of pieces together, but cannot move a single piece out of a set of pieces from a square.

Pieces are moved as Queen in Chess: They can be moved any number of vacant squares diagonally, horizontally, or vertically.
