This solitaire card game is played with a standard 52 card deck with 1 (or optionally 2) Joker cards. The goal is to eliminate all royalty cards before the stockpile runs out.

name: Seekers: Treasure Hunt
description:
Earl Von Venture’s Guide!

In Seekers: Treasure Hunt, you are an archeologist, and your goal is to find the buried treasure.

Objective:

There are 4 clues in every game. Land on all 4 eye stones to collect clues to find the exact location of the treasure and dig for the treasure.

Gameplay:

In order to play the game, each player starts by selecting two character cards and drawing 3 playing cards. Each character will be represented on the board game map by a colored gem, which will be used to search for the treasure. Each player's character starts at the designated start boxes. Now the game is ready to be played!

Choose a player to start the game.The game is played in turns, in a clockwise direction.The following are the actions each player takes during his/her turn:

1. Draw one card from the top of the playing cards pile.

2. Activate Character Abilities and Move each of your characters.

3. Use any number of cards (playing cards and treasure chest cards) in your hand.

4. Discard extra cards.

During the game, players can go to the various treasure chest tiles to collect treasure chest cards, each of which has a special ability.Some of these cards help you get to the eye stones faster and help you win faster.

The game ends when one player lands on the treasure location and digs for the treasure.
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Point to Point Movement, Role Playing

name: RRR: Adventurer Promo Tile
description: This promo tile for RRR allows a player to add a neutral tile from the neutral area to their personal area.
categories: Abstract Strategy, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy

name: RRR: Hayato Kisaragi Promo Tile
description: This promo tile for RRR allows a player to draw a neutral tile at random from the neutral tiles not chosen for this game to their area.
categories: Abstract Strategy, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy

name: Mutosaurus
description:
A print and play card game with dinosaurs.

Draw cards and put your dinosaurs in play: herbivorous, omnivorous, or carnivorous. Make them change with mutation.

The game ends when the volcano and the meteor cards are in play, it is the begining of the mass extinction, the K. T.

Score points for the bigger dinosaurs in play, but there's no place for every one, you count only: 3 herbivores, 2 omnivores and 1 carnivore.

The cards are language independent, rules are in French and English.
categories: Animals, Card Game, Prehistoric, Print & Play

name: Marshall
description:
For the first time, a game about Marshall amps. Explore the exciting life of Jim Marshall as the Father of Loud, a great musician and champion engineer.

The only Marshall trivia game. 50 years of rock history. A tribute to the gods of riffs.

The loudest rock game ever.


1,600 trivia questions ranging from early rock and metal to current artists. All questions have three levels of difficulty: Poser, Fan and Scientist. All players are always involved since they bet on each other’s rock knowledge.

The goal is to be the first to finish one lap around the board through the use of rock knowledge, clever betting and a bit of luck. Players answer questions about anecdotes, myths, rockers, albums, songs and Sex, Amps & Rock ‘n’ Roll. You can also be asked to hum the riffs of well-known rock songs.

Features:

Authentic Rock Science Marshall Tortex game paws by DUNLOP, made exclusively for this game.

Inspired by the classic Marshall look of the 50th anniversary amps, the game even has its own Marshall model number.

Exclusive limited edition poster, Rock Science Marshall picks and Marshall stack card holders, found only in this game.

name: Bzura 1939
description:
This is a game of a series using the W-39 (Wrzesien 1939 - September 1939) system rules.

The Battle of the Bzura (or Kutno or Battle of Kutno — German name) was a battle in the opening campaign of World War II during the 1939 German invasion of Poland, fought between 9 and 19 September, 1939, between Polish and German forces. Finally, the Germans outflanked the Polish forces and took all of western Poland. It was the single largest battle in the 1939 September campaign and took place to the west of Warsaw, near the Bzura River. In it, a Polish breakout attack gained initial success but eventually faltered after a concentrated German counterattack.

The 4th edition includes the book "Piotrków 1939" per publisher webpage.

name: Kill the Overlord: Patronage
description:
Kickstarter third character role set. Includes eight additional character role cards:

8- Prince/Princess
7- Whisperer
6- Patrician
5- Doctor
4- Bishop
3- Barrister
2- Swindler
1- Assassin

Set includes additional rules for:

- Badge cards:
- Assassin: Death Badge
- Barrister: False Evidence
- Whisper: Rumor
- Prince/Princess card with 'promises' binding agreement [player that breaks a promise is immediately executed]
- Activation Order clarifying rule [start with highest ranked player]
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Medieval, Political

name: Kings of Sun Tzu
description:
Kings of Sun Tzu is a 2-4 player competitive game played in rounds centered on situational strategies, resource management, and calculated gambles. Each player is a king of a powerful military state, vying to unite and rule all of China. Players start each round by rolling dice and placing them on the battlefield. Each player must then puzzle out the best move they can make by evaluating dice positions, resources on the battlefield, and the opponent’s goals. Troops, heroes, tactics, and strategies can all be used to alter the outcome as players try to defeat their opponents and be declared the first emperor of China.

Kings of Sun Tzu is inspired by the history of China from around 475 BC through 221 BC known as the “Warring States” period. The rulers of many powerful states were embroiled in war to determine who would emerge as the conqueror and king of a unified China. This is the era in which many military innovations occurred in China; the use of iron weapons over bronze and the modernization of armies with mass infantry, crossbowmen, and cavalry. Around this time, many intellectual developments were also taking place, such as the Hundred Schools of Thought, which included philosophies like Confucianism and Taoism that were being cultivated and spread across the land. This period also saw the utilization of many great Chinese military classics, including the most celebrated of them all, Sun Tzu’s treatise on military strategy, The Art of War.
mechanics: Action Queue, Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Dice Rolling, Hand Management

name: Mayfair Games Limited Edition Promo Expansion Set #3
description:
The Mayfair Games Limited Edition Promo Expansion Set #3 is composed of 3 expansions:

Bacchus' Banquet: Bad Gas
If you are given poison, you may choose to flip the bad gas token. If the token lands blank side up, there is no effect, and play proceeds as usual. If it lands bad gas side up, immediately move your belt down one notch.

Additionally, neighboring players might be affected by your gas. The player to your left and the player to your right must check to see if they are affected! They each flip the bad gas token. If their flip lands gas side up, then they are forced to purge and immediately move their belt down one notch.

If both your left and right neighbors purged, you are sickened by their acts and must move your belt up by the same number of spaces as the poison you originally received.

Family Business: Blood Brothers and The Moll Expansions
If you currently control the weakest mob (fewest surviving members), you may take the Blood Brothers tile and place it Blood Brothers side up in front of you.

Blood Brothers: Whenever one of your mobsters is added to the Hit List, you must move one mobster already on the Hit List to the space directly in front of your just-added mobster (effectively making them a higher priority on the Hit List). The mobster you move can be one of yours, or an opponent's. If there are no other mobsters on the Hit List then ignore the effect.

When you activate Blood Brothers you must make a choice: either keep the tile Blood Brothers side up, or turn it over to The Moll side.

The Moll: Whenever one of your mobsters is added to the Hit List, you may take a mobster that is controlled by the player that put you on the Hit List and place it on the Hit List in the space behind your just-added mobster. When you activate The Moll, you must flip the tile back over to the Blood Brothers side.

When your mob is no longer the weakest in play, or you are eliminated, you must give the tile to the player with the weakest mob. If there is ever a tie, nobody may control the tile until one player has the weakest mob. When there are only three players left in the game, this tile is taken out of play and is returned to the box.

Zen Garden: Tea House and Tools
Each player begins the game with a Tea House and Tools tile. The tile is placed using the same rules as a lantern tile. However, when you place it, you have a choice which side you want to place face up: Tea House or Tools.

A tea house is treated much like a lantern: it is wild, and it can still be a part of a pattern. However, it cannot be replaced like a lantern. A tools tile can be replaced exactly like a lantern. However, it is a part of NO landscapes. It cannot be a part of any pattern.

name: Verr√ºckt
description:
Verrück doch mal
German text on backside of the box: In diesem spannenden Spiel wird versucht, durch Bildung möglichst vieler und langer Wörter die meisten Punkte zu erzielen. Durch das Verrücken von Buchstabenchips muss ein Wort gebildet werden, wobei jeder verwendete Buchstabenchip Punkte bringt. Auch Sonderpunkte sind möglich. Die Spieler sind abwechselnd an der Reihe, wodurch sich immer wieder neue Möglichkeiten ergeben. Optimales Wort gefunden? Oder sind etwa noch mehr Punkte möglich? Flexibles Denken ist hierbei gefragt. Doch Eile ist geboten, denn die Zeit läuft ab.

English: Try to get the most points by creating the most and the longest words. Build it by shifting letter chips, every chip counts. Players alternate, so every time new chances occur. Found the optimal word? Or are more points possible? But do not dawdle, time runs short.

name: Feudalizm
description:
Feudalizm is a strategy game set in a medieval atmosphere. The player takes on the role of a local prince and expanding the power of subordinate lands. The game offers a wide range of possible actions: construction of castles, towns, cities and rural location, construction of business facilities, trade, sieges and assaults of castles or towns. The action is varied random events in the form of cards. The modular system allows the board to change its appearance at each game.

Each player starts the game with the disposal of city, a sum of money, a certain amount of raw materials and the deployment of troops and several farm buildings. The player's task is to manage the development of his principality by building new business facilities, colonize new areas, increasing the strength of the army, the establishment of villages and towns, castles extension locks. The main objective pursued by each of the players is dominance over its rivals, which can be obtained on how the economic or military conquering lands belonging to the opponents.

The game is divided into rounds, each round corresponds to one seasonal: spring, summer, autumn, winter. During each turn a player can perform up to four specific actions. The game ends when one player has to fulfill the conditions of economic or military dominance over their opponents.

The basic raw materials present in the game are : wood , stone , ore, iron , food , horses, consumer goods , and weapons and armor .

The game includes a deck of 30 cards random discovered alternately by the players. There are also so-called card . advisors drawn or selected before the start of the game . Features counselors have a significant impact on the course of the game.

The currency of the game are known. kordyty denominations of 1 , 2, 5 and 10 Outbuildings, workers, settlers , towns and villages are in the form of cardboard chips. Castles in the discretion of the buyer may be in the form of chips or resin models.

In choosing the path of military conquest available to the player are various units : light and heavy cavalry , infantry peasant, municipal police, swordsmen, axemen, halberdiers, archers, crossbow and machine battle . Battles can be resolved in a very fast manner (for the impatient players) , or on the board battle (for players with a strategic verve ).


Jest to gra osadzona w klimacie ≈õredniowiecza. Gracz wciela siƒô w rolƒô lokalnego ksiƒôcia i rozbudowuje potƒôgƒô podleg≈Çych sobie ziem. Gra oferuje szerokie spektrum mo≈ºliwych akcji: budowa zamków, grodów, lokacja miast i wsi, budowa obiektów gospodarczych, handel, oblƒô≈ºenia i szturmy zamków lub grodów. Akcjƒô urozmaicajƒÖ wydarzenia losowe w postaci kart. Modu≈Çowy uk≈Çad planszy pozwala zmieniaƒá jej wyglƒÖd przy ka≈ºdej rozgrywce.

Ka≈ºdy z graczy rozpoczyna grƒô majƒÖc do dyspozycji gród, pewnƒÖ sumƒô pieniƒôdzy, okre≈õlonƒÖ ilo≈õƒá surowców i oddzia≈Çów wojska oraz kilka obiektów gospodarczych. Zadaniem gracza jest kierowanie rozwojem swego ksiƒôstwa poprzez budowanie nowych obiektów gospodarczych, kolonizowanie nowych terenów, zwiƒôkszanie si≈Çy armii, zak≈Çadanie wsi i miast, rozbudowa grodów w zamki. G≈Çównym celem do którego dƒÖ≈ºy ka≈ºdy z graczy jest dominacja nad rywalami, którƒÖ mo≈ºna uzyskaƒá na sposób gospodarczy lub militarny podbijajƒÖc tereny nale≈ºƒÖce do przeciwników.

Gra podzielona jest na tury, ka≈ºda tura odpowiada jednemu sezonowi: wiosna, lato, jesie≈Ñ, zima. Podczas ka≈ºdej z tur gracz mo≈ºe wykonaƒá do czterech okre≈õlonych czynno≈õci. Gra ko≈Ñczy siƒô w chwili gdy jeden z graczy spe≈Çni warunki dominacji gospodarczej lub militarnej nad swymi przeciwnikami.

Podstawowe surowce wystƒôpujƒÖce w grze sƒÖ : drewno , kamie≈Ñ, ≈ºelazo , rudy , jedzenie , konie, dobra konsumpcyjne , a bro≈Ñ i zbroje .

Gra zawiera taliƒô 30 kart losowych odkrywanych na przemian przez graczy. WystƒôpujƒÖ równie≈º karty tzw. doradców losowane lub wybierane przed rozpoczƒôciem rozgrywki. Cechy doradców majƒÖ istotny wp≈Çyw na przebieg gry.

WalutƒÖ w grze sƒÖ tzw. kordyty o nomina≈Çach 1, 2, 5 i 10. Budynki gospodarcze, robotnicy, osadnicy, miasta oraz wsie wystƒôpujƒÖ w postaci kartonowych ≈ºetonów. Grody i zamki w zale≈ºno≈õci od uznania kupujƒÖcego mogƒÖ byƒá w formie ≈ºetonów lub ≈ºywicznych modeli.

ObierajƒÖc drogƒô militarnego podboju do dyspozycji gracza sƒÖ ró≈ºnorakie jednostki: lekka i ciƒô≈ºka jazda, piechota ch≈Çopska, stra≈º miejska, miecznicy, topornicy, halabardnicy, ≈Çucznicy, kusznicy, oraz machiny bojowe. Bitwy rozstrzygane mogƒÖ byƒá w sposób bardzo szybki (dla niecierpliwych graczy), lub na planszy bitewnej (dla graczy z zaciƒôciem strategicznym).

name: Kingdoms Card Game
description:
Simple card game for 2-4 people.

Players are trying to form their own province in a kingdom using 5 different characters.

Players must always look after single provinces to make sure that each of them makes the maximum income to the royal treasury. Once shall you overlook any bad thing about any province and it will pull your growing kingdom back. And also neighbors will never leave you in peace trying to advance their kingdoms and take a piece of other lands.

name: Robin Hood 2888
description:
Robin Hood and his gifted team of young vigilantes must help the downtrodden people of their land and deal with evil plots of the Sheriff – before finally meeting up with the villain himself in a final showdown to decide the fate of the Nottingham Sector.

This is a fully cooperative game which takes place over a series of rounds. Players must work together, pooling their time and resources, to contend with sinister plots affecting the Nottingham Sector.

By rolling specific types of dice (Combat, Stealth, or Diplomacy), players may choose how best to resolve the Plots. At the end of each round, the Threat Level may rise, making subsequent rounds much harder.

In the end, the players will have to push forward through the Sheriff's fortress-like Factory to confront the villain himself!

Only through careful management of the dice, tactical decisions about how to resolve the Plots, and a little luck of the roll will Robin Hood and his heroic team win the day!
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers, Worker Placement

name: Inertia
description:
Inertia is a game of unification in the sense of Claude Soucie's Lines of Action. The first player to unite all of his pieces on the board into a single group wins.

To start, white places one piece anywhere on the 8x8 square board. Players then alternate placing pieces on the board, with the first piece being adjacent to the opponent's most recently placed piece and the second piece being adjacent to no pieces, either orthogonally or diagonally.

Once a player can't place a second piece, the placement phase ends and the next player starts the movement phase. On a turn, a player moves one piece akin to a queen in chess, with movement ending after passing through any number of empty spaces or by landing on an opponent's piece and capturing it. If this move increases the total number of groups on the board — with a group being a single stone or a series of straight- or diagonally-connected like-colored stones — then the move is illegal. Gameplay continues until one player unites all of his pieces into a single group; if he simultaneously creates single groups for both players, then the game is a draw.

Instead of using a chess board, Inertia can be played on a hexhex board with pieces moving like hex rooks.

name: Weft
description:
IntroductionWeft is a drawless connection game for two players: Red and Blue. It’s played with trapezium-shaped pieces on the cells of an initially empty basket-weave grid. The top and bottom edges of the board are colored red; the left and right edges are colored blue.

All pieces are the same and only differ in color. They can be placed with any side (front or back) up. A cell can accommodate two pieces, and no piece can be placed in a way that makes this physically impossible.



DefinitionsTwo pieces are point adjacent if they share nothing more than a vertex, and edge adjacent if they share at least part of a side longer than a vertex.



PlayStarting with Red, the players take turns placing pieces of their own color on empty spaces of the board, one piece per turn.

At the end of a turn, for any two point adjacent, like-colored pieces there must be at least one like-colored piece edge adjacent to both.

Passing is not allowed. Players will always have a placement available and must make one.

The game is won by the player who completes a chain of edge adjacent pieces of their color touching the two opposite board edges of his color. Draws are not possible.



Pie ruleThe pie rule is used in order to make the game fair. This means that Blue will have the option, on their first turn only, to change sides instead of making a regular move.
mechanics: Chaining, Connections, Paper-and-Pencil, Pattern Recognition, Tile Placement

name: Jogo Mortal Kombat
description:
THE WORLD’S GREATEST FIGHTERS ARE PRESENT. BUT ONLY ONE WILL BE THE GREAT CHAMPION!
There are 6 character to chose from MORTAL KOMBAT - Shang Tsung, Goro, Johnny Cage, Raiden, Sonya Blade or
Liu Kang.
Each player chooses one of them and took a position in the arena. Then spins the roulette wheel to move your
character around the arena. The opponent was reached: the battle begins.

Select an hit from the attack cards. Your opponent must defend, counter-attacking with the same hit. The one who
apply the strongest hit - determined by the number of dots - gets to choose the next blow in the combat
sequence and so on. Are always three strokes. The loser, loses a life.

But there’s more: if someone wins 3 consecutive exchanges of blows gets a… “FATALITY”. He has the right to
attempt a fatal blow at the roulette, you can throw the opponent to the throns, eliminating him from the
tournament. Who loses all lives of the same color will also be eliminated. Among all the greatest fighters in the
world, only one - only one - will be the MORTAL KOMBAT’s great champion! Who will be?

name: The Celebrated Jumping Frog of Calaveras County
description:
Join in this crazy dash to hop your frog across the finish line, but don't let your opponent know which frog is yours. Hop. Bluff. Win.

The Celebrated Jumping Frog of Calaveras County takes place at a frog jumping contest. It relies on bluffing to make your frog finish first, bidding for turn order each round, and planning your next move. At the beginning of the game, each player draws a color card at random to determine which frog to get to the finish line. Cards are used for both bidding for who hops first and the type of action is performed. Actions include hopping one frogs, flipping over frogs, moving to the top of a frogpile and more!
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Grid Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Hausnummer
description:
Paper-and-pencil game where from 2 to 4 players using pencils of different colours must throw a die and write the thrown values on an 8x8 board, forming numbers that will be scored when a row or column has been totally filled.

In their turn, a player must throw a die and write the value on one square of an 8x8 board, as far from the side of the board as the value shown in the die (1 is the border and so on). The value can be written as a first digit (tens) or as a second digit (units) in a number. The round ends when a row or column of the board has been filled up with numbers, all having a second digit and at least one having a first digit. Players will then score the numbers in the row or column that are fully in their colour; it's possible to "share" numbers but they won't score.

A whole game consists of several rounds: three for three players and four for two or four players.

name: Islands
description:
In Islands you will use strategy and creative concepts to win. You will need to attack and defend in order to conquer. Move your characters over the path you have created and jump your opponent to send them away. Leave them stranded without a path to win!

Contents: 40 "rocks", 20 marbles, game board, instructions, and storage bag.

name: Sechser Vorteil
description:
Paper-and-pencil game where from 2 to 4 players must score the most possible points by enclosing spaces of an 8x8 board. Three extra dice are required.

Each player throws the three dice in their turn and chooses any combination of these dice of which the sum equals 6; these values are then written on vertically or horizontally consecutive spaces of the board. When an area of the board has been enclosed, the player with the biggest amount of border spaces in their colour fills the enclosed spaces with dots in their colour; if there is a tie the spaces remain blank until a space in the area is filled and the tie is broken. Areas including spaces on the border can include two spaces at most.

When every space on the board has either a number or a dot the game ends; the player with most dots wins. An alternative scoring method is offered: dots score two points and border spaces score one point.

name: Ascension: Michelle, Star Oracle Promo Card
description:
Ascension: Michelle, Star Oracle features Michelle Swan, the winner of the Indianapolis Ascension: Immortal Heroes tournament hosted by Star City Games.

Cost: 4 Rune
Value: 2 Honor
Effect: Draw a card. Unite: Gain 1 Rune, 1 Power, 1 Honor, 1 Energy (Gain this effect once if you play or have played another Lifebound Hero this turn.)
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy

name: Shadow Shift
description:
Four stealthy thieves slip the perimeter security of an anonymous warehouse. Springing through air ducts they silently merge with the shadows that dominate the building’s interior. Each criminal tries to outdo the others and reach a vault hidden at the furthest end of the silent storage facility. However standing in their way are the two security guards of the Shadow Shift who relentlessly patrol the darkened corridors trying to apprehend any trespassers.

In Shadow Shift stealth is the name of the game. Criminal players choose to guide their thieves, through the darkened maze of corridors using subterfuge, bluffs, misdirection and cunning to be the first to reach the vault doors. The Security Guards player must use his two Guards and powers of deduction to uncover which of the warehouse’s many shadows conceal the criminals.

The object of Shadow Shift depends on what role you choose. Criminals must get from the break-in point, one of four unsecured air vents, to a vault without being detected by a Guard. The Guards must find all of the Criminals before any of them reaches a vault.

Shadow Shift is a point to point movement game where you either have to gaurd a vault or rob a vault. The gaurds spend the games trying to work out which of the many moving shadows are hiding a criminal while not straying too far from the vault lest a criminal sneeks past. The criminal player spend the game shuffling the shadows, confusing the guards and them making a dash for the vault but only when the time is right.

name: Sweeping the Doorstep
description:
A previously unpublished expansion for the ASL Starter Kits, utilizing boards and countermixes for ASLSK 2 and 3. Included as an insert to Tactical Wargamer's Journal, Issue 3.

Sweeping the Doorstep is a two-player scenario depicting the fighting at Carpiquet in July 1944. The scenario was designed as part of the Battles of Carpiquet (q.v.) contest but was not released with those scenarios as it was the only ASLSK scenario in the contest. In addition to the scenario, playtest notes and historical articles are included.

Tactical Wargamer's Journal (ISSN 1918-9729), published on a non-regular schedule, covers topics of interest on all aspects of the world of commercial tactical wargaming, with its focus set on warfare at the man-to-man, squad and platoon level in the 20th Century and contemporary era. Tactical Wargamer's Journal (TWJ) places emphasis on both military history and the history of tactical level gaming itself.

Issue 3 focuses on the history of the 21st Army Group in Northwest Europe and depictions of the Commonwealth Armies in that theatre in tactical-level wargames.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Line of Sight

name: Krampus
description:
Krampus is a Werewolf/Mafia re-theme for the holidays where some players are Krampusz, a race of Alpine Christmas demons who abduct naughty children and carry them off to their lair to eat. Most of the players, though, are children who are trying to tattle to the Parent (the moderator) about the right Krampusz. There are also a variety of other Christmas roles, including Frosty, Elf on the Shelf, Jesus, and the Ghosts of Christmas Past, Present, and Future.

If the children correctly tattle on all of the Krampusz, they win. If the Krampusz outnumber the children, they win.
categories: Card Game, Deduction, Party Game, Print & Play
mechanics: Acting, Betting and Bluffing, Cooperative Game, Hidden Roles, Negotiation, Player Elimination, Team-Based Game, Variable Player Powers, Voting

name: Democracy
description:
Democracy was published in the year of the first democratic elections in South Africa - 1994.

In Democracy you are the leader of a political party. All players try to increase their influence with partymembers and their assets such as business, news papers, TV etc. (75 influence cards). Some of the character- and asset-cards show guaranteed votes. The assets must be assigned to a character.
Players can trade their influence cards (assets) freely.

There are 120 event cards with positive and negative effects - so there is a lot of luck. These generate income, which is needed to pay some bad events or the travel-costs from region to region by car or plane, or have direct effects to your political reputation.

The partymembers travel throughout the country canvassing in the regions. Each region has a base resistance of 7. The influence of the canvassing partymember(s) + their assets + D6 must be greater to win the region. Players mark their regions with vote counters - each region is worth 1 vote.

An election is called - 2 ways:
- Automatically after all 50 regions are won, or
- A player can call for an election if he has one of 3 election-card (and only after a minimum of rounds are over, depending on number of players).
Than the last 5 rounds are played. In this "window period" nearly everything is allowed. Players can play special influence cards such as muckrakers, callgirls, third forces or assassins to "destroy" the political reputation or even kill the party leader. Hopefully he has (and can pay) bodyguards ...
Only in this period a player can take a region from another party.

Winning of the game - 2 ways:
- When all other party leaders are killed you win
- After the election, the player with the most votes wins.

name: Pizza Express
description:
The town's pizza bakers are well known for their delicious pizzas. To make sure they are freshly prepared, each pizza baker has installed a pizza oven in his delivery van. The customer receives the freshest pizza, baked hot and crispy right outside his front door.

The players are all pizza bakers with their own pizza oven express vans. The game board is a town "map" with roads, signal lights, barriers, one-way streets, supermarkets and six pizza customers.

Todays pizza customer is decided by throwing the die. A cute littel wodden house is placed on the location to identify where to deliver the pizza.
All the bakers then set off in their vans to deliver the pizza to the hungry customer. If you are the first to arrive at the customer's house, you will recieve moey for your pizza before a new customer shows up. To win the game you must be the fastes pizza baker three times.

It is a turn based game where you have two options each turn after having trown the dice: Drive in the direction of the pizza customer, or play a card.

The cards give the following possible actions:
- Switch trafic light from red to green or green to red.
- Open or close a barrier.
- Blocking a street in both directions
- Turning a steet into a one-way street.
- Move your opponent's van by the number thrown - usually in reverse.
- Request all players to visit a supermarket to stock up supplies before continuing to the customer.
- Cancel pizza order and throw the dice to decide who is the new pizza customer.

The number of cards are limited for each delivery round (3-5 depending of number of players), and not restocked untill a pizza is delivered.

A fast game about delicious pizzas and fast pizza bakers!

All parts made of wood.

name: Campaign Book #7: The War of Independence in the North
description: Presents information on the organization of the respective armies during the war, the Orders of Battle for several actions as well as some information on flags and standards of the period

name: Par Terre et Par Mer
description: Roll and move game with a travel theme published in France (1880 - 1900). Players visit exotic locations and world Capitals. Starting and ending in France.

name: Warhammer 40,000: Stronghold Assault
description:
Provided by Publisher:

Armoured bastions and towering bulwarks stand as imposing sentinels on almost every battleground in the 41st Millennium. To assault such fortifications is invariably to charge in the face of death, and only the most determined army has any hope of survival.

Warhammer 40,000: Stronghold Assault provides a plethora of background material and rules to turn any game of Warhammer 40,000 into full-blown siege warfare.

This 48-page, full colour, hardback supplement contains:

· New art, background, and timeline entries conveying the horror of siege warfare in the 41st Millennium.
· 17 fortifications datasheets for the full range of Warhammer 40,000 scenery that can be used by any Warhammer 40,000 army.
· Updated rules for buildings and fortifications for games of Warhammer 40,000.
· Additional rules for weapons and battlefield debris.
· Includes three new Siege War missions that can be played instead of the Eternal War missions in the Warhammer 40,000 rulebook.

You will need a copy of the Warhammer 40,000 rulebook and relevant codexes in order to use the contents of this book.
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: BrainBox: On the Farm
description:
From the publisher:
The object of the game is to win as many cards as possible in ten minutes. The first player takes a card from the Brainbox and turns the timer over. The player then has ten seconds to study the picture on the card. When the timer runs out the card is passed to player two and player one rolls the die to see which question is to be asked. The questions are on the reverse of the picture card. Player Two checks the answer by looking at the picture and if it is correct the card is given back to Player One to keep. If the answer is wrong the card is placed back into the Brainbox and the next player chooses a card. Please remember, the answer to the question is on the picture side of the card, so look carefully! The player with the most cards after ten minutes wins! If there is a tie, it's sudden death with both players choosing a card and having to answer all eight questions on the card. The player who answers the most correctly wins! For 1 player Look at the card as above for ten seconds. Then turn the card over and answer all the questions (use a pen and paper to record the answers). If all questions are answered correctly the card is kept. If any answers are incorrect, the card has to be put back in the Brainbox. See how many cards you have after five or ten minutes.
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Memory, Trivia
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move
publishers: Brainbox Games Pty Ltd, Green Board Game Co., KENSHO Kft., moses. Verlag GmbH

name: Wat zit daar achter?
description:
There is a castle with a lot of windows and behind every window there is someone or something to discover. Do you know where is who or what?

At the beginning of the game you place tiles in every window and study where is what. Then you cover every window with shutters.

You draw a tile that corresponds to one of the tiles behind the shutters. Do you remember where it was? The person who finds the most correct tiles wins.

name: BattleCON: Mark.PTO Promo Guest Character
description:
Mark.PTO is non-canonical. He is a guest character from the "Mark.PTO" comic by Fabio Fontes.

Mark's cards have secondary effects that let him break the fourth wall!

Originally available to backers of the Devastation of Indines Kickstarter Campaign.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting
mechanics: Hand Management, Simultaneous Action Selection, Variable Player Powers

name: Senkrecht-Starter
description:
Trivia game with a board. When played by individual players, each tries to reach the finish line by giving the right answers. There are some obstacles (risk) on a circuit where you can be thrown back when giving a wrong answer.

The more often you are finishing a circuit the higher the bonus you get at the ranking list.

It's going back and forth until someone manages to push the pawn on the ranking list over the finish line.
categories: Dice, Educational, Music, Party Game, Racing, Trivia

name: Hubertus St. Hubert: Zwei Jagdspiele
description:
There are two games on the two-sided game board:

1. Treibjagd: One player has 6 hunters and 14 hounds, the other 12 hares. The movements are determined by two dice. The hunters try to shot the hares or capure them with their hounds, the hares try to escape. The hunters win if they eliminate 6 hares. The hares win if 6 of them manage to escape to safe spaces.

2. Altes Jagdspiel: Two to five Players start at space 1 and try to be the first to arrive on space 79. Several spaces on the board have a hunting related special meaning which is explained in the game rules.

name: Braddock's Defeat: The Battle of Monongahela
description:
Braddock’s Defeat is a low complexity conflict simulation of the French and Indian War battle that ended the British expedition to capture French Fort Duquesne. Not an ambush, as is popularly thought, the battle was actually a meeting engagement. The French in Fort Duquesne, told by scouts that a large British force with guns was approaching, sent elements of the Duquesne garrison on a preemptive strike. The French force met the British vanguard column before they could set up an ambush.

Braddock’s Defeat is a two player game with each player taking the side of either the French or the British. Both players have allies to control: the British side American colonial and Indian units, the French side Canadian militia and Indian units.

Braddock’s Defeat also is highly suitable for solitaire play.

This game was issued as a separate game as a gift to Gold donors for the 2014 Consimworld Donation Drive.

name: Angel Chess
description:
Angel Chess is a Chess variant played on a 9 x 8 board, with an extra pawn and an "Angel" piece next to the King. The Angel combines the abilities of the Queen and Knight, and there are some special rules governing its use, otherwise the game's pieces are used in the same manner as Chess, and the game is won by checkmate of the opponent's King.

Is described in The Classified Encyclopedia of Chess Variants (Beasley-edited edition 2007).

name: Earth's Legacy
description:
When the wormhole opened up for the first time on the edge of the solar system, mankind was not ready. Governments scrambled to cobble together spaceships to investigate the anomaly, but it vanished as unexpectedly as it had first appeared.

Years later, the wormhole has returned and this time, we were prepared. Probe data shocked humanity when it revealed that a perfectly habitable planet lay on the other side, awaiting human colonization. A global effort was mounted and finally, the colony ship was ready for its maiden voyage. Built from whatever modular components were available, the ship left on its journey, carrying with it a crew of intrepid explorers, meager supplies and the hopes of planet Earth. Would they survive the expedition and start a new chapter in humanity's history on the mysterious planet?

Earth's Legacy is a co-operative, legacy, micro card game. Though the base game consists of very few components, the combination of player choice, random elements, and unique, persistent game modifications through an upgrade system, lead to a high level of replayability and expandability. The low complexity nature and minimal components of Earth's Legacy make it the perfect introduction to the legacy game genre that will appeal to gamers and non-gamers alike.
categories: Card Game, Science Fiction, Space Exploration, Travel
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Open Drafting, Tile Placement, Variable Player Powers

name: Tails and Tactics
description:
Created in October 2011, Tails and Tactics had been in development for almost two years before being released in July 2013. Creator Pedro “Reynard” Loustaunau first started with a very serious game concept and quickly found it to be lame. After realizing it needed a sillier tone, he quickly went from “a little bit lighthearted” to “quite a bit silly” as he realized Jan’s art would be perfect for his new vision of the game. Having found his ad in the programming schedule for Anthrocon 2011, Reynard contacted Jan with his crazy idea for him to become Lead Artist for the project. The ad pointed to Swords and Sausages (now Reynard’s favorite webcomic), which showcased Jan’s vibrant imagination and his talents as an artist.

Jan quickly became the Lead Artist for Tails and Tactics and development continued for almost two years before finally releasing at Anthrocon 2013. Thanks to the pledges of many wonderful people on IndieGoGo, Series 1 of Tails and Tactics became a reality.

Objective of the Game:
To win. Duh.
In order to do that, though, you must fight through your opponent's front line and attack his or her base enough to deplete its health to 0 - before they do so to you.
Each player begins the game with 30 Base Health. Base Health is lost when a unit controlled by an opposing player attacks your base (represented by you, the player). They may only do so, though, when you have no units on the field to defend with. If you do have units on the field that are able to defend, opponents must remove them before being able to attack your base directly.
1 base health is lost per attack, no matter how powerful (or weak) the attacking unit is. Some powerful units make up for this by having the ability to attack multiple times, so watch out!
Base health may also be lost when an opponent attacks one of your units and you choose to dodge the attack. Any dodged attacks will be applied directly to your base.
Once your opponent's base health reaches 0, you are victorious! Gloating and victory dances are acceptable at this point.
categories: Card Game, Comic Book / Strip, Wargame

name: Simulation Games for Beginner #2
description:
Published with three games in one box:

Decisive Battle of the Combined Fleet

"Decisive Battle the Combined Fleet" is a tactical level surface naval battle wargame in WW2 Pacific theater. Players control either the fleet of Imperial Japanese Navy or United States Navy, and fight each other. Players manage ships movement, gun and torpedo attack. This game was designed for wargame beginners.

F-16 Fighting Falcon

"F-16 Fighting Falcon" is a tactical level air combat wargame in modern warfare. This game covers only air to air combat, and does not include ground attack. Victory conditions vary by scenario. For example, shooting down enemy aircraft. This game was designed for wargame beginners.

Clash in the South Pacific

"Crash at Southern Pacific" is an operational level wargame for Battle of the Santa Cruz Island. Players control either the aircraft carrier fleet of Imperial Japanese Navy or United States Navy. Players manage fleet movement, search for the enemy, and aircraft operation. This game was designed for wargame beginners.
categories: Aviation / Flight, Modern Warfare, Nautical, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Secret Unit Deployment

name: Die Rheinreise
description:
"Die Rheinreise. Gesellschafts-Spiel für die Deutsche Jugend. Neue verbesserte Ausgabe" - The journey along the Rhine. Board game for the German youth. New and improved edition.

Object: be the first to reach target space crossing 100 numbered squares. Typical 'roll and move' game.
special: along your way to the target you'll pick up tools (umbrella, boat...) which make your race a bit easier/faster

Contents: 4-piece, color illustrated and designed with some black and white images cardboard and the center of the Rhine River in the stretch between Mainz and Cologne (34x69 cm); pawns of tin in an old painting (6 persons, 4 ships); 26 colorfully illustrated cards, 1 dice.

name: 12345ive!
description:
Two players advance their pieces across a grid of spots, according to a single rule of movement... which depends upon the number of pieces in a straight or ricocheted line. Groups of pieces may move in the direction of their axis up to a number of spaces equal to the number of pieces in that group.

The object is to move your pieces off the opposite end of the board first.

The playing surface is a fabric bag; the playing pieces are miscellaneous objects - drop them in the bag, roll it up, and snap it shut for easy carrying or storage.

name: The Khyber Ablaze: Uprisings and Punitive Expeditions on the North-West Frontier
description:
The Khyber Ablaze places the Player in command of the British Forces along the North-West Frontier and Afghanistan in the later part of the Victorian Era. You must use the forces available to you to put down a wave of uprisings, led by a fantatical Leader, that threaten to throw the British out of the region. If you liked movies like "Gunga Din", "The Brigand of Kandahar", "Flame over India" and "Lives of the Bengal Lancers", this game is for you.

OBJECTIVE: As the Commander of British Forces along the North-West Frontier, the Player must protect the British Settlements and defeat the Khan’s Forces by capturing three of their four Fortified Settlements of Samagan, Konduz, Herat and Kandahar before time runs out or the Khan’s Forces capture enough British Settlements to drive you Back to India.

GAME FEATURES: The game features a fun and simplistic method for resolving solitaire combat tactically, rules for Heroes that can make an impact on the outcome of battles, and lots of colorful game counters.

name: Y≈´gen
description:
Y≈´gen (yoo-gehn) is a fast, semi-casual game for 2 players, with each game about 20 to 30 minutes long. There's a bit of strategy and a bit of luck involved.

The players take turns drawing and placing tiles, triggering "pushes" and "pulls" on the old tiles, thus moving 3 "philosopher" figures along the board. The main goal is to push 2 philosophers out through your borders, but final scoring can be triggered in several ways.

name: On Seapower
description:
[publisher's description]

On Seapower (OS) is a card game of naval innovation in the period before the Great War (roughly 1875-1920). Players take the role of Great Britain, France, the United States, or Germany. Each nation must plan and execute the development of a fleet during peacetime, and then test its capabilities in a series of wartime Missions.

In the game, cards represent Ships, Technologies, Doctrines, Innovators, and Random Events. As the international Tension Level rises toward an inevitable War, players must make tradeoffs between building new ships using the best current technology, or investing in the development of more advanced weapons and platforms, to be built later.
categories: Card Game, Economic, Wargame, World War I

name: Im Fluge durch Deutschland, Oesterreich und die Schweiz
description:
Objective: be the first turning back to Berlin (space 70 - round trip)
- moving by turns -
A roll-and-move race game portraying an airship journey across three countries. The players face different hazards along their way (red marked spaces).

notes:
likely published (see aeroplanes) early 1920's
categories: Aviation / Flight, Children's Game, Dice, Educational, Racing, Travel
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Raid: Pirate's Plunder
description:
Take control of a 17th century pirate and roam the seven seas in search of booty. Compete against your fellow pirates to hunt and take down merchant ships of varying value in order to increase your overall wealth. The pirate with the most booty after all merchant ships have been captured becomes the most infamous pirate and wins the game.

The board is made up of hex tiles and can be set randomly or as agreed upon by all players. The majority of the hexes are open seas, but watch out for obstacles! Sea serpents, giant squid, super volcanoes, ship wrecks, and sand bars all stand in the way of you and your reward. Navigate through the obstacles by moving in only one direction each turn. Land on a hex on which a merchant ship lies to capture your booty. To secure your prize permanently, take the merchant ship to Black Bart's Lagoon. Be careful to avoid other pirates, as they can steal the ship before you get to Black Bart's Lagoon. The lagoon, along with the tavern, fortress, and port, are all special hex tiles that serve different purposes in the game. As you roam the seas, watch out for the navy! If the naval ship lands on the same hex as you, you are sent back to your home port.

Once a ship is brought to Black Bart's Lagoon and secured, you can either hold on to your booty or invest it in special equipment that could potentially help you commandeer additional ships. In the end, the player with the most cash in hand, not including special equipment, is the winner of the game.
mechanics: Modular Board, Pick-up and Deliver, Point to Point Movement

name: Five Little N***** Boys
description:
WARNING: This game is racist in both name and presentation, and is part of the BGG database for completeness

This is a target action game. Using a a rubber band gun and shooting that gun at a lithographed cardboard figure target of a man eating watermelon. The object is to hit the target. Most hits in whatever number of shots is mutually agreed on wins.

name: Treacherous Turf
description:
It's the year 2288, the world has gone through crisis after crisis but finally the economy has stabilised once again. The Duke, aka Lord Hogarth, has united the continent but gang warfare is keeping the capital from peace. The Duke has put out a 2 billion cash reward to the person who can take control and unite the gangs of the capital.

Whether you are are a local gang lord, a wealthy businessman or a local burger van guy that thinks he has what it takes, this is an opportunity that cannot be missed. Start recruiting from the local thuggery and make a name for yourself launching war on this treacherous turf!

Treacherous Turf is a card drafting combat game for 2 players. Each player draws a hand of seven cards, takes one and passes it on to the other player, until each player has a new hand of seven cards. Players then take turns to place these cards one at a time simultaneously onto one of three arenas. Once all seven cards have been played each arena is totaled, whoever has the most points on their side of the arena gets 1 point. After each arena has been totaled, the deck is shuffled and the drafting starts afresh. Play continues until one player reaches 5 points. If two players hit 5 points at the same time, another round continues until one player has more points than the other, revealing a clear winner.

name: Choose Your Crew: Pirates
description: Yaar! Anchors up! Here’s an exciting new card game that’s simple to learn and fun to play! Gather your crew of dastardly pirates to set sail before your opponents and win the game! Along the way you can sabotage their efforts with cannon fire, a bout of scurvy or incite mutiny in their midst! Convince more pirates to join your crew with spiced rum and treasure. Or even kidnap a crew member from a rival ship! If you have an abundance of Swabbies mopping the decks but not enough Gunners to man the cannons you can trade them across to a rival crew for someone more worthy of your ship. But beware you might not always get what you bargain for. After all, pirates are a deceitful lot!

name: Tri Bang
description:
Tri Bang is played on a 9x19 grid of squares, of which the outer rows and the long middle row are decorated. Each player is given 25 colored discs, each his own color, and takes turns placing the discs on any square of the board.

The object is to form three in a row, either beginning or ending on one of the decorated rows, but not with a middle piece of the three on a decorated row. Players call out "Tri Bang" when completing three in a row, and win the game. Players can also choose to continue playing, to see who can complete the most Tri Bangs before running out of pieces.

name: Super Moose
description:
Our super friendly moose has shed his antlers. Help him regrow new ones by adding one branch at a time. Be careful! If he tips over, you'll have to begin again.

Players take turns helping an adorable moose grow new antlers by stacking brightly colored wooden squiggles onto the rocking base. Just don't be the one to bring the whole thing crashing down!

name: Space Program
description:
Two nations dominate the space race, competing by building rockets, satellites and infrastructure with the aim of being first into space and beyond!

It is 1962 and in an alternate universe the Northern States Federation and Central European Social Republic vie for the domination of space. As President of one of these nations your scientists and engineers work tirelesly to produce blueprints for new rockets and infrastructure, submitting them to you for approval. You advance your space program by placing the blueprints into dossiers to be actioned.

To keep up with your opponent you will be forced to bluff about how advanced your space program is. But look out, enemy agents are always close at hand to reveal your plans, and your opponent is only a phonecall away from challenging your actions.


Space Program is an abstract card game for two players.

Each player starts with a stack of blueprint cards known as their drawing board. Each turn players play cards from their hand to the table.

Each card has two ways that it can be played. They can be laid down in a pyramid formation for their numerical value to score points, or for it's special ability. Players play their blueprint cards to the table to score the most points and can bluff about what they are playing and use the special abilities to switch the positions of the blueprints, use agent cards to reveal an opponent's cards, block an opponent's progress and more.

The pyramid is like a 'technology tree' where the lowest levels represent the infrastructure and the levels above represent your satellites, rockets and manned missions.

The game is played over three rounds and the winner is the player with the most points at the end of the game.

name: Megablitz!
description:
Subtitled: Rules for fighting large actions of the Second World War

From the game web site:"Megablitz is a set of operational-level wargames rules for 20th Century warfare. The main features of the rules are:

The playing pieces - model figures and vehicles mounted on stands - represent battalion-sized or regiment-sized units, depending upon the type of unit being represented. These units are allocated Strength Points (SP) which relate to each unit's type (e.g. Infantry, Cavalry, Armour), strength, equipment, and level of training. Strength Point markers are attached to the back of each stand, and are changed when the unit loses Strength Points as a result of combat.

The ground scale used is very large (1:25,000 in games using 20 mm scale figures and vehicles and 1:50,000 in games using 1:300th scale figures and vehicles).

The game moves represent two hours of actual time."

name: Coldwar:  1983
description:
ColdWar: 1983 is a set of skirmish wargame rules for section and platoon level battles between NATO and Warsaw Pact troops using 28mm scale miniatures and including the odd AFV (this is not the set of rules to fight the Battle of Fulda Gap!).

The rules can also be used for post-apocalyptic games where the Third World War has entered a stalemate period following some limited nuclear and chemical exchange (as in James Rouch’s The Zone series of books or GDW’s Twilight 2000 role-playing game), and for recreating some of the period conflicts involving regular troops such as the Falklands and Afghanistan.

name: Army Lists Book Three: Armies originating after 1000 AD
description: Collection of Army Lists for use with "War Games Rules 3000 BC to 1485 AD" also published by Wargames Research Group. Last of the 3 army list books at that point. Sixty additional armies are provided, numbering 121-180. The army list notes that about half of those armies listed in book two are applicable to the period covered in this list. These Army List specifically support the 6th Edition of the War Games Rules.

name: Babababa Burger
description:
In Babababa Burger, you are working in a busy burger shop. In order to fill the orders, you'll need to collect the ingredients for making the perfect burger for each customer that comes into the shop.

There are four decks of ingredients: a red deck that includes beef patties and fried eggs, a yellow deck that includes chicken nuggets and french fries, a blue deck that includes pickles and cheese, and a green deck that includes tomatoes and onions. All four decks also include buns. You start the game with two food preparation areas and a card from each deck. Three orders are turned up that can be filled. A fourth order is turned up on top of the deck, this is a future order that will become available when one of the current orders is filled. On your turn, you can play ingredients into your two food prep areas. Then you place your worker token next to one of the four decks. You draw two cards from that deck and place them under your token. These cards can be taken when it is your turn again. If someone also places their token next to the same deck, then you can take those cards at that time. If at the end of your turn you have more than four cards in your hand, you have to trash ingredients until you are down to four cards. Once cards are in the trash, you may also send your worker to get ingredients from the trash--with the added benefit that you get to choose which two cards from the trash you put under your token. The game continues until one of the decks is exhausted. Add up the total value of the orders each player has filled. The player with the highest value wins.
mechanics: Hand Management, Set Collection, Worker Placement

name: A Fistful of Kung Fu: Hong Kong Movie Wargame Rules
description:
A Fistful of Kung Fu is a small scale miniature skirmish game based on A Song of Blades and Heroes and designed to recreate the action of Hong Kong action movies.

Each player has a "Protagonist" and 5-14 "Extras" - which could be selected from the Police, Ninjas, Martial Artists, Yakusa, Triads and Tongs, Supernatural Creatures, animals, or Cyborgs lists provided in the book - or pretty much anything they can imagine.

On a player's turn models are activated individually and dice for action points. For each success the model can take an action. For each failure the enemy protagonist has a chance to react. If two failures are rolled the player's turn ends and passes to the other player.

From the publishers website:

A Fistful of Kung Fu brings the hyper-kinetic, bullet-spraying, demon-slaying, kung-fu-fighting action of Hong Kong movies and Asian cinema to the wargames tabletop. In a modern world walking a precarious line between the advances of next-generation technology and the tradition and mysticism of ancient cultures, Kung Fu schools face off in no-holds-barred tournaments, corporations hire agents and spies to steal each other's secrets, overworked SWAT teams respond to gunfights between feuding Triad and Yakuza clans, and ancient artefacts are sought by hopping vampires, demon sorcerers and cyborgs alike. Combining the gunfights of John Woo’s Hard Boiled, the hand-to-hand combat of Enter the Dragon, the sheer mystical weirdness of Big Trouble in Little China, the wuxia action of Crouching Tiger Hidden Dragon, and everything in-between, A Fistful of Kung Fu is a skirmish wargame unlike any other

name: Trilos
description:
Trilos is a game system featuring Triangular Dominoes (twenty-four Trilos and one Joker,) two playing boards, and two tile holders that include clips for tracking scores. Each Trilo has a number of pips along each side, one through nine, and has a white face on one side, black on the other. The spots on each side are the same, so that on one side the numbers run clockwise, the other anti-clockwise, which is indicated by an extra mark.

The rules describe these games for play with Trilos:

Dom Trilo – a game of drawing Trilos and matching them on a table, in an attempt to rid one's hand of any remaining tiles

Stones and Windows – two players match randomly drawn Trilos around the blank edges of the small board (a triangular grid of 10 triangles the same size as the Trilos.) The goal is to be the first to use all one's Trilos or, if reaching an unplayable position, to score the fewest points on remaining Trilos.

Rummy Trilo – three players draw seven Trilos and privately try to match a pattern drawn in the rulebook, taking turns swapping out pieces until someone completes the pattern.

Crazy Pavement – a more complicated version of Stones and Windows, with players trying to match pieces around the numbered sides of the small board, tracking several different ways to score points. When the game becomes unplayable, the score determines the winner.

Khuti – two players lay Trilos on the larger board (which features a grid of twenty-two triangles,) attempting to fill the board while outscoring each other.

Khefren – two players engage in a slightly less difficult version of the above game, Khuti.

Two Patience Games – there are two solitaire games included in the rules, Pyramid Patience and Trilex Patience.

Troulette – a game of chance utilizing a scoring board drawn in the rules and the Trilos pieces.

name: Patrol:  WWII
description:
Patrol: WWII is a fast playing man-to-man skirmish system that recreates squad patrols in any theatre of the Second World War with as little as ten miniatures per side and a 4'x4' play area. Individual games last from 15 minutes to 1 hour allowing for multiple exciting games in an evening's play.

Patrol takes you beyond line ‘em up and shoot ‘em down miniature gaming. Opposing squads draw one of the 20 missions offering a large variety of tactical challenges that reflect historical tactics and weapon effects.

Stats and weapons for American, Commonwealth, Soviet, German, Italian, Japanese, and Partisans forces are included. Additional appendix expands the game into the Korean War with new weapons and missions.

Monstrous tanks, zooming jeeps with 30 cal blazing, flame throwers and mortars raining death, along with random battlefield events, create a chaotic and dangerous battlefield where a realistic morale system recreates the reactions of soldiers and their squad leader's attempts to motivate them.

A complete campaign lets you keep the same squad over multiple games (if you can keep them alive). Survivors gain experience and skills, scrounge for weapons and gear, and try to get some sleep before drawing replacements and ammunition for the next patrol.
categories: Book, Miniatures, Modern Warfare, Wargame, World War II

name: Paved With [my...] Intentions
description:
Paved With [my...] Intentions is a quick card-drafting, story-telling, party game. You will mix and match sentence fragments, balancing the story you want to tell about yourself against building a winning score—then read your creation aloud and hope a high score overshadows a potentially embarrassing or frightening self-portrait.

The official goal is to produce a lineup of seven cards with the (absolute) greatest value, but most of a player's effort goes into putting together a story they'll be satisfied reading aloud to the group—and in the event of a tie or someone scoring exactly zero, the best story wins (by player voting).

The story chunks on the cards contain elements of comedy, horror, working in an office, sexuality, religion, new-age mysticism, dreams, nightmares, and more, and are frequently only a sentence or a fragment of a sentence, so it's unusual for any single theme to dominate even a single player's hand. Some cards, or combinations of cards, are explicit in their depiction of sex and violence, which will either put players off the game or push them to create the wildest stories possible.
